Show full description ‚ñº
**Description:** * Job Title: **Lifecycle Marketing Manager** ‚Äì ABC Carpet & Home Flagship Store, NYC * Location: New York City, NY * Position Type: Full-Time, On-Site Join Our Team at ABC Carpet & Home - Flagship, New York **ABC Carpet & Home 's Mission:** Known as the most iconic Home Design destination in New York, our mission is to bring our magic and colorful vision to the world through a unique and unparalleled curation of rugs, furniture and d√©cor. ABC Carpet & Home is a 150+ year old privately and family-owned company with an entrepreneurial culture. We are currently seeking a dedicated and experienced **Lifecycle Marketing Manager** to join our New York team. **The Opportunity:** We are a luxury home and carpet store seeking an experienced Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our team.¬†This person will be responsible for developing and optimizing multi-channel customer journeys to drive engagement, retention, and revenue throughout the customer lifecycle. This role will own the strategy and execution of programs across email, SMS, direct mail, and other channels, using data-driven insights to deliver personalized experiences at scale.They should be comfortable implementing brand strategies, marketing plans, and project management for all marketing initiatives, and working cross-functionally to execute these strategies. This is a full-time position in office. **Key Responsibilities:** * Drive strong email and SMS campaigns to acquire and retain customers across our product portfolio * Spearhead all new marketing product launches to drive repeat and new revenue * Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure consistency in brand-related decisions * Analyze and report on brand performance across channels, including but not limited to: direct mail, email, SMS * Monitor market and consumer trends within the interior design and home space * Project management for all marketing projects, serving as the glue between dev, merchandising, and ecomm teams **Qualifications:** * Bachelor's degree * 3-6+ years of experience in lifecycle, retention, or CRM marketing, preferably in a direct-to-consumer or ecommerce environment. * Proven success managing customer journeys and automated campaigns across digital channels. * Strong analytical mindset; comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights. * Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools. * Excellent project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives. * Strong copywriting skills and a keen eye for creative and brand voice. * Passionate about customer experience, personalization, and performance marketing. * Experience in home furnishings or interior design is preferred but not required * Experience working in: Klaviyo, Attentive, Google Analytics, Shopify, Asana a plus. **Compensation Details:** Starting Salary: We offer a competitive salary ranging from $90,000 to $110,000, depending on your experience and qualifications. Our commitment to equitable pay means we regularly adjust our ranges to stay compliant with state and local laws, ensuring our team members are rewarded fairly for their expertise and dedication.

Lifecycle Marketing Manager:We are a luxury home and carpet store seeking an experienced Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our team.¬† This person will be responsible for developingand optimizing multi-channel customer journeys to drive engagement, retention, and revenue throughout the customer lifecycle. This role will own the strategy and execution of programs across email, SMS, direct mail, and other channels, using data-driven insights to deliver personalized experiences at scale.They should be comfortable implementing brand strategies, marketing plans, and project management for all marketing initiatives, and working cross-functionally to execute these strategies. This is a full-time position in office.Responsibilities:-Drive strong email and SMS campaigns to acquire and retain customers across our product portfolio-Spearhead all new marketing product launches to drive repeat and new revenue-Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure consistency in brand-related decisions-Analyze and report on brand performance across channels, including but not limited to: direct mail, email, SMS-Monitor market and consumer trends within the interior design and home space-Project management for all marketing projects, serving as the glue between dev, merchandising, and ecomm teams.Qualifications:-Bachelor's degree-3-6+ years of experience in lifecycle, retention, or CRM marketing, preferably in a direct-to-consumer or ecommerce environment.-Proven success managing customer journeys and automated campaigns across digital channels.-Strong analytical mindset; comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights.-Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools.-Excellent project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.-Strong copywriting skills and a keen eye for creative and brand voice.-Passionate about customer experience, personalization, and performance marketing.-Experience in home furnishings or interior design is preferred but not required-Experience working in: Klaviyo, Attentive, Google Analytics, Shopify, Asana a plus.We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.
Marketing Associate
linkedin New York City (United States) Tue, 28 Ja N/A
About Usabc carpet & home is the most iconic luxury home design destination in New York City, enchanting shoppers with its unique, unrivaled high-end rug offering, paired with its expertly curated sel...
Show full description ‚ñº
About Usabc carpet & home is the most iconic luxury home design destination in New York City, enchanting shoppers with its unique, unrivaled high-end rug offering, paired with its expertly curated selection of artisan decor and furniture pieces sourced across the globe. abc is not only the place where home decor enthusiasts come to discover one-of-a-kind finds, but more so an otherworldly space igniting the customer‚Äôs inspiration to bring magic home.What started in the late nineteenth century as a pushcart business selling carpets has become one of the largest and most diverse rug and home collections in the world. We look to nature and the world to create a meaningful curation that focuses on quality, craftsmanship, and uniqueness to tell a handmade story. Our actions are always in the pursuit of magic.Job DescriptionWe are looking for a creative and analytical Marketing Associate to join our team. You will be responsible for helping own both paid and organic channels including social/search, influencer/affiliate, lifecycle (email + sms), organic social (Pinterest, Instagram, TikTok) and events + brand partnerships. To understand channel performance you will work closely with the Senior Marketing Manager and Senior Director of Growth for weekly, monthly, and yearly reporting. You should feel comfortable working cross-functionally to execute these strategies and ensure brand consistency. This role will be joining a passionate team of four: VP of Marketing, Senior Director of Growth, Senior Marketing Manager and a graphic designer. This is a full-time position in our office in NYC. This role will report directly to the Senior Marketing Manager.ResponsibilitiesManage organic social channels including Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, and LinkedIn, and spearheading the launch of net-new channels like TikTok and YouTubeDevelop channel specific strategies, monitor ongoing performance, and translate anecdotal, qualitative, and quantitative findings to inform future efforts. Integrate channel strategies across organic and influencer strategiesConcept, develop, and deploy creative content for each channel, working closely cross-departmentally (Marketing, Editorial, PR) to ensure cohesive and engaging messagingResearch emerging trends, opportunities, and partners that will enhance our social media activity and brand presence in a meaningful wayManage marketing execution and logistics for marketing loans/gifts for PR, Editorial/Media, Influencer and other marketing needsExecute retention marketing strategies across email and SMS by thinking creatively about how to market new arrivals, best sellers and spearhead cross-selling/upselling opportunitiesManage and own influencer/affiliate marketing sourcing, strategy, execution and reportingAssist in event and partnership logistical execution to bring the magic of our brand to life and to our customersOwn weekly reporting of organic social + lifecycle channels to share learnings and insights with the full marketing team, ecomm team, and abc leadership teams.QualificationsMinimum 1-3 years of work experience within marketing, pr, advertising or a relevant field.Digital Marketing Experience preferred.Creative and content marketing skills required.Experience in retail/luxury is a plus, not required.Exceptional writing and communication skills, impeccable attention to detail.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and Google Analytics is a plus.BenefitsAbility to join a heritage brand with an entrepreneurial/start-up feelGenerous employee discountMedical, dental, and vision health care insurance

Show full description ‚ñº
Alfred Williams & Company is seeking an **Account Manager** focused on Business Development to drive growth through proactive outreach, relationship building and exceptional client service. You‚Äôll develop new opportunities, expand existing accounts and partner closely with design, project management and customer administration to deliver outstanding workplace solutions. **Responsibilities** * Identify, qualify and close new business opportunities. * Understand client goals and align solutions to business objectives. * Proactively build and maintain a strong network (A+D firms, commercial real estate, brokers, end users, etc.). * Own relationships with clients while serving as the primary point of contact. * Manage day-to-day account needs and advocate for the customer throughout the project lifecycle. * Lead internal and external meetings, clearly articulate scope, priorities and next steps. * Coordinate with internal partners (Designer, Project Manager, Project Coordinator) to ensure quality delivery. * Oversee project timelines, budgets, and change management; escalate risks early. * Consistently exceed client expectations and add value to strategic and creative conversations. * Track pipeline activity, forecasts, and progress toward goals. **Qualifications** * **2+ years** of relevant experience in commercial furniture, Design, real estate or construction industries. * Strong written and verbal communication skills; confident presenter and facilitator. * Self-starter who is proactive, flexible, and comfortable managing multiple projects and deadlines. * Excellent prioritization, organization, and follow-through. * Familiarity with proposals, budgeting and basic contract terms. * Capable of reading and understanding floorplans, AutoCAD, etc. * Knowledge of the A+D community, commercial real estate ecosystem and project delivery process.

Join Our Team as Director of Sales!Are you ready to make a lasting impact in the workspace solutions industry? Alfred Williams & Company is seeking a dynamic and strategic Director of Sales to lead our San Antonio market. As a member of MillerKnoll‚Äôs Certified Dealer Network, we are dedicated to delivering exceptional service across North America, with nearly 50 dealer partners operating in over 240 locations. By joining our team, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in creating inspiring spaces that drive success for our clients, offering them a seamless experience from project start to finish. If you‚Äôre passionate about client relationships, strategic growth and fostering innovation in workspace solutions, we‚Äôd love to connect with you.Position OverviewThe Director of Sales for the San Antonio, TX market will lead the development and execution of strategic sales initiatives to drive revenue growth and strengthen Alfred Williams & Company‚Äôs presence in the region. This role is responsible for building relationships with clients, identifying market opportunities, and aligning our services with customer needs. The Director of Sales will work closely with the Regional President to shape and implement market-specific sales strategies, ensuring alignment with Alfred Williams & Company‚Äôs mission, values, and commitment to exceptional service.Key ResponsibilitiesSales Strategy & Execution: Develop and implement a comprehensive sales strategy for the San Antonio market, aligned with company objectives and growth targets.Client Relationship Management: Establish and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients to support their design, workspace, and sustainability goals.Market Development: Identify and pursue new business opportunities, positioning Alfred Williams & Company as the preferred partner for workspace solutions.Performance Tracking: Utilize metrics and client feedback to continuously improve service quality and exceed client expectations.Community Engagement: Represent Alfred Williams & Company within the local community, supporting our values and commitment to sustainability and social responsibility.Sales Team Development: Training, goal setting, performance management, recruitment, motivation, and strategy execution to drive team success.Proven experience in sales leadership within the furniture, design, or similar industries, with a track record of driving growth.Strong relationship-building skills and a customer-centric approach.Strategic mindset with the ability to execute against both short-term goals and long-term objectives.Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.

We are looking for energetic, customer-service forward, and determined salespeople at our Gilbert team! Individuals with prior experience customer facing furniture sales arehighlyencouraged to apply.As an AFW Sales consultant, you will be advising and guiding customers and assisting in the selection of home furnishings and accessories for their homes. At AFW, we offer our customers a low-pressure, professional shopping experience. You use basic selling skills to guide the customer through our showrooms selecting furniture and home d√©cor products helping them create something fresh and new in their homes.The best candidate wants to be part of continuing our mission of providing our customers with the greatest values in home furnishings and accessories. The ultimate goal at AFW is to take care of our customers.We provide paid training for all Home Furnishings Consultants. Training period (typically 3-6 weeks) will earn $17/hour. Once completed, home furnishing consultants will earn wages based on their commissioned sales with a guaranteed weekly pay of $860. Draw rate is $21.54. Up to $90,000/year!What to expect as a Consultant:No Pressure Sales EnvironmentHonest SellingOpportunity to make good moneyWe do not sell extended warranties, snake oil, etcWe make it fun!We offer pleasant shopping experiencesBest prices and best values anywhereGreat shopper traffic & repeat customers that love us!Relax and help customers build their dream roomsOur visual design teams stay on top of the latest trends & support youJob RequirementsWillingness to learn about the industry, the products, and the customersMaintain a professional appearance and follow the dress guidelines.Attend daily meetings and required training.Have a flexible schedule and work all shifts, which include weekends, evenings, and holidays.Follow the guidelines set forth in the AFW Code of Conduct for Home Furnishings Consultants.Assist in the maintaining of the showroom including daily cleaning, vacuuming, and tagging.Adhere to the AFW asset protection policies in helping to identify and prevent fraud.Coordinate and work effectively with multiple departments to continuously improve processes, maximize efficiency, and exceed customer service expectations.Ability to learn and apply new technologies including tablets, iPads, and basic computer knowledge.Job ExpectationsDemonstrate a customer-first mindset and be accessible to ensure every customer has a great shopping experience.Connect with customers by asking open-ended questions to assess needs and make relevant merchandise suggestions.Educate customers on our products, policies, and events.Commitment to AFW‚Äôs safety policies and proceduresCapable of walking the show floor to ensure customers are being assisted.Speak knowledgeably and confidently to customers about styles, fit, fabrics, price, and trends in home furnishings.Experienced in meeting high customer expectations.Have a Do It Right the First-Time mentality.Detail-oriented with strong follow-up and follow-through skills.Possess excellent time management abilities.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Understand website navigation and point of sales systems to proactively leverage technology to facilitate the overall customer experience.Physical RequirementsAbility to move up to 25 lbs. in weight to maintain the flow of merchandise.Requires the ability to maneuver in confined and sometimes congested spaces.Requires the ability to sit, stand, walk, stoop, and bend for 8 hours or more daily.Requires constant use of arms, hands, fingers, eyes, legs, and back.The Home Furnishings Consultant position requires lifting, gripping, bending, kneeling, and stooping to demonstrate features of merchandise for customer satisfaction.AFW BenefitsWeekly payLow Deductibles on Medical Plans.Great coverage for dental & vision.A wide selection of voluntary benefits401(k) and 401(k) Roth Retirement Savings Plan Perks.A variety of paid time off optionsA pre-employment drug screen and pre-employment background check must be passed upon job offer.American Furniture Warehouse provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national Show full description ‚ñº
About Us: Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home d√©cor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe. Role Summary: **This is a 12 month FTC and we are looking for a start date of March/beginning of April** As Digital Merchandising & Production Manager, you‚Äôll lead the visual merchandising and digital content strategy across our e-commerce platform. Acting as the bridge between trading, buying, marketing, and tech teams, you‚Äôll oversee the execution of homepage, category, and product pages to reflect commercial priorities and brand goals. You‚Äôll also drive product activation, manage the digital product pipeline, and champion SEO and content enhancements to elevate the customer journey. With a strong grasp of systems and a proactive approach to system optimisations, you‚Äôll play a key role in shaping the future of our digital experience. You will be managing and supporting a team. What You'll Be Doing: Merchandising & Site Content * Own & deliver on visual site merchandising strategy * Owns all content on site, ensuring engaging and inspiring to support customer discoverability * Works closely with Trade on successful execution of site strategy across page optimisations, content callouts, filters, category structure, page merchandising and other site changes to support product discoverability & CVR. * Oversees execution of homepage & other content pages and ensure they reflect trading priorities and CVR optimisations alongside brand goals * Liaison between buying, marketing to ensure campaign launch ready (site, product, links..) Tech & System Optimisations * Champion tech roadmap optimisations & a go between tech and the business * Reports tech issues & liaises with tech on issues & opportunities * Systems expert & seeks opportunities to improve processes Product Activation * Plan & oversee product launches across the website * Manages the digital product pipeline and ensures accurate, timely product uploads in coordination with Buying and Planning. * Owns product attribution, SEO tagging, and content optimization (e.g., product descriptions, imagery, styling). * Identifies and resolves product & content gaps to support conversion and improve the customer journey What You'll Need: * A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you‚Äôre someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm * Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a sharp eye for emerging talent and unique opportunities * Management experience * Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations * A people-first attitude and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally * Super-organised whilst still being flexible, with the ability to juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure * Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite * Familiarity with performance-tracking tools essential, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms (i.e. Dash Social, GRIN, Plot) * Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand The Perks: * Work-life balance: * Flexible start and finish times * Bring your dog to work * Wellbeing: * Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health * Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym memberships * Private Medical Insurance * Employee Discount: * Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands * Community: * One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice * Travel: * Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan * Continued Development: * We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development #AnthroEU Equal Opportunity Statement: URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Show full description ‚ñº
Anthropologie is looking for an Influencer Marketing Coordinator. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator will support the day-to-day of the Anthropologie influencer marketing team. This person will report to the Influencer Marketing Associate and partner with Anthropologie‚Äôs crossfunctional teams to support the execution of the Anthropologie, AnthroLiving and BHLDN influencer campaigns and giftings. **Role Responsibilities** * Assist in management of Influencer campaigns for Anthropologie , AnthroLiving and AnthroWeddings. Including but not limited to: + Expand Anthropologie brand awareness by staying up-to-date on up-and-coming influencers excelling in reach and engagement KPIs as well as brand relevant content to test within Anthropologie campaigns + Assist in the curation of face sheets, cast scouting for campaigns and contracts + Manage campaign timelines and coordination of campaign launch from following up of content concepts, placing product orders, managing content deadlines, initial content approvals, tracking live content and reporting + Ensure that product selections adhere to campaign concept and brief parameters prior to placing orders as well as site availability. When orders are placed, manage all steps inclusive of order tracking & resolving order issues + Curate product SKU lists to pass off to web dev. team for anthropologie.com linking purposes and create UTMs to provide Influencers for content + Capture live content inclusive of IG Stories and ensuring all deliverable obligations are met and track all content on monday.com + Ensure social teams are supporting live influencer content via community management + Coordinate with digital team on content available for paid social needs and assist in whitelisting strategy by ensuring branded content tool is utilized + Assist in ambassador initiatives including but not limited to: campaign launch process, bonus campaigns, collecting reviews, outfitting program coordination, co-op campaigns * Manage regular pulse of influencer giftings process including but not limited to: + Recommending key product gifting opportunities during key calendar moments + Coordinate with art team on asset needs: packaging, card inserts, handwritten notes + Coordinate with digital teams on landing page experiences, UTMs, QR codes, etc. + Coordinate with product teams to curate a personalized gifting product selection that relates to story/brand message being told via gifting + Place gifting product orders and manage gifting package process inclusive of sending gifts and coordinate tracking + Coordinate entire process of opportunistic influencer giftings + Assist in execution of the celebrity home giftings program including but not limited to order placements, inventory checking, landing page coordination, recapping * Experiences and Events: + Assist in casting for Anthropologie brand events and experiences + Partner with cross functional teams on invitation assets, casting expectations, casting approvals and product orders + Manage outfitting process for influencer attendees * Budget: + Assist in Influencer budget coordination in a timely manner including: + Invoice submission assistance + Monthly finance tracker and trial balance completion * Recapping: + Ensure all influencer partners are verified on Creator IQ to accurately pull performance + Partner with Influencer Associate on pulling together performance metrics to create actionable takeaways and recapping for campaigns + Outreach to gifting recipients or event attendees for their account reporting if deliverables aren‚Äôt required + Responsible for recapping and reporting on content for all giftings and events **Role Qualifications** * Minimum 1+ years influencer management experience desired * Obtained Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or related field * A charismatic and proactive style of communication desired for external communication * Strong organization skills inclusive of building timelines and tracking weekly and daily product orders and able to work on a variety of projects at one time in a fast-paced environment * Strong writing and communication skills Anthropologie is looking for a Senior Graphic Designer for the Art Department. The main objective of the senior designer‚Äôs role is to assist and lead on concept, design, implementation of our exclusive own brands‚ÄîBrand identity management and standards, label and product packaging for apparel, accessories and home products, GWPs, store signage and event/influencer collateral. **Role Responsibilities**Responsibilities include assisting in the creative, production & management of: * Seasonal retail & direct packaging * Printed brand collateral & digital assets * Product Packaging: Own brand packaging of wide-range of products ‚Äî home, textile, beauty, gift * Brand programs ‚Äî branding and collateral * Campaign & seasonal assets * Communication: home office, store, direct * SubBrands ‚Äî creative & management of labels, hangtags, messaging & packaging of both apparel and home products **Role Qualifications** * Bachelor degree in discipline related to functional work or role with 6+ years of relevant work experience OR demonstrated ability to meet the job requirements through a comparable number of years of applicable work experience. * Packaging and branding experience highly preferred. * Experience with Adobe Suite, Basecamp, Monday as well as Microsoft Office * Knowledge of traditional and digital printing processes, color separations and vendor ready art and die-line files. * Exceptional written and verbal communication skills: Must be able to communicate the business needs and objectives effectively via email and in meetings. #Anthropologie #EC-LI1 **The Perks**URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Anthropologie Sales Associate - Islington, London
indeed Islington (United Kingdom) Sun, 26 Oc N/A

Show full description ‚ñº
Location: This position is located at 126-127 Upper St, Islington, , N11QP United Kingdom Role Summary: Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company. What You'll Be Doing: **Customer Experience:** * Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valued * Selling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestions * Omni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in store **Teamwork & Communication:** * Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help others * Share Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customer * Employee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journal * Insights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store Leadership **Visual & Business Operations:** * Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚Äôs * Product Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floor * Store Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updates **Merchandising & Display:** * Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standards * Is knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messaging * Has an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience. What You'll Need: * Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must. * An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market. * Strong communication skills. The Perks: **Work Life Balance:** * ‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlement **Wellbeing:** * Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health * Discount off external gym memberships * Private Medical Insurance for eligible employees **Employee Discounts:** * Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN Brands **Travel:** * Season ticket loan for eligible employees * Cycle to work scheme for eligible employees **Continued Development:** * We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development #AnthroEU #LI-AA1 Equal Opportunity Statement: URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.
Anthropologie - Digital Marketing Manager
indeed London (United Kingdom) Sat, 18 Oc N/A
About Us: Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which n...
Show full description ‚ñº
About Us: Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home d√©cor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe. Role Summary: We are looking for a highly skilled Digital Marketing Manager with a proven track record of driving growth across Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Affiliates and SEO in the UK and wider European markets. This is a pivotal role within the business for improving ROAS and growing all digital marketing channels in line with business goals. What You'll Be Doing: * Supporting the Head of Digital Marketing in the development, management and execution of the Anthropologie EU digital marketing strategy * Management of external digital marketing agencies, ensuring delivery of channel strategy and performance through challenging partners on performance & areas for opportunities * Support the Head of Digital Marketing with forecasting channel traffic, demand, spend and efficiency * Manage daily, weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reporting to deliver growth across marketing channels and strategic priorities * Deliver on clear investment targets across paid channels, ensuring spend & efficiency is aligned to forecasts * Through analysis, seek opportunities to drive growth & optimise performance across marketing channels * Manage in-house paid social marketing, through ad planning, optimised investment and review of ad performance. * Partner with the organic social team on the paid social strategy and cross-funnel budget * Manage the marketing feeds and work with agency on optimisations * Manage Affiliate tenancy and commission opportunities, in line with our marketing calendar * Work closely with the online trading, brand marketing and buying teams to ensure ads and product focuses are aligned with business priorities and trends * Partner with the ecommerce trading and web production team on SEO recommendations and optimisations * Management of the Digital Marketing Assistant * Identify and driver opportunities to grow Digital Marketing channels through new vendors and projects * Attend weekly, monthly and ad hoc trade meetings, presenting trade and highlighting opportunities to further grow the business What You'll Need: * Project management experience * Confident in all areas of online marketing, with experience in managing multiple activities. * A confident communicator and willing to influencer through best practice and ROAS * Ability to analyse marketing campaigns and present strategies based on results * Strong leadership skills and experience with managing a team * Ability to multi-task and delegate * Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders The Perks: * Work-life balance: * Flexible start and finish times * Bring your dog to work * Wellbeing: * Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health * Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount off external gym memberships * Private Medical Insurance * Employee Discount: * Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands * Community: * One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice * Travel: * Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan * Continued Development: * We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development #AnthroEU Equal Opportunity Statement: URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe. Role Summary: We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Digital Marketing Executive to join our Ecommerce team to support driving the growth of EU customer acquisition across Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Affiliates and SEO. What You'll Be Doing: * Supporting the Head of Digital Marketing in the execution of the Anthropologie EU digital marketing strategy * Producing weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reporting to deliver growth across marketing channels and strategic priorities * Through analysis, seek opportunities to drive growth & optimise performance across marketing channels * Manage the digital marketing agencies, aligning & guiding them on opportunities to deliver performance * Manage in-house paid social marketing, through ad planning, optimised investment and review of ad performance * Support on delivering clear investment targets across paid channels, ensuring spend & efficiency is aligned to forecasts * Work closely with the online trading, brand marketing and buying teams to ensure ads and product focuses are aligned with business priorities * Plan and book promotional activity across key affiliates in line with our marketing calendar * Partner with the ecommerce trading and web production team on any SEO recommendations and optimisations * Management of the Digital Marketing Assistant * Monitor the marketplace and competitors, keeping the business informed of industry initiatives and key developments What You'll Need: * Project management experience * Confident in all areas of online marketing, with experience in managing multiple activities. * A confident communicator and willing to influence through best practice and ROAS * Ability to analyse marketing campaigns and present strategies based on results * Excellent attention to detail * Willingness to learn and ability to pick up new skills quickly The Perks: * Work-life balance: * Flexible start and finish times * Bring your dog to work * Wellbeing: * Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health * Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount off external gym memberships * Private Medical Insurance * Employee Discount: * Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands * Community: * One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice * Travel: * Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan * Continued Development: * We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development #AnthroEU Equal Opportunity Statement: URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Anthropologie Influencer Marketing Coordinator
linkedin Philadelphia (United States) Mon, 06 Oc N/A

Show full description ‚ñº
Anthropologie is looking for an Influencer Marketing Coordinator. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator will support the day-to-day of the Anthropologie influencer marketing team. This person will report to the Influencer Marketing Associate and partner with Anthropologie‚Äôs crossfunctional teams to support the execution of the Anthropologie, AnthroLiving and BHLDN influencer campaigns and giftings. **Role Responsibilities** * Assist in management of Influencer campaigns for Anthropologie , AnthroLiving and AnthroWeddings. Including but not limited to: + Expand Anthropologie brand awareness by staying up-to-date on up-and-coming influencers excelling in reach and engagement KPIs as well as brand relevant content to test within Anthropologie campaigns + Assist in the curation of face sheets, cast scouting for campaigns and contracts + Manage campaign timelines and coordination of campaign launch from following up of content concepts, placing product orders, managing content deadlines, initial content approvals, tracking live content and reporting + Ensure that product selections adhere to campaign concept and brief parameters prior to placing orders as well as site availability. When orders are placed, manage all steps inclusive of order tracking & resolving order issues + Curate product SKU lists to pass off to web dev. team for anthropologie.com linking purposes and create UTMs to provide Influencers for content + Capture live content inclusive of IG Stories and ensuring all deliverable obligations are met and track all content on monday.com + Ensure social teams are supporting live influencer content via community management + Coordinate with digital team on content available for paid social needs and assist in whitelisting strategy by ensuring branded content tool is utilized + Assist in ambassador initiatives including but not limited to: campaign launch process, bonus campaigns, collecting reviews, outfitting program coordination, co-op campaigns * Manage regular pulse of influencer giftings process including but not limited to: + Recommending key product gifting opportunities during key calendar moments + Coordinate with art team on asset needs: packaging, card inserts, handwritten notes + Coordinate with digital teams on landing page experiences, UTMs, QR codes, etc. + Coordinate with product teams to curate a personalized gifting product selection that relates to story/brand message being told via gifting + Place gifting product orders and manage gifting package process inclusive of sending gifts and coordinate tracking + Coordinate entire process of opportunistic influencer giftings + Assist in execution of the celebrity home giftings program including but not limited to order placements, inventory checking, landing page coordination, recapping * Experiences and Events: + Assist in casting for Anthropologie brand events and experiences + Partner with cross functional teams on invitation assets, casting expectations, casting approvals and product orders + Manage outfitting process for influencer attendees * Budget: + Assist in Influencer budget coordination in a timely manner including: + Invoice submission assistance + Monthly finance tracker and trial balance completion * Recapping: + Ensure all influencer partners are verified on Creator IQ to accurately pull performance + Partner with Influencer Associate on pulling together performance metrics to create actionable takeaways and recapping for campaigns + Outreach to gifting recipients or event attendees for their account reporting if deliverables aren‚Äôt required + Responsible for recapping and reporting on content for all giftings and events **Role Qualifications** * 1+ years influencer management and/or social media experience desired * A charismatic and proactive style of communication desired for external communication * Strong organization skills inclusive of building timelines and tracking weekly and daily product orders and able to work on a variety of projects at one time in a fast-paced environment * Strong writing and communication skills #Anthropologie **The Perks**URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefits **EEO Statement**URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Anthropologie - Marketing Planning Manager (12 Month FTC)
indeed London (United Kingdom) Thu, 11 Se N/A
About Us: Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which n...
Show full description ‚ñº
About Us: Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home d√©cor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe. Role Summary: As Marketing Planning Manager, you‚Äôll play a key role in leading Anthropologie‚Äôs brand campaign planning across Europe, with a particular focus on 360 marketing campaigns, retail and trade marketing and project management. Supporting teams across Brand Marketing, Creative, Digital Marketing and Retail, you will lead the planning and delivery of standout omni-channel campaigns activated across in-store, owned, earned and paid channels. You‚Äôll also set-up efficient ways of working and communicating across department and be a key marketing contact across the business. What You'll Be Doing: *Campaign Project Management:* * Take the lead on marketing campaigns and activations, project managing from concept to delivery, working with Brand & Creative, Digital, Product and Retail teams to scope requirements, plan deliverables, manage budgets and deliver campaigns on time * Own the brand marketing calendar, working closely with US & EU colleagues to align global campaign messaging amplification, and identify and communicate EU-only messages * Support the Brand Executive on campaign briefing, ensuring cross-departmental briefs are clear and completed by all departments * Track creative and channel deliverables using project management tools, keeping stakeholders updated on key milestones and actions * Lead post-campaign reporting and analysis, creating weekly, monthly and quarterly tracking against key metrics, working across teams to collate and present results and learnings to wider teams *Retail & Trade Marketing:* * Assist the Senior Brand Marketing Manager to brief and deliver all in-store POS * Contribute to the successful launch and ongoing marketing of new Anthropologie stores, helping to develop opening plans and overseeing execution of planned activity * Work with Retail and Digital teams to plan promotional messaging into the marketing calendar, capture Creative requirements and brief Creative teams *Planning Processes:* * Create ongoing efficiencies and review ways of working across teams to more effectively plan and manage marketing processes and communication * Input into monthly and campaign Budget planning and tracking alongside Brand, Influencer, Social, and PR teams, reviewing regularly with the Marketing Director and Finance team * Own regular planning meetings, campaign kick-offs & channel alignments, and support channel teams on their planning * Onboard Brand & Creative teams onto a new project management tool, and set up campaign planning functionality What You'll Need: * A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you‚Äôre someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm * Experience in Marketing Project Management or Brand Marketing ideally in Retail (either in-house or agency) with a strong knowledge of 360 campaign planning processes and deliverables * Demonstrable experience in planning and delivering 360 brand awareness and performance-driven campaigns, partnerships, and experiential activations * Highly-organised with strong planning and process optimisation skills, and the ability to be flexible, juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure * Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations * Excellent written and verbal communication skills * Confident at communicating with senior stakeholders and with across global teams, and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally * Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Google and Microsoft office tools, as well as project planning tools such as Asana, Trello and Figma * Strong understanding of performance and results tracking, and familiarity with performance-tracking tools, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms * Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand * Ability to recognise and ensure activations are on-brand and of the high creative standard our customers expect of Anthropologie, aligning with the global brand identity The Perks: Work-life balance: * Flexible start and finish times * Bring your dog to work Wellbeing: * Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health * Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym memberships * Private Medical Insurance Employee Discount: * Up to 40% off at **all URBN Brands!** Community: * One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice Travel: * Cycle to work scheme * Season ticket loan Continued Development: * We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development #AnthroEU #LI-SW1 Equal Opportunity Statement: URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-AA1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Location:This position is located at 31-33 Market Hill, Cambridge, , CB23NU United Kingdom Role Summary:Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-TS1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Role Summary:Anthropologie is looking for a creative, enthusiastic and dedicated individual to play a key role in content management for Anthropologie.com. The Temporary Digital Content Coordinator po...
Show full description ‚ñº
Role Summary:Anthropologie is looking for a creative, enthusiastic and dedicated individual to play a key role in content management for Anthropologie.com. The Temporary Digital Content Coordinator position will be responsible for a variety of tasks working directly with multiple teams across the organization, including UX/UI, Marketing, Merchandising, Design, Copywriting and Customer Service Operations teams.The position will work within the technical framework of a catalog and content management system but will not be directly responsible for the configuration or development of this system.Role Responsibilities:Upload, validate, and maintain content on the Anthropologie.com website and iOS app within a Content Management SystemAssist with the coding, set-up, and QA of daily and email marketing campaigns, plus events and surveys as neededWork collaboratively with Merchandising, Design, Copy, Digital and Brand Marketing, Analytics and Testing, UX/UI to deliver brand-appropriate content and messagingIdentify and troubleshoot/resolve issues before they go out to the customer; if unresolvable, relay issues to the appropriate teams for further investigation ‚Äì follow-through until resolution is vitalRole Qualifications:Competency with a content management systemPrior experience with email marketing software is a plusExperienced in writing HTML and CSS; familiarity with JavaScript is a plusFamiliar with digital design, asset creation, and knowledge of Adobe SuiteTechnically savvy and able to learn new concepts and software applications quicklyAbility to answer questions technical questions and troubleshoot problemsStrong ability for multi-tasking and working independentlyExceptional organization, communication, and time-management skillsAbility to excel in a fast-paced environment with tight time constraints#AnthropologieThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefitsEEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. To ensure compliance with our non-discrimination and anti-harassment policies, we offer anti-harassment training to managers and employees.

Location:This position is located at 149 High Street, Guildford, , GU13AD United Kingdom Role Summary:Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-TS1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Location:This position is located at 4400 Sharon Rd., Charlotte, North Carolina, 28211 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Anthropologie Temporary Home Designer - Graphic Design
indeed Philadelphia (United States) Sat, 07 Ju N/A
Role Summary:Anthropologie Home is looking for a Temporary Graphic Designer. The Graphic Designer will contribute to the visual identity of Anthro Living by developing compelling product packaging and...
Show full description ‚ñº
Role Summary:Anthropologie Home is looking for a Temporary Graphic Designer. The Graphic Designer will contribute to the visual identity of Anthro Living by developing compelling product packaging and graphic treatments for a range of home products. The ideal candidate will be a creative and detail-oriented individual with a strong understanding of design principles and a proven track record of bringing design concepts to execution. This role requires the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced environment, ensuring brand consistency and visually appealing solutions that resonate with the Anthro Living customer.Role Responsibilities:Conceptualize and design innovative product packaging solutions that are both aesthetically pleasing and functional, considering production feasibility and brand guidelines.Develop creative graphic treatments for Anthro Living products, including but not limited to candles, home fragrance, decorative accessories, and seasonal items.Maintain a strong awareness of current design trends, techniques, and technologies to inform design solutions.Collaborate closely with designers, product development, and marketing teams to ensure visual elements are cohesive and effectively communicate the Anthro Living brand message.Manage design projects from concept to final production, including preparing files for print or digital output.Contribute to the development and maintenance of brand style guides and visual standards.Role Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design or a related field.3-5 years of professional experience in graphic design, preferably within a retail or lifestyle brand environment.Proficiency in industry-standard design software, including Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.A strong portfolio demonstrating a solid understanding of typography, layout, color theory, and visual hierarchy, with examples of packaging and product graphics.Proven ability to translate creative concepts into effective and brand-appropriate visual solutions.Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefitsEEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. To ensure compliance with our non-discrimination and anti-harassment policies, we offer anti-harassment training to managers and employees.

Role Summary:The Associate Graphic Designer will contribute to the visual identity of Anthro Living by developing compelling product packaging and graphic treatments for a range of home products. The ideal candidate will be a creative and detail-oriented individual with a strong understanding of design principles and a proven track record of bringing design concepts to execution. This role requires the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced environment, ensuring brand consistency and visually appealing solutions that resonate with the Anthro Living customer.Role Responsibilities:Conceptualize and design innovative product packaging solutions that are both aesthetically pleasing and functional, considering production feasibility and brand guidelines.Develop creative graphic treatments for Anthro Living products, including but not limited to candles, home fragrance, decorative accessories, and seasonal items.Maintain a strong awareness of current design trends, techniques, and technologies to inform design solutions.Collaborate closely with designers, product development, and marketing teams to ensure visual elements are cohesive and effectively communicate the Anthro Living brand message.Manage design projects from concept to final production, including preparing files for print or digital output.Contribute to the development and maintenance of brand style guides and visual standards.Role Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design or a related field.3-5 years of professional experience in graphic design, preferably within a retail or lifestyle brand environment.Proficiency in industry-standard design software, including Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.A strong portfolio demonstrating a solid understanding of typography, layout, color theory, and visual hierarchy, with examples of packaging and product graphics.Proven ability to translate creative concepts into effective and brand-appropriate visual solutions.Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! Location:This position is located at 31-33 Market Hill, Cambridge, , CB23NU United Kingdom Role Summary:Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-TS1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Role Summary:We‚Äôre looking for a creative and motivated Junior Digital Designer to join our team in the Philadelphia area. This role is ideal for someone with 1‚Äì3 years of experience who is passionate about digital design, eager to grow, and excited to contribute to engaging visual experiences across a range of platforms.Role Responsibilities:Design and produce digital assets including web banners, emails, social media graphics, and site contentSupport the execution of seasonal campaigns and product launchesCollaborate with senior designers, art directors, and other team members to maintain brand consistency and visual excellenceAssist in creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for digital experiencesParticipate in team critiques and incorporate feedback to continuously elevate creative outputRole Qualifications:1‚Äì3 years of experience in digital design (agency or in-house experience preferred)Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesignExperience or familiarity with Figma is a huge plusStrong typography, layout, and visual storytelling skillsAbility to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environmentA portfolio that demonstrates clean, modern design and attention to detailBonus Points:Experience with motion graphics, UX/UI, or working with developersKnowledge of web and email best practices, including file optimization and responsive design#AnthropologieThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! Location:This position is located at 126-127 Upper St, Islington, , N11QP United Kingdom Role Summary:Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-AA1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.
