Show full description ‚ñº
Location:This position is located at 325 SW Powerhouse Dr, Bend, Oregon, 97702 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit https://www.urbn.com/work-with-us/storesPay Range: Starting from USD $16.00/Hr. Anthropologie Wage Transparency:To view information related to various state-specific wage transparency laws, click here. Please also note, if a full-time role is eligible to participate in the Sales Bonus Program, this may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range. EEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Lamar Blvd., Austin, Texas, 78703 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Location:This position is located at 50 Rideau St, Ottawa, Ontario, K1N9J7 Canada Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit https://www.urbn.com/work-with-us/storesPay Range: Starting from CAD $17.20/Hr. Anthropologie Wage Transparency:To view information related to various state-specific wage transparency laws, click here. Please also note, if a full-time role is eligible to participate in the Sales Bonus Program, this may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range.

Location:This position is located at 26 Eastgate, Victoria Leeds, , LS27JL United Kingdom Role Summary:Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-TS1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Anthropologie Jr. Art Director- Home
indeed Philadelphia (United States) Thu, 17 Ap N/A
Role Summary:Anthropologie is seeking an JuniorArt Director to support the creative execution of home photography within our in-house photo studio. This role will collaborate closely with the Senior A...
Show full description ‚ñº
Role Summary:Anthropologie is seeking an JuniorArt Director to support the creative execution of home photography within our in-house photo studio. This role will collaborate closely with the Senior Art Director and Associate Creative Director to bring the brand‚Äôs vision to life across all digital platforms. The ideal candidate is a highly creative visual thinker with a strong understanding of photography, styling, and brand storytelling.Role Responsibilities:Support the Associate Creative Director and Senior Art Director in executing the overarchingcreative vision for home and still life photography.Partner with a team of photographers and stylists to develop compelling and brand-rightimagery.Work with Styling Director and stylists on our in-house style out process for creativephotography ideation and planning seasonally.Maintain ecommerce photo standards and work with team members on elevating creative forany categories necessary to support the business needs.Collaborate with the studio operations team to ensure smooth workflows and efficientprocesses.Work closely with producers to align on schedules, budgets, and production needs.Assist in concepting and mood boarding for seasonal campaigns, product photography, andeditorial content.Provide on-set art direction and feedback to ensure consistent brand aesthetics.Maintain a keen awareness of industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging visualstorytelling techniques.Contribute to post-production discussions, ensuring final assets align with the creative brief andbrand identity.Support cross-functional collaboration with design, merchandising, and marketing teams.Role Qualifications:5+ years of experience in art direction, photo production, or a related creative role.A strong portfolio showcasing expertise in home photography.Understanding of composition, lighting, and styling techniques and a passion for current trendsin the global interior design and home retail industries.Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work cross divisionally.Detail-oriented, highly organized, and able to manage multiple projects in a fast-pacedenvironment.Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Bridge) and other relevant creativetools.Experience working within a studio environment is a plus.The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefitsEEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. Location:This position is located at 715 Hawthorn Row, Vernon Hills, Illinois, 60061 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit https://www.urbn.com/work-with-us/storesPay Range: Starting from USD $15.50/Hr. Please also note, if a full-time role is eligible to participate in the Sales Bonus Program, this may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range. Location:This position is located at 50 Rideau St, Ottawa, Ontario, K1N9J7 Canada Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit https://www.urbn.com/work-with-us/storesPay Range: Starting from CAD $17.20/Hr. Please also note, if a full-time role is eligible to participate in the Sales Bonus Program, this may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range.

Anthropologie Assistant Creative Merchandiser - Women's & Weddings
indeed Philadelphia (United States) Tue, 01 Ap N/A
Role Summary:Anthropologie is looking for a highly organized and creativeCreative Merchandising Assistantto support the development and execution of trend-driven merchandising strategies. In this role...
Show full description ‚ñº
Role Summary:Anthropologie is looking for a highly organized and creativeCreative Merchandising Assistantto support the development and execution of trend-driven merchandising strategies. In this role, you‚Äôll help bring seasonal stories to life by packaging product and messaging priorities for partner teams, organizing imagery and assets, maintaining merchandising documents, and curating product selections. You‚Äôll play a key role in connecting trend insights to product storytelling by tracking emerging fashion and cultural trends and contributing to creative brainstorms. This is a great fit for someone with curiosity for fashion and culture, creative intuition, and the ability to stay organized and efficient in a fast-paced environment.Role Responsibilities:Key ResponsibilitiesMaintain and update imagery and messaging details in merchandising documents with speed and accuracy, ensuring all stakeholders have access to the latest information.Curate featured product selections for marketing content, ensuring alignment with merchandising and storytelling priorities.Assist in the preparation of internal presentations and reports that communicate merchandising strategies and trend insights to leadership and cross-functional teams.Package and communicate seasonal and trend information in a clear format for styling, marketing, and buying teams.Track and identify emerging fashion, styling, cultural, and social media trends that may influence Anthropologie‚Äôs messaging and product storytelling.Contribute to creative brainstorming sessions and provide relevant trend insights to merchandising and marketing teams.Demonstrate urgency and efficiency in all tasks to keep merchandising and marketing teams on track with key messaging priorities.#LI-ME1Role Qualifications:Qualifications & SkillsEducation & Experience:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Fashion Merchandising, Marketing, Communications, or a related field preferred. Internship experience in merchandising, creative, or marketing is a plus.Technical Skills:Strong proficiency in digital tools, including Google Slides, and Microsoft Office. Ability to quickly adapt to new systems and processes.Communication:Strong written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to present ideas clearly and succinctly.Creative Aptitude:A keen eye for trends with an understanding of how cultural moments impact fashion and retail.Work Ethic & Speed:Must work with urgency and efficiency in a fast-paced environment. Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously with attention to detail.Initiative & Curiosity:While much of the role is task-driven, a successful candidate will be a self-starter who identifies opportunities and takes initiative to bring fresh ideas forward.Why You‚Äôll Love This RoleBe at the intersection of fashion, culture, and creative storytelling, influencing how Anthropologie brings trends to life.Gain hands-on experience in both merchandising and marketing within a highly collaborative and creative team.Build relationships across the organization (styling, marketing, buying, and more) in this highly cross-functional role.Work in a fast-paced, high-energy environment where no two days are the same.Develop your creative voice and presentation skills while contributing to a brand with a strong aesthetic and unique point of view.The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefitsEEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. Anthropologie Group Temp: Project Manager, Marketing Analytics
indeed Philadelphia (United States) Tue, 01 Ap N/A
Role Summary:Anthropologie Group is seeking a highly organized and proactive Project Manager to join our Marketing Analytics team as a temporary position for Maternity leave cover. This role will supp...
Show full description ‚ñº
Role Summary:Anthropologie Group is seeking a highly organized and proactive Project Manager to join our Marketing Analytics team as a temporary position for Maternity leave cover. This role will support the Marketing Analytics team by managing communication and coordination between cross-functional partners and various vendors, with a primary focus on our MMM/MTA vendor. The ideal candidate will have strong project management skills, excellent communication abilities, and a keen understanding of marketing analytics.Role Responsibilities:Project Management:Oversee and manage marketing analytics projects from inception to completion, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.Vendor Coordination:Act as the primary liaison with our MMM/MTA vendor, facilitating communication, managing timelines, and ensuring deliverables meet our standards.Cross-Functional Communication:Serve as the main point of contact between the Marketing Analytics team and other departments, ensuring clear and consistent communication.Reporting and Documentation:Develop and maintain project documentation, including timelines, status reports, and meeting notes.Stakeholder Management:Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and address any concerns or issues that arise during project execution.Process Improvement:Identify opportunities to streamline processes and improve efficiency within the Marketing Analytics team.Support Senior Marketing Analyst:Assist with various tasks as needed, including data analysis, report generation, and presentation preparation.Role Qualifications:At least 4 years of experience in serving as a Project Manager on engagements that delivered a Marketing (CRM, Campaign Management) or a Digital (Web, e-comm) solution, preferably in the Retail industry.Experience in project managing on initiatives that launched Marketing Campaign Automation capabilities (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Marketing Cloud, etc) or CRM/CDP capabilities. Project management experience in Digital Commerce solutions.In depth knowledge of MMM, MTA and Incrementality measurement solutions and vendor managementBachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related fieldExceptional attention to detail and strong ability to juggle multiple priorities at onceCollaborative personality with the ability to also work independentlyAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, results-oriented organization#LI-AZ1The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! Location:This position is located at 420 W Broadway, New York, New York, 10012 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-AA1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Anthropologie Brand Marketing Intern (12 Month FTC)
indeed London (United Kingdom) Sat, 22 Fe N/A
About Us:Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now...
Show full description ‚ñº
About Us:Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home d√©cor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.Role Summary:Working in a small, hands-on marketing team the Marketing Intern will support the marketing department in the delivery of marketing activities across campaigns, influencers, social media and stores. You will spend 4 days a week working alongside the Brand Marketing Manager and one day a week supporting the social team.What You'll Be Doing:Work with the buying teams and distribution centre to request and coordinate product for upcoming influencers partnerships.Assist with our influencer partnership programmes, building relationships and setting up activations.Support in the creation of marketing reports and campaign evaluations collating assets and results.Support in the set up and delivery of data capture competitions.Support retail stores including sourcing marketing opportunities, resources and admin assistance such as store signage requests.Assist with scheduling and community management of all social media channelsTagging products and posting to Instagram / Instagram StoriesStay abreast of top social trends, competitor posts and marketing practices and feedback to the wider social team.Ad-hoc support on customer care in social channels.Image research across Instagram and TiktokSupport on ad-hoc video content and feature in company TikToks.Delivering the Pinterest strategy for the year with a keen understanding to learn SEO and work with the platform on best practices.What You'll Need:You must be a 2nd year undergraduate student at a UK University undertaking an accredited placement year or currently working in one of our URBN stores.You must be available for 1-year full time from July 2025 until July 2026.A passion and enthusiasm for the Anthropologie brand and what we representA love for fashion and be interested in the market at largeAbility to multitask in our fast-paced Head OfficeBasic understanding of Microsoft OfficeA lover of Tik-Tok and someone who is on top of trending itemsKeen knowledge of social media platforms and general pop culture / key dates /events.#AnthroEU #LI-ER1The Perks:Work-life balance:Flexible start and finish timesBring your dog to workWellbeing:Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthFully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym membershipsPrivate Medical InsuranceEmployee Discount:Up to 40% off at all URBN BrandsCommunity:One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choiceTravel:Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loanContinued Development:We offer structured support within Show full description ‚ñº
Location:This position is located at 50 Rideau St, Ottawa, Ontario, K1N9J7 Canada Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit https://www.urbn.com/work-with-us/storesPay Range: Starting from CAD $17.20/Hr. Anthropologie Wage Transparency:To view information related to various state-specific wage transparency laws, click here. Please also note, if a full-time role is eligible to participate in the Sales Bonus Program, this may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range.

Anthropologie Paid Social Marketing Coordinator
indeed Philadelphia (United States) Thu, 20 Fe N/A
Role Summary:Anthropologie is hiring a digital marketing professional to develop and execute the Paid Social marketing activation strategy for Anthropologie Group brands, Anthropologie and BHLDN. This...
Show full description ‚ñº
Role Summary:Anthropologie is hiring a digital marketing professional to develop and execute the Paid Social marketing activation strategy for Anthropologie Group brands, Anthropologie and BHLDN. This role is highly cross-functional where teamwork, innovation, analysis, and strategic thinking are critical aspects of this position‚Äôs responsibilities.We are looking for a Paid Social media coordinator who knows how to execute within paid social channels and can help us to explore how to grow our paid social presence while connecting our mission and our unique product assortment customers. You will collaborate closely with our other paid digital channels, creative and merchandising leads as well as ad tech stakeholders to align the channel and business growth goals.In this role collaboration and clear communications are key. It is critical that you are curious, a self-starter, and a willing teammate who takes pride in ownership of this important program. The ideal candidate has serious analytical chops and strong work ethic with a drive to provide growth for the business. It's important to possess an eagerness to innovate, measure, test, sometimes fail, learn, and evolve to implement improved strategy for Anthropologie Group campaigns across Paid Social media.Role Responsibilities:Work under the Manager Paid Social and cross-functionally with creative, merchandising, and analytics teams to incorporate the business vision into paid social programsExecute full-cycle programs of direct response paid social campaigns across Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok and other emerging social channelsTake direction from marketing & creative briefs into execution & mid-campaign optimizations to hindsight reporting & analysisHelp to define and provide creative specification best practices and needsMonitor and optimize Dynamic Product Ad campaigns & strategy to drive profitable demand and support business priorities.Provide campaign analysis to help generate data-driven recommendations that improve current marketing and business practices in order to drive profitable demand, customer acquisition, engagement and retentionImplement advanced automation and optimization solutions to drive efficiencies of scaleContribute to other team projects and initiatives, remaining flexible and willingness to support opportunities to drive the businessThe position demands strong analytical, planning and multi-tasking skills to achieve business objectives, as well as a keen marketing sense to maximize resonance with target audiencesEmbody fail fast mentality by developing tests and iterating on learnings across platforms, creative formats, messaging and audiencesRole Qualifications:1-2 years‚Äô experience in paid social performance marketingFamiliarity with paid social (FB/IG/Pinterest/TikTok) platforms and at least one of the following tools: Facebook Ads Manager, Pinterest Business, and TikTok for BusinessAgency and/or consulting experienceExperience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and implementing strategies to resolve problemsExperience drawing conclusions from campaign results and crafting presentations to exhibit performance trendsExperience analyzing channel results and laddering channel insights up to business goalsHigh degree of project management skill and strong work ethicFamiliarity with web analytics#LI-BL1The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefitsEEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. To ensure compliance with our non-discrimination and anti-harassment policies, we offer anti-harassment training to managers and employees.

Location:This position is located at Brent Cross Shopping Centre Prince Charles Dr Hen, London, , NW43FP United Kingdom Role Summary:Achieve the Anthropologie mission ‚Äì to create an unimagined experience. Consistently meet or exceed the financial, operational, and visual expectations of the company.What You'll Be Doing:Customer Experience:Customer Connection: initiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalised way where all customers feel welcome, heard, and valuedSelling Culture supports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsOmni-Channel Service: provides a frictionless customer experience by utilising technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colours, and places orders for items not available in storeTeamwork & Communication:Team Player: builds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-AA1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersShare Knowledge: participates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerEmployee Recognition: contributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalInsights & Feedback provides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual & Business Operations:Business Acumen: understands their contribution to service, selling on every shift in order to positively impact the store‚Äôs business KPI‚ÄôsProduct Flow: supports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorStore Environment: maintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesMerchandising & Display:Executes stock-to-sales processes and presentation standardsIs knowledgeable of trend and supports brand messagingHas an understanding of how the merchant process impacts business and the customer experience.What You'll Need:Previous experience in a retail environment ‚Äì not a must.An awareness of the Anthropologie brand and its appeal to the local market.Strong communication skills.The Perks:Work Life Balance:‚ÄòLife Leave‚Äô - one day a year to take time off for those big events in life, in addition to your annual leave entitlementWellbeing:Employee Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial healthDiscount off external gym membershipsPrivate Medical Insurance for eligible employeesEmployee Discounts:Up to 40% employee discount at all URBN BrandsTravel:Season ticket loan for eligible employeesCycle to work scheme for eligible employeesContinued Development:We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development#AnthroEU #LI-AA1Equal Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Location:This position is located at 125 Westchester Ave, White Plains, New York, 10601 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefitsPay Range: Starting from USD $17.50/Hr. Anthropologie Wage Transparency:To view information related to various state-specific wage transparency laws, click here. Please also note, if a full-time role is eligible to participate in the Sales Bonus Program, this may result in bringing the total compensation to a higher range. EEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. To ensure compliance with our non-discrimination and anti-harassment policies, we offer anti-harassment training to managers and employees.

Anthropologie Freelance Social Content Creative
indeed London (United Kingdom) Fri, 27 De N/A
About Us:Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now...
Show full description ‚ñº
About Us:Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home d√©cor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.Role Summary:We are looking for a Freelance Social Content Creative to support the Anthropologie social team. You‚Äôll support with ideation, creative execution and post-production for Anthropologie Europe‚Äôs TikTok and Instagram accounts.This position will be a mix of working remote, in our office and in our stores 3 days a week.What You'll Be Doing:Develop and demonstrate understanding of Anthropologie‚Äôs key audiences and how best to engage themOffering of-the-moment, specialist advice on developing social trends, suggesting how these can be applied to Anthropologie‚Äôs content strategyEnd-to-end management of project-based content creation, from sample selection and shooting, through to video capturing, editing and writing captionsPresent ideas back to the social team for approval.Collaborate on the planning of the social content calendarEnsure your creative and ideation maintains brand TOV.What You'll Need:A positive can-do attitudeHyper-fixated on detailStrong knowledge of the developing social media landscape, both current and emerging innovationsStrong knowledge of fashion, homeware and cultural trends in the social spaceVideo editing skills ‚Äì Capcut essential, Premiere optional.Confident in front of the cameraStrong organisation skills ‚Äì must be able to manage multiple video projects at once.Balance being a forward planner with the ability to be reactive and adaptable in a changing retail environmentAbility to centre the brand in all creative processesStrong English language and communication skillsPlease share either their own social profile online OR a portfolio showcasing previous work.#AnthroEU #LI-ER1The Perks:Work-life balance:Flexible start and finish timesBring your dog to workEqual Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

Location:This position is located at 3050 Washtenaw Ave, Ann Arbor, Michigan, 48104 United States Role Summary:A Sales Associate contributes to driving sales through providing a genuine and unique experience to each customer.Role Responsibilities:Customer ExperienceInitiates genuine conversation to engage with the customer in a personalized way where all customers feel welcome, heard and valuedSupports a selling environment in all areas of the sales floor by connecting with multiple customers and sharing product suggestionsProvides a frictionless customer experience by utilizing technology to transact in the moment, find sizes and colors, and place orders for items not available in storeTeamwork + CommunicationBuilds productive relationships with peers; asks for support when needed and makes an effort to help othersParticipates in the learning and sharing of product knowledge, current trends, and personal styling priorities to inspire the customerContributes to a positive team morale participating in store initiatives and highlighting peers and leaders through the SPARKED journalProvides insights related to the customer and employee experience and communicates feedback to Store LeadershipVisual + Business OperationsUnderstands their contribution to service and selling on every shift in order to impact the store‚Äôs businessSupports the shipment process to gain awareness of product, including what‚Äôs new and what‚Äôs restock; contributes to completion of omni order fulfillment processes while maintaining stock levels of the floorMaintains Anthropologie‚Äôs visual and operational standards while keeping the focus on the customer; stays current on merchandising updatesRole Qualifications:Anthro brand fanExperience in customer serviceExperience being a team playerAbility to work flexible hours to meet the needs of the store including nights, weekends, and holidaysThe Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. EEO Statement:URBN celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity or expression), religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Show full description ‚ñº
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations. Arhaus is seeking a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital to join their Creative team. The ideal candidate will be able to translate strategic insights into brand defining creative storytelling, have a high attention to detail, be able to drive creative innovation, and manage the creative design process. As a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital, you'll be responsible for the concepting, execution and on-time delivery of high-quality creative materials across marketing channels with a focus on building the Arhaus brand, engaging customers, and driving business results. **Essential Duties & Responsibilities:** * Lead and manage the creative design process from concept to completion, ensuring that all deliverables support Arhaus brand pillars, engaging customers, and driving business results * Partner with copywriters and marketing partners to brainstorm, design and develop creative work for various campaigns, including print ads, digital banners, social media content, and other marketing materials. * Design materials that enhance the Arhaus brand and the overall customer experience * Drive innovation with editorial storytelling approach that elevates customer engagement * Provide expertise that pushes the team to do the most effective and elevated work possible * Demonstrate exceptional creative concepting ability across multiple marketing channels, as evidenced by a diverse portfolio of work * Translate strategic insights into effective and highly creative ideas * Oversee and mentor designers, providing guidance and feedback to ensure their professional growth and the quality of their work. * Partner with Marketing leads to grow the business and explore new business opportunities * Manage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously * Maintain accountability for overall quality of creative work * Conduct and participate in design reviews with a range of stakeholders across the organization **Requirements:** * Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in Advertising, Communications, Design, or other related field (or other relevant equivalent) * 7+ years of experience in Art Direction * Fluent in Adobe Suite * Strong conceptual and visual storytelling skills, with an exceptional portfolio showcasing a range of campaign work.. * Strong understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout design. * Ability to balance big-picture creative thinking with hands-on design execution. * Strong project management skills and ability to function as project leader influencing others as well as individual contributor. Able to work well in cross-functional teams. * Strong leadership skills and the ability to mentor and guide junior team members. * Team Player ‚Äì Must be able to manage and work with various members of creative, ecommerce and social teams * Must be organized and able to prioritize, multi-task and work independently * Fluent in English, with excellent communication, presentation, and social skills * Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts appropriately to different audiences and varying levels of the organization * Excellent presentation, teambuilding and communication skills, as well as a strong customer service mentality, to build and maintain relationships Arhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Arhaus are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Arhaus will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Arhaus encourages applicants of all ages.
Manager, Growth Marketing
linkedin Hudson (United States) Fri, 17 Oc N/A
Since 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. Arhaus ...
Show full description ‚ñº
Since 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. Arhaus is seeking a Manager, Growth Marketing to lead our paid media strategy and execution across paid social, display, video, search and emerging channels. In this highly data-driven, creative role, this individual will be instrumental in shaping and scaling our digital presence, driving profitable growth and brand affinity through innovative campaigns and rigorous performance optimization. Reporting to the Director, Content & Growth Marketing, this leader will own the strategy, planning, execution, budget management and performance across all growth channels and will directly lead and oversee a team of specialists, ensuring both team and channel success. **This position is located on-site at our Corporate Headquarters in Boston Heights, OH.** Key Responsibilities * Own the growth marketing strategy across paid social, display, video, and search, aligning campaigns with business objectives * Develop full-funnel paid media plans that drive awareness, engagement, and conversion while maximizing efficiency * Set channel KPIs and manage budgets, ensuring delivery against sales and ROI targets * Lead cross-functional collaboration, partnering closely with Creative, Analytics, and Ecom to deliver best-in-class campaigns * Oversee in platform activation and optimization across all platforms refining targeting, bidding, creative and landing page strategies * Translate performance data into insights, providing actionable recommendations to stakeholders and senior leadership * Manage vendor relationships to ensure alignment, performance and continuous growth * Continuously test and evolve campaigns and strategies, building roadmaps for creative, audience, and channel innovations * Lead and develop a high-performing team, providing coaching, feedback, and career development opportunities for direct reports * Stay ahead of industry trends and platform updates to inform strategy and maintain competitive advantage **Required Experience** * 4+ years of growth or performance marketing experience, including strategic planning, performance optimization and hands-on execution of multi million dollar programs * Demonstrated leadership and people management experience, with proven success managing direct reports * Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem, including campaign structure, audience segmentation, bidding strategies, and attribution modeling * Demonstrated understanding and experiencing in full funnel strategy * Strong storytelling skills with the ability to distill complex data into insights for stakeholders and senior leadership * Data-driven problem solving skills, with a desire to look for opportunities through data analysis and to take action on them * Experience in a fast-paced environment where deadlines, priorities, and initiatives pivot at the speed of digital trends * Self-starter with exceptional organizational, prioritization, and communication skills, with the ability to lead both teams and cross-functional partners **Preferred Experience** * Familiarity with multiple forms of analytics and measurement tools (ie A/B + Brand/Conversion Lift Testing, GA4, Media Mixed Modeling, etc) * Experience with retail and/or eCommerce D2C brands * Understanding of retail calendar and seasonal process * Passion for digital innovation, consumer trends, and the intersection of brand and performance marketing

Job Details **Description**Job Description Since 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for a strategic and passionate leader who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand. Arhaus is seeking a Manager, Growth Marketing to lead our paid media strategy and execution across paid social, display, video, search and emerging channels. In this highly data-driven, creative role, this individual will be instrumental in shaping and scaling our digital presence, driving profitable growth and brand affinity through innovative campaigns and rigorous performance optimization. Reporting to the Director, Content & Growth Marketing, this leader will own the strategy, planning, execution, budget management and performance across all growth channels and will directly lead and oversee a team of specialists, ensuring both team and channel success. This position is located on-site at our Corporate Headquarters in Boston Heights, OH. Key Responsibilities * Own the growth marketing strategy across paid social, display, video, and search, aligning campaigns with business objectives * Develop full-funnel paid media plans that drive awareness, engagement, and conversion while maximizing efficiency * Set channel KPIs and manage budgets, ensuring delivery against sales and ROI targets * Lead cross-functional collaboration, partnering closely with Creative, Analytics, and Ecom to deliver best-in-class campaigns * Oversee in platform activation and optimization across all platforms refining targeting, bidding, creative and landing page strategies * Translate performance data into insights, providing actionable recommendations to stakeholders and senior leadership * Manage vendor relationships to ensure alignment, performance and continuous growth * Continuously test and evolve campaigns and strategies, building roadmaps for creative, audience, and channel innovations * Lead and develop a high-performing team, providing coaching, feedback, and career development opportunities for direct reports * Stay ahead of industry trends and platform updates to inform strategy and maintain competitive advantage **Required Experience** * 4+ years of growth or performance marketing experience, including strategic planning, performance optimization and hands-on execution of multi million dollar programs * Demonstrated leadership and people management experience, with proven success managing direct reports * Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem, including campaign structure, audience segmentation, bidding strategies, and attribution modeling * Demonstrated understanding and experiencing in full funnel strategy * Strong storytelling skills with the ability to distill complex data into insights for stakeholders and senior leadership * Data-driven problem solving skills, with a desire to look for opportunities through data analysis and to take action on them * Experience in a fast-paced environment where deadlines, priorities, and initiatives pivot at the speed of digital trends * Self-starter with exceptional organizational, prioritization, and communication skills, with the ability to lead both teams and cross-functional partners **Preferred Experience** * Familiarity with multiple forms of analytics and measurement tools (ie A/B + Brand/Conversion Lift Testing, GA4, Media Mixed Modeling, etc) * Experience with retail and/or eCommerce D2C brands * Understanding of retail calendar and seasonal process * Passion for digital innovation, consumer trends, and the intersection of brand and performance marketing
VP, Commerce and Marketing Technology
linkedin Boston Heights (United States) Wed, 15 Oc N/A

Show full description ‚ñº
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations. **Essential Duties & Responsibilities:** The Vice President of Commerce and Marketing Technology will be a visionary leader responsible for shaping and executing the company‚Äôs commerce strategy across retail, eCommerce, and emerging marketing technology platforms. This executive will drive innovation, enhance customer engagement, and deliver seamless, personalized shopping experiences through cutting-edge technology and is responsible for delivery and continuous improvement of all customer-facing technology platforms that drive revenue and brand engagement. This includes ownership of the enterprise **e-commerce, point-of-sale (POS), order management, CRM, loyalty, and marketing technology ecosystems**. The role requires a proven track record of leading large-scale technology initiatives preferably with Shopify experience, fostering innovation, and aligning technology with business goals in a fast-paced retail environment. **Commerce and Marketing Strategy & Leadership** * Develop and execute the technology vision for commerce and marketing technologies to accelerate growth and profitability. * Partner with executive leadership to align innovation roadmaps with overall business objectives. * Lead a high-performing technology organization (blend of internal and external teams), fostering a culture of innovation, agility, and continuous improvement. **Commerce and Marketing Platform Management** * Lead the vision, design, and lifecycle of e-commerce, POS, OMS, and CRM systems (e.g., Shopify, Manhattan Active Omni, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or similar). * Oversee integrations between ERP, WMS, PIM, and digital front-ends to ensure real-time inventory visibility, accurate pricing, and personalized marketing. * Champion enterprise data integration and governance across the martech stack (CDP, analytics, tagging, and privacy compliance). * Ensure scalability, security, and performance of commerce and marketing platforms to support rapid growth and evolving customer needs. * Drive enhancements in digital merchandising, personalization, payment solutions, and omnichannel integration. **Innovation & Emerging Technology** * Identify and deploy emerging technologies that enhance the retail experience and operational efficiency. * Establish partnerships with technology providers, startups, and innovation labs to stay ahead of market trends. * Pilot and scale new digital experiences that deepen customer engagement and loyalty. **Customer Experience & Data** * Ensure a frictionless omnichannel journey‚Äîonline, mobile, and in-store‚Äîthrough unified authentication, cart persistence, and loyalty experiences. * Enable store associates with reliable POS and clienteling tools that reflect real-time customer and product data. * Partner with Marketing and Customer Insights to leverage martech capabilities for personalization, automation, and A/B testing. Lead efforts to deliver personalized, data-driven customer journeys across channels. * Leverage analytics, customer insights, and predictive modeling to optimize product recommendations, promotions, and digital content. * Champion a customer-first mindset in all technology initiatives. **Operational Excellence** * Oversee technology budgets, vendor relationships, and enterprise platform investments. * Implement best practices for governance, cybersecurity, compliance, and risk management. * Partner with store operations, supply chain, and marketing to enable seamless omnichannel experiences. **Requirements:** * 15+ years of technology leadership experience, with at least 7 years in senior roles overseeing engineering, operations and best practices. * Commerce and/or marketing technology management in retail or consumer-facing industries. * Strong background in enterprise architecture, digital commerce platforms, and customer experience technologies. * Demonstrated success in leading digital transformation and delivering measurable business impact.
