Job DetailsDescriptionSince 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for someone who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand.Arhaus, a leader in premium, luxury home furnishings, is seeking a highly strategic, creative, and experiencedSr Product Marketing Managerto join our team. This role is central to ensuring that both oursales teamsandclientshave the information they need to make informed decisions and to successfully sell and buy Arhaus products. The Product Marketing Manager will drive the communication of Arhaus‚Äôquality, craftsmanshipandproduct differentiation, creating clear, compelling, and accessible content that resonates with both our internal teams and clients. This position will also oversee the development and execution of product marketing collateral, partnering closely withProduct Merchandising,Marketing, Creative, andPhoto Studioteams while ensuring internal teams to deliver on time.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesElevated Product Strategy & Presentation:Lead the creation and implementation of product marketing strategies that emphasize Arhaus‚Äô luxury craftsmanship and quality, ensuring product messaging is clear, compelling, and resonates with both customers and the sales team. Highlight the premium value and unique design differentiation of Arhaus products across all channels.E-Commerce Optimization & Customer-Facing Content: Work closely with the E-commerce and creative teams to ensure that products are launched on Arhaus.com on-time and that product content on Product Detail Pages (PDP) and Product Listing Pages (PLP) is optimized for conversion, clearly communicating the luxury quality and differentiated design of Arhaus products. Ensure all digital content reflects the brand‚Äôs premium positioning, guiding customers through the buying journey with rich product descriptions, imagery, and multimedia.Customer Communication & Support: Develop clear, easy-to-understand product information and materials for customers, both in-store and online. Ensure that the information available to customers supports their decision-making process, providing them with the necessary details about product features, quality, craftsmanship, and differentiation to facilitate purchasing decisions.Sales Enablement & Training Materials: Create and support comprehensive product materials for the sales team, ensuring they have all the necessary information to effectively sell Arhaus products. Be the marketing lead in strategizing future opportunities for refining our product information process and technology ‚Äì ie, product feature sheets, FAQs, competitive analysis documents, and in-depth product modules that highlight product quality, craftsmanship, and unique selling points, enabling the sales team to communicate with confidence and close more sales.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Serve as the central point of contact for all product presentation and marketing initiatives between Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales, and other teams. Ensure all teams are aligned on product priorities, marketing timelines, and key messaging, and facilitate the smooth execution of product-related content.Process Development & Optimization: Establish and refine internal processes and communication tools for managing product marketing initiatives to ensure timely, effective execution of product launches. Optimize tools and set clear timelines, task assignments, and accountability structures to keep all teams on track and ensure timely delivery of marketing materials, training content, and digital assets.Partnership with Product Merchandising Team: Collaborate closely with the Product Merchandising Team to establish seasonal product priorities that reflect Arhaus‚Äô luxury positioning and sales goals. Work together to prioritize products for ecommerce presentation and marketing and ensure that these priorities are communicated clearly to the creative, photo studio, and ecomm teams for seamless execution of content that reflects the brand‚Äôs quality and premium value.Collaboration with Creative & Photo Studio Teams: Once product priorities are set, communicate these priorities clearly to the creative and photo studio teams. Ensure creative timelines align with targeted launch dates and product merchandising priorities. Hold teams accountable for achieviOversee the creation of high-quality, on-brand visual assets that showcase the craftsmanship and luxury of Arhaus products.Alignment and Support of Selling & Service Team: Evaluate and Identify opportunity in how marketing can better support our selling & service teams with product information. Develop and implement a strategy to support those teams.Team Leadership & AccountabilityLead and manage cross-functional teams, including content creators, copywriters, designers, and external agencies. Ensure that all team members are held accountable for deadlines and deliverables, maintaining the highest quality standards. Develop efficient workflows and processes that foster collaboration and streamline execution.Market & Competitive AnalysisStay up to date on industry trends and competitor activities. Use this information to adapt Arhaus‚Äô product positioning and ensure that our product offerings remain best-in-class in terms of both luxury and value. Analyze consumer behavior and purchasing patterns to further optimize product messaging and marketing strategies.RequirementsBachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.8+ years of product marketing or product merchandising experience, ideally within the luxury retail or home furnishings industry.Proven experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales) to bring product marketing strategies to life.Ability to create compelling product messaging that clearly communicates luxury, quality, craftsmanship, and product differentiation for both internal teams and customers.Strong experience in creating and managing sales enablement tools and materials that support both in-store and online sales efforts.Exceptional project management skills with the ability to juggle multiple priorities, drive projects to completion, and maintain high standards of execution.Leadership experience, with the ability to manage teams, set expectations, and hold teams accountable for deliverables.Strong understanding of marketing, e-commerce, product content creation, and digital marketing best practices.Ability to analyze market trends, customer feedback, and sales data to refine product positioning and communication strategies.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a focus on ensuring both sales teams and customers have the information they need to succeedArhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations.As theCreative Project Managerat Arhaus, you will play a critical role in managing and executing creative projects that support our marketing and larger enterprise initiatives. This role requires someone who is both organized and creative, capable of partnering with marketing teams to understand project goals, creative brief tracking, and collaborating with both internal creative teams and external creative freelancers or agencies. You will be responsible for defining project timelines, assigning tasks, managing relationships, and ensuring that all creative deliverables meet the required standards and deadlines. You will thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where deliverables and content opportunities may evolve throughout the creative process.Project Management & Coordination:Schedule review meetings as neededContinuously evaluate and improve current processesPartner closely with marketing teams to gather and define project briefs, creative needs, and strategic goals.Work collaboratively with internal creative teams to assign tasks, establish timelines, and manage deliverables for design, content, and production.Develop and manage clear project timelines, ensuring alignment of deadlines and priorities across teams.Oversee day-to-day project details, track progress, and proactively address any issues or bottlenecks that arise.External Freelancer & Agency Management:Communicate and collaborate with external creative freelancers and agencies to ensure they are aligned with the project‚Äôs goals, deliverables, and deadlines.Manage the onboarding process for external partners, ensuring they understand brand guidelines, project scope, and expectations.Serve as the primary point of contact for external partners, ensuring smooth communication and maintaining strong relationships throughout the project lifecycle.Review and provide feedback to freelancers and agencies to ensure deliverables meet Arhaus‚Äô quality standards and creative vision.Negotiate contracts and manage external resources to ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget.Collaboration & Communication:Serve as the primary point of contact between marketing, internal creative teams, and external freelancers/agencies, ensuring all teams are aligned and working toward the same objectives.Regularly update stakeholders on the status of projects, keeping them informed of progress, challenges, and outcomes.Facilitate effective communication to ensure creative concepts meet marketing objectives and brand guidelines.Creative Flexibility & Adaptability:Thrive in a creative and flexible environment where deliverables and content opportunities may evolve and shift throughout the creative process.Be proactive in adjusting timelines and resources as needed to accommodate new opportunities or unexpected changes.Demonstrate agility in managing projects with fluctuating priorities, ensuring that creative teams remain motivated and productive as the direction of a project evolves.Project Delivery:Monitor and ensure that creative assets from both internal teams and external partners are delivered on time and within budget.Track and monitor revisions as necessary to completion of the project.Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities to improve project workflows and efficiency, contributing to best practices in creative project management.Provide feedback and support to both internal and external teams to foster continuous improvement in project execution.QUALIFICATIONSExperience:5+ years of experience in project management, preferably in a creative or marketing environment.Proven experience working with and managing external creative freelancers and agencies.Familiarity with project management tools and software (e.g., Asana, Monday.com, or similar platforms).Skills:Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate effectively with internal teams and external partners.Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines while maintaining a creative mindset.Detail-oriented, with a keen eye for quality and consistency.Creative and Strategic Thinking:A strong understanding of creative processes, design principles, and how creative work aligns with marketing goals.Ability to balance creativity with strategic thinking to deliver projects that meet both aesthetic and business objectives.Demonstrated ability to thrive in a flexible, evolving Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations.Arhaus, a leader in premium, luxury home furnishings, is seeking a highly strategic, creative, and experiencedSenior Product Marketing Managerto join our team. Highlight the premium value and unique design differentiation of Arhaus products across all channels.E-Commerce Optimization & Customer-Facing Content:Work closely with the E-commerce and creative teams to ensure that products are launched on Arhaus.com on-time and that product content on Product Detail Pages (PDP) and Product Listing Pages (PLP) is optimized for conversion, clearly communicating the luxury quality and differentiated design of Arhaus products. Ensure all digital content reflects the brand‚Äôs premium positioning, guiding customers through the buying journey with rich product descriptions, imagery, and multimedia.Customer Communication & Support:Develop clear, easy-to-understand product information and materials for customers, both in-store and online. Ensure that the information available to customers supports their decision-making process, providing them with the necessary details about product features, quality, craftsmanship, and differentiation to facilitate purchasing decisions.Sales Enablement & Training Materials:Create and support comprehensive product materials for the sales team, ensuring they have all the necessary information to effectively sell Arhaus products. Be the marketing lead in strategizing future opportunities for refining our product information process and technology ‚Äì ie, product feature sheets, FAQs, competitive analysis documents, and in-depth product modules that highlight product quality, craftsmanship, and unique selling points, enabling the sales team to communicate with confidence and close more sales.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Serve as the central point of contact for all product presentation and marketing initiatives between Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales, and other teams. Ensure all teams are aligned on product priorities, marketing timelines, and key messaging, and facilitate the smooth execution of product-related content.Process Development & Optimization:Establish and refine internal processes and communication tools for managing product marketing initiatives to ensure timely, effective execution of product launches. Optimize tools and set clear timelines, task assignments, and accountability structures to keep all teams on track and ensure timely delivery of marketing materials, training content, and digital assets.Partnership with Product Merchandising Team:Collaborate closely with the Product Merchandising Team to establish seasonal product priorities that reflect Arhaus‚Äô luxury positioning and sales goals. Work together to prioritize products for ecommerce presentation and marketing and ensure that these priorities are communicated clearly to the creative, photo studio, and ecomm teams for seamless execution of content that reflects the brand‚Äôs quality and premium value.Collaboration with Creative & Photo Studio Teams:Once product priorities are set, communicate these priorities clearly to the creative and photo studio teams. Ensure creative timelines align with targeted launch dates and product merchandising priorities. Hold teams accountable. Oversee the creation of high-quality, on-brand visual assets that showcase the craftsmanship and luxury of Arhaus products.Alignment and Support of Selling & Service Team:Evaluate and Identify opportunity in how marketing can better support our selling & service teams with product information. Develop and implement a strategy to support those teams.Team Leadership & Accountability:Lead and manage cross-functional teams, including content creators, copywriters, designers, and external agencies. Ensure that all team members are held accountable for deadlines and deliverables, maintaining the highest quality standards. Develop efficient workflows and processes that foster collaboration and streamline execution.Market & Competitive Analysis:Stay up to date on industry trends and competitor activities. Use this information to adapt Arhaus‚Äô product positioning and ensure that our product offerings remain best-in-class in terms of both luxury and value. Analyze consumer behavior and purchasing patterns to further optimize product messaging and marketing strategiesRequirements:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.8+ years of product marketing or product merchandising experience, ideally within the luxury retail or home furnishings industry.Proven experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales) to bring product marketing strategies to life.Ability to create compelling product messaging that clearly communicates luxury, quality, craftsmanship, and product differentiation for both internal teams and customers.Strong experience in creating and managing sales enablement tools and materials that support both in-store and online sales efforts.Exceptional project management skills with the ability to juggle multiple priorities, drive projects to completion, and maintain high standards of execution.Leadership experience, with the ability to manage teams, set expectations, and hold teams accountable for deliverables.Strong understanding of marketing, e-commerce, product content creation, and digital marketing best practices.Ability to analyze market trends, customer feedback, and sales data to refine product positioning and communication strategies.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a focus on ensuring both sales teams and customers have the information they need to succeed.Arhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Arhaus are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Arhaus will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Arhaus encourages applicants of all ages.

SummaryArhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations.Arhaus is seeking a Senior Art Director to join their Creative team. The ideal candidate will be able to translate strategic insights into brand defining creative storytelling, have a high attention to detail, be able to drive creative innovation, and manage the creative design process. As an Art Director, you'll be responsible for the concepting, execution and on-time delivery of high-quality creative materials across marketing channels with a focus on building the Arhaus brand, engaging customers, and driving business results.Key ResponsibilitiesLead and manage the creative design process from concept to completion, ensuring that all deliverables support Arhaus brand pillars, engaging customers, and driving business resultsPartner with copywriters and marketing partners to brainstorm, design and develop creative work for various campaigns, including print ads, digital banners, social media content, and other marketing materials.Design materials that enhance the Arhaus brand and the overall customer experienceDrive innovation with editorial storytelling approach that elevates customer engagementProvide expertise that pushes the team to do the most effective and elevated work possibleDemonstrate exceptional creative concepting ability across multiple marketing channels, as evidenced by a diverse portfolio of workTranslate strategic insights into effective and highly creative ideasOversee and mentor designers, providing guidance and feedback to ensure their professional growth and the quality of their work.Partner with Marketing leads to grow the business and explore new business opportunitiesManage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneouslyMaintain accountability for overall quality of creative workConduct and participate in design reviews with a range of stakeholders across the organizationExperience & SkillsBachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in Advertising, Communications, Design, or other related field (or other relevant equivalent)7+ years of experience in Art DirectionFluent in Adobe SuiteStrong conceptual and visual storytelling skills, with an exceptional portfolio showcasing a range of campaign work..Strong understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout design.Ability to balance big-picture creative thinking with hands-on design execution.Strong project management skills and ability to function as project leader influencing others as well as individual contributor. Able to work well in cross-functional teams.Strong leadership skills and the ability to mentor and guide junior team members.Team Player ‚Äì Must be able to manage and work with various members of creative, ecommerce and social teamsMust be organized and able to prioritize, multi-task and work independentlyFluent in English, with excellent communication, presentation, and social skillsStrong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts appropriately to different audiences and varying levels of the organizationExcellent presentation, teambuilding and communication skills, as well as a strong customer service mentality, to build and maintain relationshipsArhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind, Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Job DetailsDescriptionSince 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for someone who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand.Arhaus is searching for a Creative Lead, Social Media, responsible for conceptualizing and executing all creative deliverables for social media marketing, inclusive of organic and paid strategy. This position will work to define and execute a cohesive creative strategy for the Arhaus social ecosystem that aligns with high level brand strategy, retail marketing strategy, and the direction for all other owned platforms within Arhaus‚Äô digital footprint (website, email, etc.). Reporting to the Senior Manager, Social Media, this team member is an innovative graphic designer and content creator who has a pulse on digital trends and remains consistently updated with the rapidly changing social media and digital marketing landscape. This position is located on-site at our Corporate Headquarters in Boston Heights, OH.Key ResponsibilitiesConcept, direct, develop and execute content inclusive of art direction and graphic design for paid and organic social media channels, inclusive of Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok and YouTube, among othersConcept and execute short and long form video content and animation, inclusive of storyboarding, art direction, and editing treatmentsPitch and execute innovative social first concepts to amplify business goals and initiativesTranslate campaign themes into compelling social channel specific contentStay abreast of social media landscape (Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, influencers and creators, etc.) and infuse trends into brand relevant design executionsThink strategically to translate data and insights into creative, social-first content that delivers resultsOwn and oversee work through lifecycle of project -- concept, design and development, refinement, executionMaintain accuracy and attention to detail throughout all deliverablesPartner with production partners to revise and refine design assets for deliverySource and organize all UGC and related content from all social media platformsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including creative, copy, influencer, storytelling + content strategy, production, and moreRequired to travel when applicableRequired Experience4+ years relevant design and content creation experience, inclusive of video and digital animation and storytellingA compelling portfolio of distinctive design work with elevated brand expressionsExpert in the Adobe Suite, Premiere, After Effects, social apps and design toolsA knowledge of home, interior design, image making, and branding with a highly refined sensibilityInspired by the changing creative landscape -- social, experiential, and brand obsessedPassion for pop culture, trends in social media, understanding of landscape and performance driversRefined design sensibility and typography skillsStrong organizational skills, keen eye for detail, and ability to manage multiple projects at onceExperience in a fast-paced environment where deadlines, priorities, and initiatives pivot at the speed of social trendsPreferred ExperienceExperience with retail and/or eCommerce D2C brandsUnderstanding of retail calendar and seasonal processExperience with copywritingExperience with luxury brands is a plusArhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. The role will ensure the health and efficiency of the website, and will collaborate with multiple internal departments to deliver website improvements that drive conversion. This position will be in Arhaus‚Äô Marketing Department reporting to the Director of E-Commerce.Duties And ResponsibilitiesAssist in all aspects of E-Commerce management including: maintaining site health, operational excellence, execution of future growth initiatives, performance reporting, and issue resolutionDevelop subject matter expertise in Arhaus website systems and processesEnsure website content accuracy including product information, promotions, and pricing utilizing knowledge of data flow processesMonitor website usability and the customer experience to improve site performance, merchandising options, engagement, and conversionTroubleshoot website, payment, and order processing issues with internal teams and develop toolset and disciplines for internal teams to expedite issue resolutionDocument processes of site management for current and future team membersPartner with IT teams on E-Commerce requirements and testing for new site capabilities. This role is located onsite at our Corporate Office in Boston Heights, OH.ResponsibilitiesAssist in execution of merchandising strategies for new product launches, marketing campaigns, and promotions through Arhaus.com.Audit product presentation online to ensure that products are accurately described, categorized, tagged and priced.Work with omni-merchants to coordinate execution of new product launchesComplete weekly audits of category pages online to ensure optimal shopping experiencePartner with eComm team to troubleshoot and resolve site issues related to products or category pagesAct as subject matter expert in Shopify product management and troubleshootingAddress concerns risen by sales, merchandising, or store teams in a professional and proficient mannerOther duties as may be determined by management to perform the necessary functions of the position, on an as needed basis.RequirementsStrong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel & Outlook).Previous Arhaus field experience a plus.Previous Shopify or other CMS experience a plus.High School diploma or equivalent is required ‚Äì some college preferred, merchandising degree a plus.Good interpersonal skills including a positive attitude, friendly people skills, efficient time management, coach-ability, critical thinking & problem solving skills, and the ability to work as a productive team member are required.Adherence to the Arhaus dress code (due to vendor visits and store appearances).Strict adherence to Arhaus policies on attendance and punctuality.Arhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Senior Product Marketing Manager
linkedin Boston Heights (United States) Thu, 27 Ma N/A
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision,...
Show full description ‚ñº
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations.Arhaus, a leader in premium, luxury home furnishings, is seeking a highly strategic, creative, and experiencedSenior Product Marketing Managerto join our team. This role is central to ensuring that both oursales teamsandclientshave the information they need to make informed decisions and to successfully sell and buy Arhaus products. The Product Marketing Manager will drive the communication of Arhaus‚Äôquality, craftsmanshipandproduct differentiation, creating clear, compelling, and accessible content that resonates with both our internal teams and clients. This position will also oversee the development and execution of product marketing collateral, partnering closely withProduct Merchandising,Marketing, Creative, andPhoto Studioteams while ensuring internal teams to deliver on time.Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Elevated Product Strategy & Presentation:Lead the creation and implementation of product marketing strategies that emphasize Arhaus‚Äô luxury craftsmanship and quality, ensuring product messaging is clear, compelling, and resonates with both customers and the sales team. Highlight the premium value and unique design differentiation of Arhaus products across all channels.E-Commerce Optimization & Customer-Facing Content:Work closely with the E-commerce and creative teams to ensure that products are launched on Arhaus.com on-time and that product content on Product Detail Pages (PDP) and Product Listing Pages (PLP) is optimized for conversion, clearly communicating the luxury quality and differentiated design of Arhaus products. Ensure all digital content reflects the brand‚Äôs premium positioning, guiding customers through the buying journey with rich product descriptions, imagery, and multimedia.Customer Communication & Support:Develop clear, easy-to-understand product information and materials for customers, both in-store and online. Ensure that the information available to customers supports their decision-making process, providing them with the necessary details about product features, quality, craftsmanship, and differentiation to facilitate purchasing decisions.Sales Enablement & Training Materials:Create and support comprehensive product materials for the sales team, ensuring they have all the necessary information to effectively sell Arhaus products. Be the marketing lead in strategizing future opportunities for refining our product information process and technology ‚Äì ie, product feature sheets, FAQs, competitive analysis documents, and in-depth product modules that highlight product quality, craftsmanship, and unique selling points, enabling the sales team to communicate with confidence and close more sales.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Serve as the central point of contact for all product presentation and marketing initiatives between Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales, and other teams. Ensure all teams are aligned on product priorities, marketing timelines, and key messaging, and facilitate the smooth execution of product-related content.Process Development & Optimization:Establish and refine internal processes and communication tools for managing product marketing initiatives to ensure timely, effective execution of product launches. Optimize tools and set clear timelines, task assignments, and accountability structures to keep all teams on track and ensure timely delivery of marketing materials, training content, and digital assets.Partnership with Product Merchandising Team:Collaborate closely with the Product Merchandising Team to establish seasonal product priorities that reflect Arhaus‚Äô luxury positioning and sales goals. Work together to prioritize products for ecommerce presentation and marketing and ensure that these priorities are communicated clearly to the creative, photo studio, and ecomm teams for seamless execution of content that reflects the brand‚Äôs quality and premium value.Collaboration with Creative & Photo Studio Teams:Once product priorities are set, communicate these priorities clearly to the creative and photo studio teams. Ensure creative timelines align with targeted launch dates and product merchandising priorities. Hold teams accountable. Oversee the creation of high-quality, on-brand visual assets that showcase the craftsmanship and luxury of Arhaus products.Alignment and Support of Selling & Service Team:Evaluate and Identify opportunity in how marketing can better support our selling & service teams with product information. Develop and implement a strategy to support those teams.Team Leadership & Accountability:Lead and manage cross-functional teams, including content creators, copywriters, designers, and external agencies. Ensure that all team members are held accountable for deadlines and deliverables, maintaining the highest quality standards. Develop efficient workflows and processes that foster collaboration and streamline execution.Market & Competitive Analysis:Stay up to date on industry trends and competitor activities. Use this information to adapt Arhaus‚Äô product positioning and ensure that our product offerings remain best-in-class in terms of both luxury and value. Analyze consumer behavior and purchasing patterns to further optimize product messaging and marketing strategiesRequirements:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.8+ years of product marketing or product merchandising experience, ideally within the luxury retail or home furnishings industry.Proven experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales) to bring product marketing strategies to life.Ability to create compelling product messaging that clearly communicates luxury, quality, craftsmanship, and product differentiation for both internal teams and customers.Strong experience in creating and managing sales enablement tools and materials that support both in-store and online sales efforts.Exceptional project management skills with the ability to juggle multiple priorities, drive projects to completion, and maintain high standards of execution.Leadership experience, with the ability to manage teams, set expectations, and hold teams accountable for deliverables.Strong understanding of marketing, e-commerce, product content creation, and digital marketing best practices.Ability to analyze market trends, customer feedback, and sales data to refine product positioning and communication strategies.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a focus on ensuring both sales teams and customers have the information they need to succeed.Arhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Arhaus are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Arhaus will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Arhaus encourages applicants of all ages.

indeed Richmond (United States) Thu, 27 Fe N/A

Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations.The Design Consultant maximizes sales and consistently delivers an exceptional guest experience. This individual is an enthusiastic representative of the Arhaus brand. Design Consultants utilize our selling model to close transactions and are responsible for conducting business according to all company standards, policies and procedures. The Design Consultant supports an exceptional guest experience at all times.As a Design Consultant, you will be providing customer service and space planning assistance, as well as maintaining a sales driven focus.If this sounds like the type of environment that you would thrive in, we invite you to apply for our open Full-Time position inRichmond, VA at Short Pump Town Center!RESPONSIBILITIESMeets required monthly sales and productivity standardsContinually develops enhanced selling behaviors according to our selling modelDemonstrates strong product knowledgeMaintains a guest book to organize, generate and cultivate businessPerforms proactive and consistent follow-up with all guests before and after the sale and at deliveryWorks to improve performance based on feedback provided by store managementPromptly solves guest concernsPerforms all opening and closing duties as directedAccurately performs all systems functions and maintain operational standardsResponsible for recording all hours workedReviews and acts upon all email and company communicationsParticipates in weekly one on ones and team meetingsWorks in collaboration with all team membersREQUIREMENTSDriven to achieve sales goalsDemonstrates knowledge and passion for company products and servicesStrong organizational, time management, technological and communication skillsWorks well independently and collaborativelyAbility to deliver high-quality guest relationsSales skills, sense of design or related experience preferredProfessional appearance and demeanorFlexible schedule that meets the needs of the business (including evenings, weekends, and holidays)COMPENSATION$22,000 (lowest hourly base) - $350,000 annualIncludes minimum hourly base plus commission and (if achieved) Monthly Sales Incentives and Quarterly BonusesCommission (plan is tiered and UNLIMITED) is paid on net WRITTEN sales for the calendar month and is based on several factors including, but not limited to, experience, store volume, and locationEMPLOYEE BENEFITSExceptional advancement opportunitiesCompetitive earnings, bonus opportunities, and generous employee discountMedical, dental, and life insurance benefits (offerings differ between full-time and part-time status)Flex spending plan401K retirement program and 529 college savings planPaid vacations and holidays (Full-time employees only)Arhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Show full description ‚ñº
Job DetailsDescriptionSince 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for someone who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand.Arhaus is searching for a Creative Lead, Social Media, responsible for conceptualizing and executing all creative deliverables for social media marketing, inclusive of organic and paid strategy. This position will work to define and execute a cohesive creative strategy for the Arhaus social ecosystem that aligns with high level brand strategy, retail marketing strategy, and the direction for all other owned platforms within Arhaus‚Äô digital footprint (website, email, etc.). Reporting to the Senior Manager, Social Media, this team member is an innovative graphic designer and content creator who has a pulse on digital trends and remains consistently updated with the rapidly changing social media and digital marketing landscape. This position is located on-site at our Corporate Headquarters in Boston Heights, OH.Key ResponsibilitiesConcept, direct, develop and execute content inclusive of art direction and graphic design for paid and organic social media channels, inclusive of Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok and YouTube, among othersConcept and execute short and long form video content and animation, inclusive of storyboarding, art direction, and editing treatmentsPitch and execute innovative social first concepts to amplify business goals and initiativesTranslate campaign themes into compelling social channel specific contentStay abreast of social media landscape (Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, influencers and creators, etc.) and infuse trends into brand relevant design executionsThink strategically to translate data and insights into creative, social-first content that delivers resultsOwn and oversee work through lifecycle of project -- concept, design and development, refinement, executionMaintain accuracy and attention to detail throughout all deliverablesPartner with production partners to revise and refine design assets for deliverySource and organize all UGC and related content from all social media platformsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including creative, copy, influencer, storytelling + content strategy, production, and moreRequired to travel when applicableRequired Experience4+ years relevant design and content creation experience, inclusive of video and digital animation and storytellingA compelling portfolio of distinctive design work with elevated brand expressionsExpert in the Adobe Suite, Premiere, After Effects, social apps and design toolsA knowledge of home, interior design, image making, and branding with a highly refined sensibilityInspired by the changing creative landscape -- social, experiential, and brand obsessedPassion for pop culture, trends in social media, understanding of landscape and performance driversRefined design sensibility and typography skillsStrong organizational skills, keen eye for detail, and ability to manage multiple projects at onceExperience in a fast-paced environment where deadlines, priorities, and initiatives pivot at the speed of social trendsPreferred ExperienceExperience with retail and/or eCommerce D2C brandsUnderstanding of retail calendar and seasonal processExperience with copywritingExperience with luxury brands is a plusArhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and d√©cor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used‚Äîand loved‚Äîfor generations.An Online Sales Consultant maximizes sales by assisting customers in the selection, purchase, and delivery of merchandise. Duties include providing warm, friendly customer service on line and over the phone as you read each customer‚Äôs need for assistance and match customer requirements to the benefits of our fine furniture & accessories.You will also complete the sale by collecting any balances due, arranging for delivery and following up on any out-of-stock situations. Successful candidates possess complete product knowledge (we‚Äôll train you!), are great multitaskers, and are highly organized with excellent written and verbal communication skills.*This is Not a Remote Position*Essential Duties:Field customer sales inquiries and complete/enhance customer orders that originate from inbound web calls, chats and emailsFollow-up on open orders report throughout each week to schedule deliveries and check on delayed merchandise. Follow up with all aspects of each sale until the merchandise is delivered to the customer‚Äôs home and customer is fully satisfiedResolves customer issues promptly and successfully by investigating problems, developing solutions, and making appropriate suggestions and recommendations. Refer the situation to store management or customer service department is solution cannot be reachedCreating customers for life by building relationships and providing excellent Arhaus service throughout the sale and delivery processHandle inquiries, stock availability/status, returns, exchanges, credits and gift cards accurately, completely, and in full accordance with corporate policiesWell versed and comfortable with the computer and other sales systemsSupport your co-workers and managers in day-to-day operations including assisting other sales consultant‚Äôs customers, as necessaryHandles money according to established proceduresHours of Operation:40 hours per weekMonday through Sunday availability is a MUST (weekend hours required, schedule will vary each month)9:00am - 5:30pm weekdays, 9:00am - 5:00pm weekends (weekend shifts - remote/work from home)Required skills:Proficient in Microsoft Office SuiteStrong written and verbal communication skillsHighly organized. Key Responsibilities AI Art Direction & Visual Strategy * Set visual direction for AI-generated imagery across all AFI brands and product lines * Establish comprehensive AI imagery standards that maintain brand integrity and quality * Develop creative briefs and visual guidelines specifically for AI-generated content * Partner with creative teams to integrate AI imagery seamlessly with traditional photography and design Studio Output & Quality Management * Oversee AI output and maintain quality standards for all AI-generated visual content * Develop quality control processes and approval workflows for AI-generated imagery * Ensure AI-generated content meets brand standards and commercial requirements * Monitor and optimize AI production workflows for efficiency and consistency Team Education & Development * Lead team education on new AI tools and techniques across the creative organization * Develop training programs and best practices for AI tool adoption * Mentor team members on AI art direction principles and creative applications * Stay current with emerging AI technologies and assess their potential for creative implementation Process Innovation & Workflow Development * Design and implement agentic workflows that scale AI production thoughtfully * Create systematic approaches that combine AI efficiency with creative excellence * Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate AI capabilities into existing creative processes * Document and refine AI production methodologies for scalable implementation **Required Qualifications**Experience & Background * 6+ years of professional art direction experience with demonstrated leadership in creative innovation * Proven track record in visual content creation, photography, or digital imaging * Portfolio featuring art direction created by AI and traditional photography required * Experience in retail, furniture, or consumer goods industries preferred Core Competencies * Advanced expertise in AI image generation tools * Strong understanding of traditional photography and art direction principles * Proficiency in creative software (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.) * Excellent process design and workflow optimization skills * Knowledge of emerging AI technologies and creative applications Leadership Skills * Demonstrated ability to educate and inspire teams on new technologies * Strong collaboration and cross-functional partnership capabilities * Excellent communication skills with ability to present AI concepts to leadership * Balance of innovative thinking with practical implementation expertise * Change management experience in adopting new creative technologies
Art Director (Artificial Intelligence)

Show full description ‚ñº
**AI Art Director - Ashley Furniture Industries** **Location: Tampa FL** *About Us* Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We‚Äôve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers.This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance. **Position Overview** Ashley Furniture Industries is seeking an innovative AI Art Director to advance AFI's creative innovation by setting the visual direction for AI-generated imagery, establishing standards, and developing agentic workflows. Reporting directly to the Sr. Director of Image Capture, this pioneering role focuses on art direction , studio output and quality , and team education on new tools and techniques. This leader ensures we scale AI thoughtfully and effectively while unlocking efficiency, expanding creative possibility, and keeping AFI at the forefront of AI-enhanced production. **Key Responsibilities** AI Art Direction & Visual Strategy * **Set visual direction for AI-generated imagery** across all AFI brands and product lines * Establish comprehensive AI imagery standards that maintain brand integrity and quality * Develop creative briefs and visual guidelines specifically for AI-generated content * Partner with creative teams to integrate AI imagery seamlessly with traditional photography and design Studio Output & Quality Management * **Oversee AI output and maintain quality standards** for all AI-generated visual content * Develop quality control processes and approval workflows for AI-generated imagery * Ensure AI-generated content meets brand standards and commercial requirements * Monitor and optimize AI production workflows for efficiency and consistency Team Education & Development * **Lead team education on new AI tools and techniques** across the creative organization * Develop training programs and best practices for AI tool adoption * Mentor team members on AI art direction principles and creative applications * Stay current with emerging AI technologies and assess their potential for creative implementation Process Innovation & Workflow Development * **Design and implement agentic workflows** that scale AI production thoughtfully * Create systematic approaches that combine AI efficiency with creative excellence * Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate AI capabilities into existing creative processes * Document and refine AI production methodologies for scalable implementation **Qualifications** Experience & Background * **6+ years of professional art direction experience**with demonstrated leadership in creative innovation * Proven track record in visual content creation, photography, or digital imaging * **Portfolio featuring art direction created by AI and traditional photography required** * Experience in retail, furniture, or consumer goods industries preferred Core Competencies * **Advanced expertise in AI image generation tools** * Strong understanding of traditional photography and art direction principles * Proficiency in creative software (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.) * Excellent process design and workflow optimization skills * Knowledge of emerging AI technologies and creative applications Leadership Skills * Demonstrated ability to educate and inspire teams on new technologies * Strong collaboration and cross-functional partnership capabilities * Excellent communication skills with ability to present AI concepts to leadership * Balance of innovative thinking with practical implementation expertise * Change management experience in adopting new creative technologies **Our Core Values** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused **Benefits We Offer** * Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program * Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday off * Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings * Professional Development Opportunities * Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism * Telehealth * 401(k) and Profit Sharing * Life Insurance To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: **Corporate Social Responsibility** **https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/** We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only. **Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:** *Ashley Furniture Industries, LLC, is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity unless an agreement is in place. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ashley Furniture via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ashley Furniture. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ashley Furniture as a result of the referral or through other means.*
Director of Product Marketing
linkedin Tampa (United States) Thu, 20 No N/A
**Director of Product Marketing ‚Äì OnSite: Tampa, FL** **About the Role:** We are seeking a seasoned **Director of Product Marketing** to define and lead the strategy, positioning, and execution of p...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Director of Product Marketing ‚Äì OnSite: Tampa, FL** **About the Role:** We are seeking a seasoned **Director of Product Marketing** to define and lead the strategy, positioning, and execution of product launches across our multi-brand home and furniture portfolio. This highly visible leadership role serves as the central connector across Merchandising, Product Development, Sales, Marketing, and Creative, ensuring each product enters the market with precision, consistency, and impact. You will own the go-to-market (GTM) strategy, develop scalable product messaging and positioning frameworks, and guide a high-performing team in bringing new collections to market across direct-to-consumer, retail, wholesale, and marketplace channels. This role offers the opportunity to shape category leadership, drive meaningful growth, and elevate how our brands engage customers across a diverse and evolving landscape. *To be considered for this opportunity, you must be able to commute to Ashley‚Äôs Corporate Office in Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is available for qualified candidates.* **Why This Opportunity Is Special:** * **Build the Foundation:** This is a unique opportunity to architect the Product Marketing function from the ground up at the largest furniture manufacturer in America. * **Lead Through Influence:** You‚Äôll sit at the center of our business‚Äîwhere strategy meets storytelling and product meets customer. * **Be a Category Shaper:** We‚Äôre launching high-velocity SKUs across multiple categories: upholstery, casegoods, motion, and bedding. * **Join a Growth-Obsessed Team:** We move fast, think big, and iterate quickly. You'll have both leadership and ownership. **What You‚Äôll be Doing:** GTM Strategy & Category Ownership * Own and manage **go-to-market plans**, calendars, and cross-functional launch workflows across all furniture categories * Define **product positioning**, selling narratives, and consumer-facing benefits for each channel (DTC, retail, Amazon, Wayfair, etc.) * Drive alignment with Merchandising and Development to prioritize the right SKUs for each seasonal launch Messaging & Content Briefing * Write and evolve **core messaging documents** and storytelling frameworks that drive marketing campaigns, packaging, PDPs, and retail content * Partner with Creative and Brand teams to brief on **imagery, video, 3D renderings, and copy** needed for launch assets * Ensure **channel-ready content** is accurate, timely, and compliant with each retailer or platform Hub Between Departments * Act as the central bridge between **Product Development, Merchandising, Sales, Creative, and Marketing** * Align on timelines, product specifications, messaging priorities, and asset needs * Run cross-functional meetings and checkpoints to keep all teams informed and accountable Product Accuracy & Consumer Insights * Partner with Data & Insights to validate claims, track reviews, and refine positioning over time * Ensure accuracy of product names, specifications, claims, dimensions, and visual representation * Maintain centralized systems for product content readiness and version control Team Leadership * Build and manage a high-performing team: * Product Marketing Managers (by category) * Content & Readiness Manager * Launch Project Manager Optional: Insights Analyst * Foster a team culture of collaboration, creativity, and continuous improvement **Skills & Qualifications:** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; advanced degree preferred * 8‚Äì10 years of progressive experience in product marketing, brand marketing, or category leadership‚Äîideally within home, furniture, or consumer goods industries * Demonstrated success leading product launches across multiple channels, with expertise in DTC, marketplace, and wholesale environments * Proven people leadership experience within high-growth, fast-paced businesses * Strong ability to collaborate across functions, with direct experience partnering with Merchandising, Sales, Product Development, Creative, and Retail Marketing teams * Exceptional communication, strategic thinking, and execution skills with a strong bias toward results * Ability and willingness to travel as needed to support business objectives * Background in organizations such as Wayfair, Amazon, Home Depot, or Steelcase a plus *Reports to:*Head Merchant/Marketplace Category Lead & Chief Creative Officer *Level:* Director (8‚Äì10 years experience) **What We Offer** *(subject to eligibility requirements)***:** Benefits: When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process. **Our Core Values:** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: **Corporate Social Responsibility** **https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/** This company values its diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made on the basis of an individual‚Äôs skills, qualifications, merit and business need.

Show full description ‚ñº
**Marketing Specialist, Partnerships ‚Äì OnSite: Tampa, FL** Ashley is seeking a Specialist, Strategic Partnerships to join our dynamic Field Marketing & Partnerships team. This role is your gateway to managing a large sports & entertainment portfolio spanning NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and top collegiate programs. **What You'll Do:** You'll be the driving force behind 40+ activations across 9 professional and 3 collegiate partnerships, executing everything from in-venue signage and paid media campaigns to VIP hospitality and sweepstakes. You'll collaborate across Marketing, Creative, PR, and Retail teams to bring high-impact brand moments to life, while tracking performance data that proves ROI. **What We're Looking For:** A detail-obsessed project manager with 1‚Äì3 years in marketing partnerships, sponsorships, or event execution (sports/entertainment background strongly preferred). You thrive in fast-paced environments, juggle multiple campaigns with ease, and bring strong organizational chops plus proficiency in Microsoft Office and project management tools. **Why This Role Matters:** You'll protect Ashley's strategic assets, ensure flawless delivery, and free senior leaders to focus on growth, all while traveling 20‚Äì30% for on-site activations that put you courtside, rinkside, and in the heart of the action. Reports to: Manager, Strategic Partnerships **Key Responsibilities** * Execute contractual deliverables including in-venue signage, paid media, sweepstakes, in-store activations, and digital/social campaigns. * Manage day-to-day partnership assets and campaign trackers, ensuring deadlines, budgets, and creative approvals are met. * Lead logistics for activations: ticketing, hospitality, VIPs, promotions, and on-site event support. * Collaborate with Marketing, Creative, PR, Retail, and Community teams to integrate campaigns into national brand moments. * Track and compile performance data for recaps, KPI reporting, and ROI analysis. * Maintain detailed calendars and process documents to ensure consistent execution across dozens of activations. * Serve as a professional liaison with partners and vendors, escalating relationship management to the Manager as needed. * Travel as needed (20‚Äì30%) for event execution and on-site activations. **Qualifications** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Sports Management, or related field. * 1‚Äì3 years of experience in marketing partnerships, sponsorships, or event execution‚Äîsports/entertainment background strongly preferred. * Strong project management and organizational skills; proven ability to juggle multiple campaigns. * Proficiency in Microsoft Office; experience with project management software (Asana, Smartsheet, etc.) a plus. * Detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. **Benefits We Offer** * Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program * Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday off * Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings * Professional Development Opportunities * Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism * Telehealth * 401(k) and Profit Sharing * Life Insurance **Our Core Values** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: Corporate Social Responsibility *We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.*

Vice President of Stationary Furniture SalesGeneral SummaryThe Vice President of Stationary Furniture Sales is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of business priorities specifically focused on Ashley's stationary furniture segment. This senior leadership position will develop and implement strategic initiatives to expand Ashley's presence in the stationary furniture market while ensuring profitable growth and market dominance. The role demands creating and nurturing a culture of success with a specialized focus on stationary furniture sales achievement and market penetration.ScopeThis position oversees the complete stationary furniture sales organization, responsible for enhancing the stationary furniture brand portfolio, creating alignment within the specialized sales team, developing stationary furniture sales talent, and executing competitive sales strategies aimed at dominating the stationary furniture market segment.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesStrategic LeadershipDevelop and execute comprehensive sales strategies specifically for stationary furniture product linesAnalyze market trends, seasonal patterns, and competitive landscape in the stationary furniture segmentCreate and implement territory-specific sales plans aligned to stationary living trendsEstablish and maintain relationships with key retailers and distributors specializing in stationary furnitureSales Operations ManagementLead and develop a specialized stationary furniture sales team across multiple territoriesSet and achieve revenue targets for the stationary furniture divisionDevelop promotional strategies that maintain competitiveness while ensuring profitabilityProduct Development & Market AnalysisCollaborate with product development teams to influence stationary furniture design based on market feedbackIdentify opportunities for product line expansion based on consumer trends and market demandsAnalyze seasonal buying patterns and adjust strategies accordinglyMonitor industry innovations in materials and design specific to stationary furnitureTeam LeadershipBuild and lead an engaged team specialized in stationary furniture salesProvide ongoing training specific to stationary furniture products, materials, and maintenanceDevelop and implement performance metrics specific to seasonal sales cyclesCreate and maintain a high-performance culture focused on stationary living solutionsJob QualificationsEducational BackgroundBachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related fieldMBA or advanced degree preferredAdditional certifications in stationary/casual furniture industry beneficialExperience10+ years of progressive sales leadership experienceMinimum 5 years specific experience in stationary/casual furniture industryStrong background in establishing strategic manufacturing partnerships and implementing successful product sourcing initiativesProven track record of driving seasonal sales programsDemonstrated success in managing multi-territory sales operationsRequired SkillsDeep understanding of stationary furniture market dynamicsStrong knowledge of materials and construction specific to stationary furnitureAdvanced strategic planning and execution capabilitiesSuperior communication and presentation skillsProficiency in CRM and sales management softwarePhysical Requirements & Work Environment70% travel required, with increased travel during peak seasonal periodsOffice environment with regular visits to showrooms, retail locations, and trade showsAbility to examine and evaluate stationary furniture products physicallyTools & TechnologyProficiency in CRM systemsExperience with Sales reporting toolsCompetency in sales analytics softwareSuccess MetricsAchievement of seasonal and annual sales targetsMarket share growth in stationary furniture segmentTeam performance and developmentCustomer satisfaction and retention ratesSuccessful new product launchesProfitable territory expansionAshley is an Equal Opportunity Employer and promotes a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth.

Senior Product Manager - OnSite: Tampa, FLSummaryAs the Senior Product Manager responsible for Ashley Global Retail's ecommerce cart and checkout experience, you'll be at the heart of our revenue engine, where every optimization you make directly impacts our bottom line and customer satisfaction. You'll lead the charge in creating seamless, intuitive purchasing journeys that turn browsers into buyers, leveraging data-driven insights to reduce cart abandonment and maximize conversion rates.Primary Job Functions:This section describes the primary /essential responsibilities that this job performs.Independently, break work down from the overall Product Vision into developable slices of functionality. Build epics, features and user stories to form the basis for a healthy backlog of work for the team to be able to build, test and deliver in incremental and iterative fashion through the scrum process.For complex products or featured sets, gather and document detailed business, functional and technical requirementsLead collaboration sessions with business stakeholders for complex products or feature sets, UX and technical associates to identify feature details and acceptance criteria.Responsible for identifying solutions based on input from stakeholders and team members to arrive at a solution. Identify functional risks, gaps and conflicts in requirements.Collaborate and communicate with other Ecomm product and development team members to ensure a shared understanding of the business value for a broad set of features and the user needs the features are solving for.Create detailed product/feature concept documents to ensure understanding of scope, function and complexity.Prioritize backlog to focus on longer term timing (4-6 months). Independently lead/facilitate product ceremonies including backlog refinement, sprint planning, and other agile ceremonies.Provide regular updates to Director to facilitate enterprise-wide communication to stakeholders, including progress towards Objectives and Key Results (OKRs). Set OKRs for each product feature set.Ensure business value is being delivered on a frequent basis through the production deployment of working tested software.Develop strong relationship with the Product Owner and/or Scrum Master to jointly address issues and opportunities with team delivery. Ensure business value is being delivered on a frequent basis through the production deployment of working tested software.Demonstrate the Company‚Äôs Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functioSecondary Job FunctionsThis section describes the secondary responsibilities that this job performs.Maintain reliable attendance.Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup.Complete other assignments and special projects as requested.Requirements:8 years of experience in product management, Ecommerce, retail, online retail or merchandising, or related field, RequiredBachelors Degree in Business, Technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience, RequiredWorking knowledge of Continuous ImprovementHandle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraintsProficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite, Agile Project Management softwareBenefits:When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process.Our Core Values:Honesty & IntegrityPassion, Drive, DisciplineContinuous Improvement/Operational ExcellenceDirty FingernailGrowth FocusedTo learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:Corporate Social Responsibilityhttps://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/This company values its diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Show full description ‚ñº
The Sr Manager, Influencer Marketing is responsible for leading the development and execution of all aspects of the Ashley brand‚Äôs influencer partnerships. You will identify and build relationships with industry influencers, develop and execute influencer campaigns, and measure the success of those campaigns. You will report on program performance and make actionable recommendations to continually improve performance and achieve Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).Develop and execute influencer strategy that aligns with the company‚Äôs strategic goals and maximizes ROI.Manage influencer campaigns from ideation to execution across various platforms, including creator platform ‚Äì CreatorIQ.Identify new influencer partnership opportunities that align with our target audience and brand values.Liaison between influencers/ambassadors and the Ashley brand.Manage influencer & ambassador relationships, contract negotiations, content planning, and provide feedback.Collaborate with larger marketing team to develop 360-influencer campaignsWork cross functionally with merchandising, supply chain and visual design departments to execute on partnerships.Work collaboratively with internal business units and third-party suppliers with the ability to build strong internal relationships.Stay informed about industry trends and best practices in influencer marketing.Monitor financial resources and ensure efficient implementation of campaigns within established budgetary limits.Measure the success of influencer campaigns against established KPIs.Prepare and present project information and analysis to senior management/executives. when required.Demonstrates the company‚Äôs values in all aspects of their work performance.Other duties: this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that may be required, or which may change over time, and which can be changed at any time, with or without notice.

Build You Career with AshleyAre you passionate about creating extraordinary customer experiences through data-driven marketing? Join one of the world's largest furniture manufacturers and retailers as we revolutionize how we connect with our customers!Senior CDP/CRM Marketing Specialist: On-Site, Tampa FLWhat Will You Do?As our Senior CDP/CRM Marketing Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of Ashley's digital marketing initiatives, orchestrating personalized customer experiences across email, SMS, mobile app, and push notifications. This role is perfect for a marketing technologist who loves solving complex challenges and driving measurable results. Senior Vice President of Stationary Furniture SalesGeneral SummaryThe Vice President of Stationary Furniture Sales is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of business priorities specifically focused on Ashley's Stationary furniture segment. This senior leadership position will develop and implement strategic initiatives to expand Ashley's presence in the Stationary furniture market while ensuring profitable growth and market dominance. The role demands creating and nurturing a culture of success with a specialized focus on Stationary furniture sales achievement and market penetration.ScopeThis position oversees the complete Stationary furniture sales organization, responsible for enhancing the Stationary furniture brand portfolio, creating alignment within the specialized sales team, developing Stationary furniture sales talent, and executing competitive sales strategies aimed at dominating the Stationary furniture market segment.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesStrategic LeadershipDevelop and execute comprehensive sales strategies specifically for Stationary furniture product linesAnalyze market trends, seasonal patterns, and competitive landscape in the Stationary furniture segmentCreate and implement territory-specific sales plans accounting for regional weather patterns and Stationary living trendsEstablish and maintain relationships with key retailers and distributors specializing in Stationary furnitureSales Operations ManagementLead and develop a specialized Stationary furniture sales team across multiple territoriesSet and achieve revenue targets for the Stationary furniture divisionMonitor and optimize inventory levels in coordination with seasonal demandsDevelop pricing strategies that maintain competitiveness while ensuring profitabilityProduct Development & Market AnalysisCollaborate with product development teams to influence Stationary furniture design based on market feedbackIdentify opportunities for product line expansion based on consumer trends and market demandsAnalyze seasonal buying patterns and adjust strategies accordinglyMonitor industry innovations in materials and design specific to Stationary furnitureTeam LeadershipBuild and lead an engaged team specialized in Stationary furniture salesProvide ongoing training specific to Stationary furniture products, materials, and maintenanceDevelop and implement performance metrics specific to seasonal sales cyclesCreate and maintain a high-performance culture focused on Stationary living solutionsJob QualificationsEducational BackgroundBachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related fieldMBA or advanced degree preferredAdditional certifications in Stationary/casual furniture industry beneficialExperience10+ years of progressive sales leadership experienceMinimum 5 years specific experience in Stationary/casual furniture industryStrong background in establishing strategic manufacturing partnerships and implementing successful product sourcing initiativesProven track record of driving seasonal sales programsDemonstrated success in managing multi-territory sales operationsRequired SkillsDeep understanding of Stationary furniture market dynamicsStrong knowledge of materials and construction specific to Stationary furnitureExcellence in seasonal forecasting and inventory managementAdvanced strategic planning and execution capabilitiesSuperior communication and presentation skillsProficiency in CRM and sales management softwarePhysical Requirements & Work Environment70% travel required, with increased travel during peak seasonal periodsOffice environment with regular visits to showrooms, retail locations, and trade showsAbility to examine and evaluate Stationary furniture products physicallyTools & TechnologyProficiency in CRM systemsExperience with inventory management systemsKnowledge of weather tracking and seasonal planning toolsCompetency in sales analytics and forecasting softwareSuccess MetricsAchievement of seasonal and annual sales targetsMarket share growth in Stationary furniture segmentTeam performance and developmentCustomer satisfaction and retention ratesSuccessful new product launchesProfitable territory expansionAshley is an Equal Opportunity Employer and promotes a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth.
