International Marketing Specialist (Bilingual) ‚Äì Colton, CA (on-site)What Will You Do?The International Marketing and Advertising Manager is an integral member of the team that must deliver to the company objectives with specific emphasis on developing successful multi-channel marketing programs for international markets including the licensee retail stores, mass merchants and independent retailers. This position involves developing and implementing retail promotion calendar and multi-channel marketing strategies to meet both store and website traffic, sales/revenue, sales per guest (SPG) and growth objectives, while leading and influencing multiple constituents, such as licensees, internal departmental partners and peers, with a high degree of communication and insight with tactical execution.Collaborate with Licensees and International Licensees to establish a comprehensive marketing promotions calendar for each international territory in order to achieve the organization‚Äôs annual multi-channel marketing plan and aligns separate but related constituents and business goals into a singular marketing platform and brand message.Drive a cultural of diversity while managing a Marketing/Advertisement understanding from their local perspectives. Understanding and creating unique strategies for different regions and countries, to meet the individual needs.Collaborate with leadership on the alignment of annual and quarterly Company goals of store and website traffic, sales, online site traffic, mattress sales and overall market growth, by country.Drive traffic through a promotional calendar for each global market.Drive the development and deploy aggressive offer and event promotion to licensees, mass merchants and retailers.Develop mattress promotions plan and calendar.Develop new and innovative ways to leverage financing as a traffic driver where possible in each foreign market.Leverage Google Analytics to provide weekly eCommerce traffic reporting; identify and make recommendations for growth opportunities.Lead retailers to provide detailed measurement and reporting on store and website traffic and sales, while identifying and recommending changes to improve effectiveness.Develop first-hand knowledge of market dynamics, competitors, and opportunities by communicating with each market, identifying business potential, and corresponding marketing programs.Develop consistent global market competitive analysis and reporting. Provide real-time recommendations to address market promotions opportunities.Collaborate and communicate with retailers and agencies to execute marketing and advertising trend analysis, monitoring, and competitive benchmarking, as appropriate.Collaborate with a variety of internal teams to identify and socialize market trends and dynamics to develop corresponding marketing programs.Demonstrate the Company‚Äôs Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions.What Do You Need?Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Advertising or related field, or equivalent work experience preferredBi-lingual, RequiredExperience in a B2C marketing and/or advertising function in a high volume, big-box, multi-retail store, preferably in furniture, RequiredProject or Supervisory/Management experience, PreferredStrong attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent interpersonal skillsEffective time management and organizational skillsWork independently as well as in a team environmentDocument management systemAnalytical and problem solving skillsMaintain confidentialityWho Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. Show full description ‚ñº
Ashley Furniture is the largest manufacturer of furniture in the world. Our talented engineers and designers travel the world to stay ahead of evolving trends, new materials, and emerging technologies. Our global teams work closely, ensuring that new products meet our standards of excellence while optimizing efficiencies in manufacturing, cost control, and speed to market.Senior Director of Product, Sales & ServicesLocation: Tampa, FL (on-site)As the Sr. Director of Product for Sales & Service at Ashley Furniture Industries, you will play a pivotal role bridging the gap between business and technology, driving product strategy and execution within our Sales and Service Organization, which includes Order Management, CRM, and our Ashley Direct website. This role is responsible for translating business vision into actionable initiatives and collaborating with Technology to deliver impactful solutions using Agile methodologies.Primary Job FunctionsThis section describes the primary /essential responsibilities that this job performs.Company Values: Demonstrate the Company‚Äôs Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions. (Honesty & Integrity, Passion, Drive & Discipline, Continuous Improvement, Dirty Fingernail, Growth-Focused, Customer Centric, Boundaryless, and A Culture of Leadership)Product Strategy: Develop and execute comprehensive strategies that align with business goals and customer needs. This includes working with stakeholders to define product vision, setting OKRs, and creating roadmaps to achieve them.Product Development: Work closely with business stakeholders and engineering teams to develop product requirements. Make critical decisions and tradeoffs to ensure that product development is on track and meets the defined specifications and quality standards.Feature Prioritization: Prioritize features and initiatives based on business and technology objectives, customer feedback, and business value. Continuously reassess and adjust feature priorities based on changing market conditions, customer feedback, and business needs.Roadmap Planning: Create and maintain detailed product roadmaps. Communicate these roadmaps to stakeholders and ensure alignment across the organization.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Supply Chain, Customer Service, and other key business functions to ensure seamless product integration and execution. This includes coordinating product launches, creating go-live strategies, and ensuring alignment across departments.Customer Focused:Work closely with support teams to understand common issues and areas for improvement and use this information to drive product enhancements and reduce customer pain points.Data Analysis: Utilize data analytics to develop strategies, identify trends, and measure ROI and product performance.Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of direct reports, fostering a high-performance, collaborative cultureAgile Methodology: Support and advocate for Agile methodologies to manage product development. This includes leading and participating in sprint ceremonies to ensure efficiency and alignment.Thought leadership: Bring expertise in the industry and functional area to drive innovation and efficiency. Understand and influence the applications and systems supporting the product.Executive Reporting: Deliver regular product updates, including monthly reviews for executive stakeholders. Manage the team through all business processes such as budget reviews, annual planning, strategy offsites, etc.Job QualificationsEducation:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration or a related field. MBA is a plus.Experience:15+ years of experience in B2B product management, preferably in enterprise software engineering and deep understanding of business operations in relevant functional areas.Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesDeep understanding of order management and customer service workflows and technology.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.Proven ability to translate business objectives into a structured product strategyExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels.Proficiency in product management tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello, Aha!) and methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum).Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.Strong leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.Who Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. linkedin United States Wed, 16 Ap N/A

Show full description ‚ñº
The Vice President of Sales (Motion) is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of the business priorities for major functions at Ashley. As a Senior Leader, the Vice President of Sales will drive Ashley to meet its strategic goals to ensure Ashley continues to grow and thrive. The Vice President of Sales is responsible and accountable for the creation and execution of plans and strategies for developing business and achieving Ashley‚Äôs sales goals. This individual is expected to create a culture of success and ongoing business and sales achievement. The Vice President of Sales holds the important responsibility of managing the sales team, operations, and resources to deliver profitable growth. As a member of the Ashley team, this individual should continuously strive to do their part to ensure Ashley is the best furniture company. Through passion, drive, and discipline, our employees have created a winning team where continuous improvement and customer satisfaction is at the heart of Ashley. We are committed to earning and retaining trust from both our customers and our employees, and the Vice-President of Sales should share these same values.ScopeThe Vice President of Sales(Motion) is responsible and accountable for enhancing the brand, creating alignment and accountability in the sales organization, enhancing sales talent, and executing a competitive sales strategy aimed at market growth domination.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesSenior Leader Job Responsibilities:Engage Employees- Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibility to employees based on strengths to maximize their job ownership and commitment to outcomes.- Provide timely guidance and feedback to help others excel so that they become more committed to their jobs and the organization.- Build and lead an engaged team that is committed to Ashley and its bottom line.Cultivate a Customer Focused Culture- Make customer relationships and satisfaction the primary driving force when designing products and processes.- Embrace the Ashley vision by creating an environment that inspires people to generate innovative ways to increase customer satisfaction when designing products and processes.- Set high standards and accountability for customer satisfaction in all business activities at Ashley.Job Specific Responsibilities:Enhance the Brand- Make customer satisfaction the primary focus to enhance Ashley‚Äôs recognition in the marketplace.- Commit to a long-term sales strategy to enhance Ashley‚Äôs brand by analyzing information, evaluating options, and selecting the best sales strategy.- Use insight into market drivers to capitalize on business opportunities that will enhance Ashley‚Äôs recognition in the marketplace.Enhance Sales Talent- Attract, develop, and retain talented individuals to build a competitively superior sales organization.- Provide timely guidance and feedback to help sales employees excel on the job and meet key accountabilities.- Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibility to help sales employees realize their highest potential at Ashley.Create Alignment and Accountability in the Sales Organization- Commit to a long-term strategy for increasing alignment and accountability at Ashley by analyzing information, evaluating options, and selecting the best sales strategy.- Align communication, people, culture, and processes to drive flawless execution of Ashley‚Äôs objectives.- Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibilities to ensure flawless execution of Ashley‚Äôs strategies.Execute Competitive Sales Strategy- Use insight into market drivers to execute a competitive sales strategy that will create new business opportunities.- Execute a competitive sales strategy for Ashley by aligning communication, people, culture, and processes.- Leverage business knowledge and experience to drive sales strategies that will gain competitive advantage.Schedule ExpectationsFlexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary; 50% travel.Job Qualifications:- **Educational Background:** Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred.- **Experience:** 10+ years of relevant experience in sales leadership, account management, or a similar role within the retail or furniture industry. Proven track record of driving customer engagement, product adoption, and achieving sales goals.- **Skills:** Exceptional leadership and team management abilities. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely. Proficiency in CRM tools and sales software. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong financial literacy with experience in budget management and financial reporting.Benefits We OfferHealth, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance ProgramPaid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday offGenerous Employee Discount on home furnishingsProfessional Development OpportunitiesAshley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical TourismTelehealth401(k) and Profit SharingLife InsuranceOur Core ValuesHonesty & IntegrityPassion, Drive, DisciplineContinuous Improvement/Operational ExcellenceDirty FingernailGrowth FocusedTo learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:Corporate Social ResponsibilityAshley Furniture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Join one of the world's largest furniture manufacturers and retailers as we revolutionize how we connect with our customers!Senior CDP/CRM Marketing Specialist: On-Site, Tampa FLWhat Will You Do?As our Senior CDP/CRM Marketing Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of Ashley's digital marketing initiatives, orchestrating personalized customer experiences across email, SMS, mobile app, and push notifications. This role is perfect for a marketing technologist who loves solving complex challenges and driving measurable results. Ability to adapt to a fast paced, evolving retail environment with a positive attitude.Lead Marketing Automation Initiatives: Architect and optimize customer journeys across multiple channels using advanced marketing automation platformsDrive Innovation: Design and implement sophisticated audience segmentation strategies that power personalized customer experiencesTechnical Leadership: Create and maintain custom templates using HTML, CSS, and Liquid ScriptingAnalytics & Optimization: Leverage Google Analytics and Looker to derive insights and optimize campaign performanceProject Management: Own the marketing technology project backlog and coordinate cross-functional initiativesTeam Leadership: Mentor and guide an offshore team member while collaborating with our 30-person marketing departmentWhat Do You Need?3+ years of experience in marketing technology/automationStrong expertise in CRM tools, customer data platforms, and complex audience segmentationProficiency in HTML, CSS, Liquid Scripting, Google Analytics, and LookerExperience with the platform Zeta Global, preferred not requiredBachelor's degree or equivalent work experienceRetail experience preferred, but not requiredExcellent problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environmentExperience managing cross-functional projects and stakeholder relationshipsWhy Ashley?Impact: Your work International Marketing Specialist (Bilingual) ‚Äì Colton, CA (on-site)What Will You Do?The International Marketing and Advertising Manager is an integral member of the team that must deliver to the company objectives with specific emphasis on developing successful multi-channel marketing programs for international markets including the licensee retail stores, mass merchants and independent retailers. This position involves developing and implementing retail promotion calendar and multi-channel marketing strategies to meet both store and website traffic, sales/revenue, sales per guest (SPG) and growth objectives, while leading and influencing multiple constituents, such as licensees, internal departmental partners and peers, with a high degree of communication and insight with tactical execution.Collaborate with Licensees and International Licensees to establish a comprehensive marketing promotions calendar for each international territory in order to achieve the organization‚Äôs annual multi-channel marketing plan and aligns separate but related constituents and business goals into a singular marketing platform and brand message.Drive a cultural of diversity while managing a Marketing/Advertisement understanding from their local perspectives. Understanding and creating unique strategies for different regions and countries, to meet the individual needs.Collaborate with leadership on the alignment of annual and quarterly Company goals of store and website traffic, sales, online site traffic, mattress sales and overall market growth, by country.Drive traffic through a promotional calendar for each global market.Drive the development and deploy aggressive offer and event promotion to licensees, mass merchants and retailers.Develop mattress promotions plan and calendar.Develop new and innovative ways to leverage financing as a traffic driver where possible in each foreign market.Leverage Google Analytics to provide weekly eCommerce traffic reporting; identify and make recommendations for growth opportunities.Lead retailers to provide detailed measurement and reporting on store and website traffic and sales, while identifying and recommending changes to improve effectiveness.Develop first-hand knowledge of market dynamics, competitors, and opportunities by communicating with each market, identifying business potential, and corresponding marketing programs.Develop consistent global market competitive analysis and reporting. Provide real-time recommendations to address market promotions opportunities.Collaborate and communicate with retailers and agencies to execute marketing and advertising trend analysis, monitoring, and competitive benchmarking, as appropriate.Collaborate with a variety of internal teams to identify and socialize market trends and dynamics to develop corresponding marketing programs.Demonstrate the Company‚Äôs Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions.What Do You Need?Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Advertising or related field, or equivalent work experience preferredBi-lingual, RequiredExperience in a B2C marketing and/or advertising function in a high volume, big-box, multi-retail store, preferably in furniture, RequiredProject or Supervisory/Management experience, PreferredStrong attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent interpersonal skillsEffective time management and organizational skillsWork independently as well as in a team environmentDocument management systemAnalytical and problem solving skillsMaintain confidentialityWho Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? Show full description ‚ñº
Ashley Furniture is the largest manufacturer of furniture in the world. Our talented engineers and designers travel the world to stay ahead of evolving trends, new materials, and emerging technologies. Our global teams work closely, ensuring that new products meet our standards of excellence while optimizing efficiencies in manufacturing, cost control, and speed to market.Vice President/Senior Director of Product, Sales & ServicesLocation: Tampa, FL--Advance/Charlotte, NC-- Arcadia, WIAs the Senior Director of Product for Sales & Service at Ashley Furniture Industries, you will play a pivotal role bridging the gap between business and technology, driving product strategy and execution within our Sales and Service Organization, which includes Order Management, CRM, and our Ashley Direct website. This role is responsible for translating business vision into actionable initiatives and collaborating with Technology to deliver impactful solutions using Agile methodologies.Primary Job FunctionsThis section describes the primary /essential responsibilities that this job performs.Company Values: Demonstrate the Company‚Äôs Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions. (Honesty & Integrity, Passion, Drive & Discipline, Continuous Improvement, Dirty Fingernail, Growth-Focused, Customer Centric, Boundaryless, and A Culture of Leadership)Product Strategy: Develop and execute comprehensive strategies that align with business goals and customer needs. This includes working with stakeholders to define product vision, setting OKRs, and creating roadmaps to achieve them.Product Development: Work closely with business stakeholders and engineering teams to develop product requirements. Make critical decisions and tradeoffs to ensure that product development is on track and meets the defined specifications and quality standards.Feature Prioritization: Prioritize features and initiatives based on business and technology objectives, customer feedback, and business value. Continuously reassess and adjust feature priorities based on changing market conditions, customer feedback, and business needs.Roadmap Planning: Create and maintain detailed product roadmaps. Communicate these roadmaps to stakeholders and ensure alignment across the organization.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Supply Chain, Customer Service, and other key business functions to ensure seamless product integration and execution. This includes coordinating product launches, creating go-live strategies, and ensuring alignment across departments.Customer Focused:Work closely with support teams to understand common issues and areas for improvement and use this information to drive product enhancements and reduce customer pain points.Data Analysis: Utilize data analytics to develop strategies, identify trends, and measure ROI and product performance.Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of direct reports, fostering a high-performance, collaborative cultureAgile Methodology: Support and advocate for Agile methodologies to manage product development. This includes leading and participating in sprint ceremonies to ensure efficiency and alignment.Thought leadership: Bring expertise in the industry and functional area to drive innovation and efficiency. Understand and influence the applications and systems supporting the product.Executive Reporting: Deliver regular product updates, including monthly reviews for executive stakeholders. Manage the team through all business processes such as budget reviews, annual planning, strategy offsites, etc.Job QualificationsEducation:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration or a related field. MBA is a plus.Experience:15+ years of experience in B2B product management, preferably in enterprise software engineering and deep understanding of business operations in relevant functional areas.Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesDeep understanding of order management and customer service workflows and technology.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.Proven ability to translate business objectives into a structured product strategyExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels.Proficiency in product management tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello, Aha!) and methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum).Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.Strong leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.Who Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a ‚ÄúGrowth Mindset‚Äù, and once you join our team, you‚Äôll learn from the best in the business.Apply today and find your home at Ashley!Benefits We OfferHealth, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance ProgramPaid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday offGenerous Employee Discount on home furnishingsProfessional Development OpportunitiesAshley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical TourismTelehealth401(k) and Profit SharingLife InsuranceOur Core ValuesHonesty & IntegrityPassion, Drive, DisciplineContinuous Improvement/Operational ExcellenceDirty FingernailGrowth FocusedTo learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:Corporate Social Responsibilityhttps://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. executing omnichannel strategies.Extensive experience with digital platforms, including websites, mobile applications, and point of sale systems.Strong knowledge of agile methodologies and experience driving agile transformations.Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and drive change across cross-functional teams.Deep understanding of customer experience, With operations spanning over 100 countries, Ashley offers a broad range of products to retail partners. The company is committed to delivering the best values, selection, and service in the furniture industry.Role DescriptionThis is a full-time on-site role for a Marketing Graphic Designer located in Colton, CA. Company OverviewAshley is a global leader in the furniture industry, committed to delivering exceptional products and customer experiences. As a dynamic and forward-thinking organization, we seek to innovate and streamline our business operations continuously. We are currently looking for a Senior Vice President (SVP) of Case Goods to serve as a strategic partner and advisor to our leadership team.SummaryThe Vice President of Case Goods Sales is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of the business priorities for major functions at Ashley. As a Senior Leader, the Vice President of Sales will drive Ashley to meet its strategic goals to ensure Ashley continues to grow and thrive.. This individual is expected to create a culture of success and ongoing business and sales achievement. The Vice President of Case Goods Sales holds the important responsibility of managing the sales team, operations, and resources to deliver profitable growth. As a member of the Ashley team, this individual should continuously strive to do their part to ensure Ashley is the best furniture company. Through passion, drive, and discipline, our employees have created a winning team where continuous improvement and customer satisfaction is at the heart of Ashley. We are committed to earning and retaining trust from both our customers and our employees, and the Vice-President should share these same values.ScopeThe Vice President of Case Goods Sales is responsible and accountable for enhancing the brand, creating alignment and accountability in the sales organization, enhancing sales talent, and executing a competitive sales strategy aimed at market growth domination.Primary Job Responsibilities:Engage EmployeesDelegate decision-making authority and task responsibility to employees based on strengths to maximize their job ownership and commitment to outcomes.Provide timely guidance and feedback to help others excel so that they become more committed to their jobs and the organization.Build and lead an engaged team that is committed to Ashley and its bottom line.Cultivate a Customer Focused CultureMake customer relationships and satisfaction the primary driving force when designing products and processes.Embrace the Ashley vision by creating an environment that inspires people to generate innovative ways to increase customer satisfaction when designing products and processes.Set high standards and accountability for customer satisfaction in all business activities at Ashley.Job Specific ResponsibilitiesEnhance the BrandMake customer satisfaction the primary focus to enhance Ashley‚Äôs recognition in the marketplace.Commit to a long-term sales strategy to enhance Ashley‚Äôs brand by analyzing information, evaluating options, and selecting the best sales strategy.Use insight into market drivers to capitalize on business opportunities that will enhance Ashley‚Äôs recognition in the marketplace.Enhance Sales TalentAttract, develop, and retain talented individuals to build a competitively superior sales organization.Provide timely guidance and feedback to help sales employees excel on the job and meet key accountabilities.Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibility to help sales employees realize their highest potential at Ashley.Create Alignment and Accountability in the Sales OrganizationCommit to a long-term strategy for increasing alignment and accountability at Ashley by analyzing information, evaluating options, and selecting the best sales strategy.Align communication, people, culture, and processes to drive flawless execution of Ashley‚Äôs objectives.Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibilities to ensure flawless execution of Ashley‚Äôs strategies.Execute Competitive Sales StrategyUse insight into market drivers to execute a competitive sales strategy that will create new business opportunities.Execute a competitive sales strategy for Ashley by aligning communication, people, culture, and processes.Leverage business knowledge and experience to drive sales strategies that will gain competitive advantage.Schedule ExpectationsFlexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary; 50% travel.Job Qualifications- **Educational Background:** Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred.- **Experience:** 10+ years of relevant experience in sales leadership, account management, or a similar role within the retail or furniture industry. Proven track record of driving customer engagement, product adoption, and achieving sales goals.- **Skills:** Exceptional leadership and team management abilities. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely. Proficiency in CRM tools and sales software. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. scalability.Lead the technical design, development, and deployment of customer experience layers across various platforms, championing best practices and efficient solutions.Embrace agile methodologies and invest in dual-track Agile Delivery models to enhance customer experiences and optimize delivery processes.Team DevelopmentBuild and mentor a high-performing engineering team, ensuring that engineers are directly aligned with key delivery areas and skillsets, fostering a collaborative environment with deep subject matter expertise.Identify and develop future leaders within the team, providing growth opportunities and a clear career path.Cross-Functional CollaborationPartner with key stakeholders, including product management, UX design, and customer operations, to align engineering initiatives with business objectives and drive strategic alignment.Collaborate closely with the Agile Delivery team to identify and address bottlenecks, constantly seeking improvements in delivery processes and cross-functional communication.Technology ManagementStay at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies, identifying opportunities to continuously improve our digital experiences and maintain our competitive edge.Ensure scalability and maintainability of solutions, leveraging global talent strategically to optimize costs and resource allocation.Be a champion for technical innovation, driving initiatives that enhance the overall customer experience and create a seamless and engaging omnichannel journey.Job Qualifications10+ years‚Äô experience of developing world-class customer-facing experiences having more than 100M sessions annually.7+ years leading and managing large cross-functional delivery teams.Strong working knowledge of modern web technologies, including modern JavaScript frameworks (such as React, Angular, or Vue.js), design systems, and content delivery networks (CDNs).Demonstrated expertise in CI/CD methodologies utilizing Kubernetes to automate and optimize deployment pipelines.Proven experience in a senior engineering leadership role within a large, customer-facing organization.Demonstrated success in developing and executing omnichannel strategies.Extensive experience with digital platforms, including websites, mobile applications, and point of sale systems.Strong knowledge of agile methodologies and experience driving agile transformations.Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and drive change across cross-functional teams.Deep understanding of customer experience, with a track record of delivering high-quality, user-centric solutions.Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Technical expertise, ideally with a background in engineering or computer science.Who Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to deliver an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a ‚ÄúGrowth Mindset‚Äù, and once you join our team, you‚Äôll learn from the best in the business.Apply today and find your home at Ashley!Compensation: Annual Salary = $175,000 - $250,000. Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to each candidate, including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job-related factors.Profit sharing is available to eligible employees; this discretionary program is dependent on the profitability of the company.Benefits: When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, 80 hours paid vacation and 40 hours of California Paid Sick Leave. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process.Ashley values its diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Director IT Digital CommerceWhat Will You Do?We are seeking a highly motivated and hands-on Director of Engineering - Digital to lead the delivery and strategy for AshleyFurniture.com, our consumer-facing mobile application, and play a key role in shaping our omnichannel strategy. This role will focus on engineering and delivering exceptional experience layers across all customer and associate touchpoints. The Director of Engineering - Digital reports to the Senior Vice President (SVP) of Retail Technology.Key ResponsibilitiesLeadership & StrategyCollaborate on and implement a comprehensive omnichannel strategy across all customer and associate touchpoints, including the standalone website, mobile application, clientelling application within stores, point of sale systems, and customer service support tools.Provide technical leadership to cross-functional engineering teams, fostering collaboration, innovation, and a culture of excellence.Set clear goals, establish KPIs, and drive continuous improvement to measure success.Engineering ExcellenceOversee the engineering and delivery of AshleyFurniture.com and the consumer-facing mobile application, ensuring high performance, reliability, and scalability.Lead the technical design, development, and deployment of customer experience layers across various platforms, championing best practices and efficient solutions.Embrace agile methodologies and invest in dual-track Agile Delivery models to enhance customer experiences and optimize delivery processes.Team DevelopmentBuild and mentor a high-performing engineering team, ensuring that engineers are directly aligned with key delivery areas and skillsets, fostering a collaborative environment with deep subject matter expertise.Identify and develop future leaders within the team, providing growth opportunities and a clear career path.Cross-Functional CollaborationPartner with key stakeholders, including product management, UX design, and customer operations, to align engineering initiatives with business objectives and drive strategic alignment.Collaborate closely with the Agile Delivery team to identify and address bottlenecks, constantly seeking improvements in delivery processes and cross-functional communication.Technology ManagementStay at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies, identifying opportunities to continuously improve our digital experiences and maintain our competitive edge.Ensure scalability and maintainability of solutions, leveraging global talent strategically to optimize costs and resource allocation.Be a champion for technical innovation, driving initiatives that enhance the overall customer experience and create a seamless and engaging omnichannel journey.Job Qualifications10+ years‚Äô experience of developing world-class customer-facing experiences having more than 100M sessions annually.7+ years leading and managing large cross-functional delivery teams.Strong working knowledge of modern web technologies, including modern JavaScript frameworks (such as React, Angular, or Vue.js), design systems, and content delivery networks (CDNs).Demonstrated expertise in CI/CD methodologies utilizing Kubernetes to automate and optimize deployment pipelines.Proven experience in a senior engineering leadership role within a large, customer-facing organization.Demonstrated success in developing and executing omnichannel strategies.Extensive experience with digital platforms, including websites, mobile applications, and point of sale systems.Strong knowledge of agile methodologies and experience driving agile transformations.Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and drive change across cross-functional teams.Deep understanding of customer experience, with a track record of delivering high-quality, user-centric solutions.Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Technical expertise, ideally with a background in engineering or computer science.Who Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. Build You Career with AshleyAre you passionate about creating extraordinary customer experiences through data-driven marketing? Join one of the world's largest furniture manufacturers and retailers as we revolutionize how we connect with our customers!Senior CDP/CRM Marketing Specialist: On-Site, Tampa FLWhat Will You Do?As our Senior CDP/CRM Marketing Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of Ashley's digital marketing initiatives, orchestrating personalized customer experiences across email, SMS, mobile app, and push notifications. This role is perfect for a marketing technologist who loves solving complex challenges and driving measurable results. Ability to adapt to a fast paced, evolving retail environment with a positive attitude.Lead Marketing Automation Initiatives: Architect and optimize customer journeys across multiple channels using advanced marketing automation platformsDrive Innovation: Design and implement sophisticated audience segmentation strategies that power personalized customer experiencesTechnical Leadership: Create and maintain custom templates using HTML, CSS, and Liquid ScriptingAnalytics & Optimization: Leverage Google Analytics and Looker to derive insights and optimize campaign performanceProject Management: Own the marketing technology project backlog and coordinate cross-functional initiativesTeam Leadership: Mentor and guide an offshore team member while collaborating with our 30-person marketing departmentWhat Do You Need?3+ years of experience in marketing technology/automationStrong expertise in CRM tools, customer data platforms, and complex audience segmentationProficiency in HTML, CSS, Liquid Scripting, Google Analytics, and LookerExperience with the platform Zeta Global, preferred not requiredBachelor's degree or equivalent work experienceRetail experience preferred, but not requiredExcellent problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environmentExperience managing cross-functional projects and stakeholder relationshipsWhy Ashley?Impact: Your work will directly influence millions of customer interactions and drive revenue for a global leaderInnovation: Be part of a digital transformation journey at a company that combines century-old tradition with cutting-edge technologyGrowth: Work with modern marketing tech stack and develop your skills across multiple channels and platformsLocation: Join our vibrant team in the heart of historic Ybor City, TampaCulture: Experience our collaborative, family-oriented culture that values innovation and personal growthThe TeamYou'll report to our Marketing Director and work alongside passionate marketing professionals who are reshaping the future of retail marketing. Vice President Engineering, Digital
linkedin Spanaway (United States) Thu, 12 De N/A
Vice President Engineering - DigitalWhat Will You Do?The VP of Engineering - Digital at Ashley Furniture plays a crucial role in driving the technological advancement of our digital experiences. Repor...
Show full description ‚ñº
Vice President Engineering - DigitalWhat Will You Do?The VP of Engineering - Digital at Ashley Furniture plays a crucial role in driving the technological advancement of our digital experiences. Reporting directly to the Senior Vice President of Retail Technology, this position requires a blend of visionary thinking and practical execution. The VP will focus on integrating and harmonizing digital touchpoints across physical stores, online platforms, and customer service tools, ensuring they operate seamlessly to enhance both customer and associate experiences.This role requires a forward-thinking leader with a strong background in digital commerce and a passion for customer-centric strategies.Primary Job FunctionsStrategic Technology Leadership: Develop and implement a comprehensive tech strategy that aligns with both immediate and long-term business goals.Architectural Oversight and Innovation: Lead the design and innovation of technology architecture focused on retail and e-commerce experiences.Integration of Retail Technologies: Ensure cohesive integration of technologies within retail operations and broader corporate systems.Team Leadership and Development: Mentor and lead a team of technology professionals, fostering skill development and innovation.Executive Team Collaboration: Participate in executive decision-making, aligning technology initiatives with overall business strategy.Technology Evaluation and Decision-Making: Review and approve new technology implementations and acquisitions.Emerging Technology Analysis: Stay abreast of emerging technologies and trends, assessing their potential impact and application in retail.Facilitate Vendor Selection: Identify and recommend potential technology vendors for initial engagements and partnerships.Budget Oversight and Resource Allocation: Oversee technology-related budget considerations, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.Risk Management and Mitigation: Proactively identify and address technological risks to the business.Compliance and Security Protocols: Ensure adherence to legal standards, security protocols, and best practices in technology.Guide Organizational Change: Lead the organization through technological transitions, focusing on change management strategies.Stakeholder Engagement and Alignment: Engage with business units to align technology solutions with their needs and goals.Direct Data Strategy Initiatives: Guide the development and management of data strategies to support business decisions.Enhance Customer Experience Through Technology: Utilize technology to innovate and improve the customer journey in retail.Facilitate Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ensure technology initiatives support and enhance broader business operations.Foster a Culture of Continuous Improvement: Promote learning, adaptation, and innovation within the technology department.Adapt and Future-Proof Technology Strategy: Continuously adapt technology strategy to meet evolving business needs and market changes.Secondary Job FunctionsMonitor Industry Best Practices: Stay informed about best practices in IT and retail technology, ensuring Ashley Furniture remains at the forefront.Collaborate on Corporate Technology Initiatives: Participate in broader corporate technology projects that may extend beyond the retail division.Sustainability and Environmental Impact: Advocate for and integrate sustainable technology practices that reduce environmental impact.Promote IT Governance: Implement and promote strong IT governance structures to ensure consistency and quality in technology-related decisions.Community and Industry Engagement: Represent Ashley Furniture in technology forums, conferences, and industry groups, enhancing the company's tech reputation.Internal Technology Advocacy and Education: Educate internal stakeholders about the benefits and potential of new technologies and digital transformation.Employee Technology Training and Development: Oversee programs for continuous learning and upskilling of employees in technology-related areas.Schedule ExpectationsTravel Requirements: Be prepared for moderate domestic and international travel as required by the role. Likely includes annual visit to India, and quarterly visit to domestic facilities.Time Zone Adaptability: Ability to adapt to varying time zones and maintain productivity with domestic and international teams.Work-Life Balance: Maintain a healthy work-life balance while managing work demands and travel requirements.Job CompetenciesEthics and Values: Strong commitment to ethical principles and values, ensuring decisions and actions align with the company‚Äôs standards and expectations.Integrity and Trustworthiness: Demonstrated integrity and trustworthiness, fostering a transparent and honest work environment.Accountability and Responsibility: Taking ownership of tasks and outcomes.Adaptability and Resilience: Effectively handling challenges and change in the workplace.Collaboration: Working well with others to achieve shared goals.Decision-Making: Utilizing data-driven insights and sound judgment for effective decision-making.Emotional Intelligence: Displaying empathy and understanding in interactions with colleagues and customers.Proactive Problem-Solving: Identifying potential issues and implementing solutions.Continuous Learning and Growth: Embracing opportunities for personal and professional development.Job Qualifications10+ years‚Äô experience of developing world-class customer-facing experiences having more than 100M sessions annually.7+ years leading and managing large cross-functional delivery teams.Proven experience in a senior engineering leadership role within a large, customer-facing organization.Strong working knowledge of modern web technologies, including modern JavaScript frameworks (such as React, Angular, or Vue.js), design systems, and content delivery networks (CDNs).Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools and processes, including container orchestration with Kubernetes.Strong knowledge of agile methodologies and experience driving agile transformationsAbility to manage and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a ‚ÄúGrowth Mindset‚Äù, and once you join our team, you‚Äôll learn from the best in the business.Apply today and find your home at Ashley!Compensation: Annual Salary = $200,000 - $250,000 plus bonus. Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to each candidate, including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job-related factors.Profit sharing is available to eligible employees; this discretionary program is dependent on the profitability of the company.Benefits: When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, 80 hours paid vacation and 40 hours of California Paid Sick Leave. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process.Ashley values its diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made on the basis of an individual‚Äôs skills, qualifications, merit, and business need.

Field Manager of Licensee Sales
linkedin United States Fri, 05 De N/A
**Build Your Career with Ashley** **Field Manager of Licensee Sales** **What Will You Do?** * Conduct ongoing location visits to identify and support the licensee in product training, merchandising...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Build Your Career with Ashley** **Field Manager of Licensee Sales** **What Will You Do?** * Conduct ongoing location visits to identify and support the licensee in product training, merchandising and product assortments, partner on velocity walks and help support any additional areas of opportunity to help grow wholesale sales. * Supports licensee new store openings and grand re-openings. Participates in new licensee onboarding. * Participates in operational strategy meetings to devise execute best practices or improvement plans to address region licensee needs or correct identified issues. * Ensures licensees in district remain in compliance with the TUA. Monitors brand standards, including product and visual, through a rigorous protocol of field visits and licensee self-reporting to help improve and continually enhance brand equity in the licensee community. * Fosters the licensee network communication process, including field reports, weekly newsletters, quarterly business strategy meetings and reporting protocols. Maintains strong relationships with the region licensees. Resolves licensee issues and concerns. * Attends Markets to help introduce licensees to new products and programs. * Participates in quarterly Licensee Sales meetings to provide team building and support to licensees. * Assists in the support of Tier 2-5 licensees as needed. Works as part of a team, plus on occasion will engage in deeper dives into problematic areas or developing opportunities as a member of a ‚Äústrike force‚Äù approach. * Promotes the Ashley brand image through active involvement in community associations and events, such as the Chamber of Commerce, Kiwanis, or Rotary Club or volunteer organizations. * Demonstrates the company‚Äôs core and growth values in performance of all job functions. **What Do You Need?** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree required in Business Administration, Management, Marketing or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. * Three to five years of retail sales and sales management or distribution center experience. Preferably with experience in furniture retail and fulfillment-based operations employing a license or franchise model. * Visual Merchandising, Furniture or Training experience a plus. * Exceptional knowledge of retail, sales and training operations processes. * Willingness to travel 80% * Ability to facilitate training and/ or presentations in front of small and large audiences. * Strong business acumen, with demonstrated knowledge of finance, management, marketing and merchandising. * Knowledge of licensed business owner or franchise law. * Knowledge of training management and improvement methods and tools. * Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to dig deep into the data and then turning that insight into action to drive results. * Outstanding leadership skills, with the ability to build an inspiring culture through vision, empowerment and development. * Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to organize thoughts, communicate clearly, completely and concisely. * Strong project/resource management and organizational skills, with the ability to consistently meet demanding deadlines. * Strong skills in relationship management and coaching that result in the accomplishment of goals. * Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities change on short notice. * Strong skills in MS Office Suite or similar office software. **Who Are We?** At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry. Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a ‚ÄúGrowth Mindset‚Äù, and once you join our team, you‚Äôll learn from the best in the business. Apply today and find your home at Ashley! **Benefits We Offer** * Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program * Paid Vacation (80 Hours), Holidays, and Your Birthday off * Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings * Professional Development Opportunities * Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism * Telehealth * 401(k) and Profit Sharing * Life Insurance **Our Core Values** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/ *We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.*
Regional Sales Manager, Electronics
linkedin Las Vegas (Venezuela) Tue, 02 De N/A
**About Us** Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We‚Äôve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for ove...
Show full description ‚ñº
**About Us** Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We‚Äôve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance. **Position Summary** The Regional Sales Manager for Electronics will lead sales initiatives across designated territories within Ashley's corporately owned retail markets. This role is responsible for driving brick-and-mortar sales performance of our Electronics category, ensuring seamless integration of electronics offerings into the customer shopping experience across all specified locations. **Primary Job Functions** **Sales Leadership & Territory Management** * Drive Electronics category sales performance across assigned corporate retail territories * Develop and execute regional sales strategies to maximize Electronics penetration in brick-and-mortar stores * Lead, coach, and develop store teams to integrate Electronics selling into the customer journey * Monitor and analyze sales metrics, market trends, and competitive landscape to identify growth opportunities * Establish and maintain sales targets, KPIs, and performance benchmarks for the region **Training & Development** * Ensure consistent execution of Electronics selling techniques across all locations * Train store teams to naturally incorporate Electronics into customer conversations throughout the sales journey * Develop and implement best practices for Electronics product presentation * Conduct regular store visits to provide hands-on coaching and support **Operational Excellence** * Ensure compliance with Electronics program standard operating procedures (SOPs) * Maintain product accuracy and consistency across all regional locations * Collaborate with merchandising and operations teams to optimize Electronics category performance * Partner with vendors to maximize training and sales opportunities **Strategic Planning** * Identify market-specific opportunities and challenges within assigned territories * Provide feedback and insights to leadership on market conditions, customer preferences, and competitive activities * Support new store openings and Electronics category expansions **Secondary Job Functions** 1. Maintain reliable attendance. 2. Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup. 3. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested. **Job Qualifications** **Education:** * Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing, or related field or equivalent work experience, Required **Experience:** * 5+ years of experience in Sales Management, preferably in consumer electronics or home furnishing, Required * Muti Unit Management experience, Preferred * Consumer Electronics or Home Furnishings experience, Preferred **Licenses or Certifications** * None **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities** * Strong attention to detail * Excellent verbal and written communication skills * Excellent interpersonal skills * Effective time management and organizational skills * Work independently as well as in a team environment * Document management system * Analytical and problem solving skills * Maintain confidentiality * Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement * Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints * Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet * Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment * Work professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respect * Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers * Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries **Schedule Expectations** 1. This position will be required to travel frequently (up to 75%). 2. Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary. **Job Competencies** 1. **Results-Oriented**: Consistently achieves and exceeds sales targets 2. **Leadership**: Inspires and motivates teams to perform at their best 3. **Customer-Focused**: Understands customer needs and delivers exceptional experiences 4. **Analytical Thinking**: Uses data to drive decisions and identify opportunities 5. **Communication**: Effectively communicates vision, expectations, and feedback 6. **Adaptability**: Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving retail environment **Our Core Values** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: **Corporate Social Responsibility** **https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/**

Retail Marketing Specialist
linkedin Tampa (United States) Wed, 26 No N/A
**About Us** Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We‚Äôve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for ove...
Show full description ‚ñº
**About Us** Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We‚Äôve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance. **Position Summary** The Retail Experience Marketing Specialist is responsible for ensuring an exceptional in-store experience across bedding and electronics categories. This role manages all aspects of retail marketing execution, including signage coordination, vendor communication, store audits, and compliance with set standards. The specialist will serve as a key liaison between marketing, visual merchandising, vendors, and retail locations to ensure timely delivery and proper placement of all point-of-purchase (POP) materials. **Key Responsibilities** **Signage Execution** o Coordinate ordering and delivery of signage for scheduled remodels, new store openings, and bedding or electronics campaigns. o Brief in-store campaign POP assets, including signage placement and in-store video assets. o Work with marketing to ensure all signage aligns with brand strategy and meets established standards. o Maintain mattress gallery standards guide. **Vendor & Store Coordination** o Partner with construction team, merchants and vendors confirm timely shipment and arrival of marketing materials. o Communicate with store teams to ensure proper POP placement and adherence to visual standards. **Store Audits & Compliance** o Conduct store audits to verify compliance with bedding and electronics visual standards. o Provide detailed recaps and action plans for stores needing updates or corrections. ¬∑ Order Management o Process bedding request forms submitted by stores for missing items required to meet standards. o Place orders for additional signage or materials as needed to maintain compliance. **Qualifications** ¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Merchandising or related field (or equivalent experience). ¬∑ 3+ years of experience in retail marketing, visual merchandising, or related role. ¬∑ Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines. ¬∑ Excellent communication and vendor management skills. ¬∑ Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; experience with project management tools a plus. ¬∑ Ability to travel for store audits and openings 50% of the time. **Key Competencies** ¬∑ Detail-oriented and highly organized. ¬∑ Strong problem-solving and follow-through skills. ¬∑ Collaborative team player with ability to work cross-functionally. ¬∑ Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. **Our Core Values** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: **Corporate Social Responsibility** **https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/** We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.
Marketing Coordinator
linkedin Tampa (United States) Fri, 24 Oc N/A
The Marketing Coordinator works directly with marketing management to drive brand awareness and intent to visit Ashley HomeStores. The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for providing **Storis** ope...
Show full description ‚ñº
The Marketing Coordinator works directly with marketing management to drive brand awareness and intent to visit Ashley HomeStores. The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for providing **Storis** operational support and general assistance to the marketing department in the day-to-day management of marketing initiatives. This position works closely with internal stakeholders across multiple disciplines and outside agencies to ensure communications and promotions are aligned with marketing objectives. The Marketing Coordinator is accountable for the continued growth of awareness, engagement and visitation by implementing strategies of marketing initiatives. **Primary Job Functions:** 1. Storis expert for the marketing team that serves as liaison for all departments. 2. Facilitate the creative process, including submitting work requests, reviewing changes and routing for approval. 3. Work closely with various departments to ensure marketing campaigns are deployed as planned. 4. Provide project management for all assigned projects, ensuring deadlines are met and projects progress in a timely fashion. 5. Pull campaign results, update reporting and assist with campaign analysis. 6. Contribute to brainstorming, consistently monitoring competitive landscape and marketing trends in order to make effective recommendations. 7. Communicate effectively with other members of the marketing team to meet department goals. 8. Establish and maintain effective communication and working relations with internal and external partners in order to secure and maintain their cooperation for assistance with special events and promotional programs. 9. Coordinate the creation and printing of all internal marketing material requests. 10. Provide administrative support for the marketing department; schedule meetings, order and maintain office supplies, coordinate events, book travel, submit expense reports, etc. 11. Demonstrate the Company‚Äôs Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions **Secondary Job Functions:** 1. May be responsible for store assistance and support when necessary for events such as grand openings or other special events. 2. Maintain reliable attendance. 3. Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup. 4. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested. **Education:** Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising or related field, or equivalent work experience, Required **Experience:** 1 year experience in Marketing, Required **Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:** ‚Ä¢ Storis ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of standard concepts, practice and procedures associated with online and offline marketing efforts ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of branding, marketing and advertising principles ‚Ä¢ Flawless execution and excellent attention to detail ‚Ä¢ Project management and presentation skills ‚Ä¢ Effectively work in a cross-functional team environment ‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills ‚Ä¢ Effective time management and organizational skills ‚Ä¢ Work independently as well as in a team environment ‚Ä¢ Document management system ‚Ä¢ Analytical and problem solving skills ‚Ä¢ Maintain confidentiality ‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement ‚Ä¢ Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints ‚Ä¢ Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet ‚Ä¢ Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities changes on short notice ‚Ä¢ Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment ‚Ä¢ Work professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respect ‚Ä¢ Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers ‚Ä¢ Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries **Schedule Expectations:** 1. Occasional Domestic Travel 2. Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary. **Job Competencies:** 1. Ethics and values 2. Integrity and trust

Maintains strong relationships with the region licensees. Resolves licensee issues and concerns. * Attends Markets to help introduce licensees to new products and programs. * Participates in quarterly Licensee Sales meetings to provide team building and support to licensees. * Assists in the support of Tier 2-5 licensees as needed. Works as part of a team, plus on occasion will engage in deeper dives into problematic areas or developing opportunities as a member of a ‚Äústrike force‚Äù approach. * Promotes the Ashley brand image through active involvement in community associations and events, such as the Chamber of Commerce, Kiwanis, or Rotary Club or volunteer organizations. * Demonstrates the company‚Äôs core and growth values in performance of all job functions. **What Do You Need?** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree required in Business Administration, Management, Marketing or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. * Three to five years of retail sales and sales management or distribution center experience. Preferably with experience in furniture retail and fulfillment-based operations employing a license or franchise model. * Visual Merchandising, Furniture or Training experience a plus. * Exceptional knowledge of retail, sales and training operations processes. * Willingness to travel 80% * Ability to facilitate training and/ or presentations in front of small and large audiences. * Strong business acumen, with demonstrated knowledge of finance, management, marketing and merchandising. * Knowledge of licensed business owner or franchise law. * Knowledge of training management and improvement methods and tools. * Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to dig deep into the data and then turning that insight into action to drive results. * Outstanding leadership skills, with the ability to build an inspiring culture through vision, empowerment and development. * Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to organize thoughts, communicate clearly, completely and concisely. * Strong project/resource management and organizational skills, with the ability to consistently meet demanding deadlines. * Strong skills in relationship management and coaching that result in the accomplishment of goals. * Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities change on short notice. * Strong skills in MS Office Suite or similar office software. **Who Are We?** At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry. Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a ‚ÄúGrowth Mindset‚Äù, and once you join our team, you‚Äôll learn from the best in the business. Apply today and find your home at Ashley! **Benefits We Offer** * Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program * Paid Vacation (80 Hours), Holidays, and Your Birthday off * Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings * Professional Development Opportunities * Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism * Telehealth * 401(k) and Profit Sharing * Life Insurance **Our Core Values** * Honesty & Integrity * Passion, Drive, Discipline * Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence * Dirty Fingernail * Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/ *We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.*

**Build Your Career with Ashley** **Field Manager of Licensee Sales** **What Will You Do?** * Conduct ongoing location visits to identify and support the licensee in product training, merchandising and product assortments, partner on velocity walks and help support any additional areas of opportunity to help grow wholesale sales. * Supports licensee new store openings and grand re-openings. Participates in new licensee onboarding. * Participates in operational strategy meetings to devise execute best practices or improvement plans to address region licensee needs or correct identified issues. * Ensures licensees in district remain in compliance with the TUA. Monitors brand standards, including product and visual, through a rigorous protocol of field visits and licensee self-reporting to help improve and continually enhance brand equity in the licensee community. * Fosters the licensee network communication process, including field reports, weekly newsletters, quarterly business strategy meetings and reporting protocols. Maintains strong relationships with the region licensees. Resolves licensee issues and concerns. * Attends Markets to help introduce licensees to new products and programs. * Participates in quarterly Licensee Sales meetings to provide team building and support to licensees. * Assists in the support of Tier 2-5 licensees as needed. Works as part of a team, plus on occasion will engage in deeper dives into problematic areas or developing opportunities as a member of a ‚Äústrike force‚Äù approach. * Promotes the Ashley brand image through active involvement in community associations and events, such as the Chamber of Commerce, Kiwanis, or Rotary Club or volunteer organizations. * Demonstrates the company‚Äôs core and growth values in performance of all job functions. **What Do You Need?** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree required in Business Administration, Management, Marketing or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. * Three to five years of retail sales and sales management or distribution center experience. Preferably with experience in furniture retail and fulfillment-based operations employing a license or franchise model. * Visual Merchandising, Furniture or Training experience a plus. * Exceptional knowledge of retail, sales and training operations processes. * Willingness to travel 80% * Ability to facilitate training and/ or presentations in front of small and large audiences. * Strong business acumen, with demonstrated knowledge of finance, management, marketing and merchandising. * Knowledge of licensed business owner or franchise law. * Knowledge of training management and improvement methods and tools. * Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to dig deep into the data and then turning that insight into action to drive results. * Outstanding leadership skills, with the ability to build an inspiring culture through vision, empowerment and development. * Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to organize thoughts, communicate clearly, completely and concisely. * Strong project/resource management and organizational skills, with the ability to consistently meet demanding deadlines. * Strong skills in relationship management and coaching that result in the accomplishment of goals. * Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities change on short notice. * Strong skills in MS Office Suite or similar office software. **Who Are We?** At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family.
