Sales Manager
linkedin Scottsdale (United States) Wed, 23 Ap N/A
For over 75 years, Ashley Furniture has been the largest home furnishings manufacturer, transforming homes worldwide. With our customer base continuously growing, we are expanding our reach by opening...
Show full description ‚ñº
For over 75 years, Ashley Furniture has been the largest home furnishings manufacturer, transforming homes worldwide. With our customer base continuously growing, we are expanding our reach by opening more stores to meet the increasing demand. Our dedication to quality, style, and affordability has solidified our reputation as a trusted and recognized brand worldwide.Purpose at AshleyThe Sales Manager holds primary responsibility for managing and driving sales and margin within the retail store, aligning with the financial plan by overseeing a sales team. In addition to driving sales, the Sales Manager supports the Store Manager in fostering a high-performing sales culture, strategically managing talent, and recruiting and developing sales staff while embodying Ashley‚Äôs Culture and Vision to enhance brand perception and become the go-to destination for home furnishing needs. Serving as a role model for guest relationship-building, the Sales Manager leads and develops retail sales associates in executing the Company‚Äôs sales approach, manages store operations such as opening and closing procedures, and ensures compliance with policies and procedures to deliver an exceptional in-store experience. Without the Store Manager, the Sales Manager may assume full leadership responsibilities for the store.What You‚Äôll DoRecruit, onboard, train, and motivate sales associates while fostering a positive work environment conducive to high performance and low turnover.Conduct performance reviews, offer ongoing coaching, and facilitate strategic engagement activities such as huddles to align store decisions with company strategy.Lead store sales associates to meet sales and profit goals while fostering a high-performing sales culture aligned with company strategy.Facilitate promotional events and provide daily sales training and product education, ensuring consistent and strategic selling to maximize results and uphold company standards.Utilize analytics and insights to create targeted selling development plans for retail sales associates, providing relevant insights on offers, assortment, and selling processes.Ensure consistent store maintenance and adherence to standards throughout, optimizing assortment and maintaining a visible presence on the floor to drive business ethically.Cultivate a customer-centric culture within the store, emphasizing the importance of prioritizing customer satisfaction.Empower the team to address customer issues promptly and empathetically, ensuring efficient resolution.Track and analyze customer feedback to identify areas for improvement and enhance the overall customer experience.Serve as a role model of Ashley's culture and vision, embodying the company's values and principles in all interactions.Manage customer engagement throughout the entire lifecycle, fostering strong relationships and maximizing customer satisfaction at every touchpoint.Complete any additional tasks as assigned by management.What You BringAssociate degree in Business Administration or related field or equivalent work experience required2 years‚Äô experience in retail sales requiredSupervisory/Management experience requiredStrong business knowledge with basic financial acumenFlexible and willing to work extended hours when necessaryAbility to work weekends and holidaysExcellent interpersonal skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsEffective time management and organizational skillsAnalytical and problem-solving skillsProficient mobile & computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internetWhat‚Äôs In It for YouWhen you join us, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs, which include:Health, dental benefits, and vision insuranceEmployee Discount from 10% - 30%Life/Disability InsuranceFlex Spending Account401KPaid Time Off & HolidaysPaid BirthdayLearn more about who we are and the causes we support hereApply now and find your home at Ashley!
Senior Director of Merchandising - Rugs, Lighting, Art, Accessories, Textiles
linkedin Tampa (United States) Fri, 27 De N/A
Senior Director of Merchandising - Rugs, Lighting, Art, Accessories, TextilesWhat Will You Do?The Senior Director, Merchandising is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution o...
Show full description ‚ñº
Senior Director of Merchandising - Rugs, Lighting, Art, Accessories, TextilesWhat Will You Do?The Senior Director, Merchandising is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of business priorities through the facilitation of product development inclusive of the collection, coordination, collation, management, and the utilization of a category product development input process for multiple product categories for the company.Key Responsibilities:Strategic LeadershipThis position will work with Merchandising leadership to formulate and guide the category development strategy for assigned product categories.Additionally, the Senior Director, Merchandising is responsible for working with a variety of internal and external teams and senior executives utilizing a data input-based process in developing the category product development strategy.The role of the Senior Director, Merchandising is to drive Ashley to meet its strategic goals to ensure Ashley continues to grow and thrive.Directly lead and inspire a team of Category Merchants, coordinating and managing the work of employees by directing members of the team to meet the area‚Äôs goals. Audit regularly to ensure standard operating procedures are being adhered to.Merchandising ExecutionDetermine appropriate competitive strategies to drive category product development, good/better/best quality merchandise assortment and quantity, purchase, pricing, margin, promotion and clearance to complement the other product categories and maximize return of advertising investment.Review and analyze consumer demographic and psychographic characteristics, fashion trends, retail landscape and other relevant data to stylistically interpret, financially plan for and react to emerging market trends and conditions.Analyze and interpret sales data and customer feedback to continuously improve merchandising and assorting strategies.Develop KPIs and metrics to measure the effectiveness of merchandising efforts and make data-driven decisions.Travel to retail store locations to conduct velocity walks; review and evaluate product mix and gain insight regarding quality or other issues and translate those findings into executable plans.Provide product development recommendations to the in-house design team; bring fresh perspectives to the table that reflect price point and design trend needs.Travel domestically and internationally to corporate, manufacturing plants, trade shows, markets and other events to observe market trends, gather product information, examine product quality and other attributes; select merchandise and establish business relationships with viable vendors, if necessary.Serve as the product merchandise advocate for the enterprise stores as well as the licensee network.Collaboration and Cross-Functional IntegrationSupport marketing for promotion collateral development, as well as promotional calendar and market calendar reconciliation.Partner with Store Design and Visual Presentation Teams to participate, as needed, in planogram and display concept set-up, as well as new store set-up.Report to the executive team on the ‚Äústate of the category‚Äù using financial analysis and other fact-based data in terms of current performance, new styles, trends, promotions, best sellers, etc.Training and DevelopmentProvide educational material to the field through launch process.Develop training programs for in-store teams to ensure consistency and excellence in visual merchandising across all locations.Mentor and develop the visual merchandising team, providing opportunities for growth and skill enhancement.Team Leadership & People DevelopmentCommunicate company and departmental issues and goals and facilitate employee growth and development through weekly team meetings, regular individual employee meetings, coaching, training, and company-offered learning opportunities.Make employment decisions and/or recommendations on hiring, improvement plans, transfers, promotions, corrective actions, terminations, pay adjustments, etc.Manage employee performance and assist employees in making improvements to their performance through coaching, mentoring and administering performance reviews. Recommend, plan and/or implement employee training and skill development activities.Qualifications:Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degreeExperience: 10 years‚Äô experience in purchasing, buying, merchandising, brand management, marketing or related field, preferably in home case goods in multiple, global locations, RequiredSkills:Strong attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent interpersonal skillsEffective time management and organizational skillsWork independently as well as in a team environmentDocument management systemAnalytical and problem solving skillsMaintain confidentialityWorking knowledge of Continuous ImprovementHandle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraintsProficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internetStrong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities changes on short noticePerform under strong demands in a fast-paced environmentWork professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respectDisplay empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customersRespond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiriesPhysical Requirements:Ability to travel to various retail locations as required.Ability to lift and move merchandise and fixtures as needed.Additional Information:This position may require periodic travel to retail locations and industry events.Who Are We?At Ashley, we‚Äôre more than a business‚Ä¶we‚Äôre family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We‚Äôre problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It‚Äôs the reason we‚Äôre always searching for better ways to deliver an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Showroom Sales Associate
linkedin San Francisco (Argentina) Tue, 11 No N/A
BASIC FUNCTION The Sales Associate has the primary responsibility to maximize sales volume by growing existing business, developing new business, and providing the best possible customer service whil...
Show full description ‚ñº
BASIC FUNCTION The Sales Associate has the primary responsibility to maximize sales volume by growing existing business, developing new business, and providing the best possible customer service while enhancing Baker‚Äôs mission to offer the highest quality and service standards in the industry. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Customer Communication ‚Ä¢ Greet customers in a friendly, professional manner and in a timely fashion (5 minutes or less). ‚Ä¢ Assist all customers as called in rotation. ‚Ä¢ Create and maintain quotations for customers who come into the Showroom or who call for information. ‚Ä¢ Follow up on all quotations within one week and on a weekly basis. ‚Ä¢ Inform customers of price increases two weeks prior to the increase occurring. ‚Ä¢ Inform customers of discontinued product, extended lead times, etc. ‚Ä¢ Provide customers with product information. ‚Ä¢ Follow up with a thank you note or phone call to all new customers who come into the Showroom. ‚Ä¢ Assist the designer‚Äôs client when the designer is unavailable. ‚Ä¢ Assist end users when available or when requested by the manager. ‚Ä¢ Always maintain professional courtesy with associates and customers. ‚Ä¢ Consistently practice proper telephone etiquette. ‚Ä¢ Return phone calls within 24 hours. ‚Ä¢ Communicate with Showroom receptionist as to whereabouts if absent from Showroom. Order Entry ‚Ä¢ Enter all orders into the system within 24 hours of receipt of the deposit or the purchase order (for net 30 accounts). Include all necessary information on the purchase order (i.e., customer information, delivery information, product options, pricing, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Provide an adequate explanation to the customer for all denials of special requests on product and/or delivery dates. Customer Service ‚Ä¢ Review the purchase order once it is generated and confirm its receipt by the factory. Return checked purchase orders to the Customer Service Associate within 24 hours. ‚Ä¢ Check factory acknowledgments and verify that the product has been ordered correctly. Report to the Customer Service Associate any incorrect acknowledgment with corrections in writing. ‚Ä¢ Track receipt by factory of COM (customer‚Äôs own material) fabric, finish samples or any other materials required for completion of order. ‚Ä¢ Review the Open Order Report and address any problems. ‚Ä¢ Send thank you cards to customers after placing an order. ‚Ä¢ Call customers periodically with updated information regarding status of the order. ‚Ä¢ Once the product is shipped, contact customers to ensure the product and the service are acceptable. ‚Ä¢ Partnering with Regional Account Coordinator, alert customers when product arrives at the distribution center that a remaining balance invoice will be sent. Inform customers that their payment may be sent prior to 2 receiving the invoice for more timely receipt of product. Apprise Net 30 customers when product arrives at distribution center and notify that shipment to the local receiver will occur shortly. ‚Ä¢ Assist Regional Account Coordinator in handling customer claims; monitor progress of customer complaint resolutions and communicate updates to customers. Customer Development and Maintenance ‚Ä¢ Provide personal accounts with information regarding current and upcoming Showroom events and sales. ‚Ä¢ Provide customers with materials and catalogues for their libraries. ‚Ä¢ Participate in design-oriented events to ensure visibility and contact with current and potential customers. ‚Ä¢ Maintain updated customer information including contact data, special interests, etc. ‚Ä¢ Maintain updated calendar of customer special dates (events, installations, publications, etc.). ‚Ä¢ Identify and implement ways to prospect new customers and increase conversion of turns to personal accounts. Showroom Responsibilities ‚Ä¢ Assist in the display maintenance of the showroom to ensure optimum showroom appearance. ‚Ä¢ Assist other Sales Associates as necessary or as directed by the Showroom Manager. ‚Ä¢ Assist in the maintenance of samples, tear sheets and resource files. ‚Ä¢ Assist in product training and mentoring of new Sales Associates. ‚Ä¢ Ensure catalogs and price lists are up to date. ‚Ä¢ Product Knowledge ‚Ä¢ Maintain knowledge of all vendor products, pricing, options, finishes, details, etc. ‚Ä¢ Maintain thorough, up-to-date knowledge of all products, pricing, and local competition. EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's Degree Preferred. Candidate will possess previous 3-5 years of high-end sales/customer experience, preferably in the furniture/design industry. Basic knowledge of the history of furniture design (periods, styles, designers, etc.) is preferred. Baker is an equal opportunity employer.

BASIC FUNCTION The Sales Associate has the primary responsibility to maximize sales volume by growing existing business, developing new business, and providing the best possible customer service while enhancing Baker‚Äôs mission to offer the highest quality and service standards in the industry. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Customer Communication ‚Ä¢ Greet customers in a friendly, professional manner and in a timely fashion (5 minutes or less). ‚Ä¢ Assist all customers as called in rotation. ‚Ä¢ Create and maintain quotations for customers who come into the Showroom or who call for information. ‚Ä¢ Follow up on all quotations within one week and on a weekly basis. ‚Ä¢ Inform customers of price increases two weeks prior to the increase occurring. ‚Ä¢ Inform customers of discontinued product, extended lead times, etc. ‚Ä¢ Provide customers with product information. ‚Ä¢ Follow up with a thank you note or phone call to all new customers who come into the Showroom. ‚Ä¢ Assist the designer‚Äôs client when the designer is unavailable. ‚Ä¢ Assist end users when available or when requested by the manager. ‚Ä¢ Always maintain professional courtesy with associates and customers. ‚Ä¢ Consistently practice proper telephone etiquette. ‚Ä¢ Return phone calls within 24 hours. ‚Ä¢ Communicate with Showroom receptionist as to whereabouts if absent from Showroom. Order Entry ‚Ä¢ Enter all orders into the system within 24 hours of receipt of the deposit or the purchase order (for net 30 accounts). Include all necessary information on the purchase order (i.e., customer information, delivery information, product options, pricing, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Provide an adequate explanation to the customer for all denials of special requests on product and/or delivery dates. Customer Service ‚Ä¢ Review the purchase order once it is generated and confirm its receipt by the factory. Return checked purchase orders to the Customer Service Associate within 24 hours. ‚Ä¢ Check factory acknowledgments and verify that the product has been ordered correctly. Report to the Customer Service Associate any incorrect acknowledgment with corrections in writing. ‚Ä¢ Track receipt by factory of COM (customer‚Äôs own material) fabric, finish samples or any other materials required for completion of order. ‚Ä¢ Review the Open Order Report and address any problems. ‚Ä¢ Send thank you cards to customers after placing an order. ‚Ä¢ Call customers periodically with updated information regarding status of the order. ‚Ä¢ Once the product is shipped, contact customers to ensure the product and the service are acceptable. ‚Ä¢ Partnering with Regional Account Coordinator, alert customers when product arrives at the distribution center that a remaining balance invoice will be sent. Inform customers that their payment may be sent prior to 2 receiving the invoice for more timely receipt of product. Apprise Net 30 customers when product arrives at distribution center and notify that shipment to the local receiver will occur shortly. ‚Ä¢ Assist Regional Account Coordinator in handling customer claims; monitor progress of customer complaint resolutions and communicate updates to customers. Customer Development and Maintenance ‚Ä¢ Provide personal accounts with information regarding current and upcoming Showroom events and sales. ‚Ä¢ Provide customers with materials and catalogues for their libraries. ‚Ä¢ Participate in design-oriented events to ensure visibility and contact with current and potential customers. ‚Ä¢ Maintain updated customer information including contact data, special interests, etc. ‚Ä¢ Maintain updated calendar of customer special dates (events, installations, publications, etc.). ‚Ä¢ Identify and implement ways to prospect new customers and increase conversion of turns to personal accounts. Showroom Responsibilities ‚Ä¢ Assist in the display maintenance of the showroom to ensure optimum showroom appearance. ‚Ä¢ Assist other Sales Associates as necessary or as directed by the Showroom Manager. ‚Ä¢ Assist in the maintenance of samples, tear sheets and resource files. ‚Ä¢ Assist in product training and mentoring of new Sales Associates. ‚Ä¢ Ensure catalogs and price lists are up to date. ‚Ä¢ Product Knowledge ‚Ä¢ Maintain knowledge of all vendor products, pricing, options, finishes, details, etc. ‚Ä¢ Maintain thorough, up-to-date knowledge of all products, pricing, and local competition. EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's Degree Preferred. Candidate will possess previous 3-5 years of high-end sales/customer experience, preferably in the furniture/design industry. Basic knowledge of the history of furniture design (periods, styles, designers, etc.) is preferred. Baker is an equal opportunity employer.

Show full description ‚ñº
**The Opportunity**Our retail expansion in the primary markets starts with hiring the best leaders. As a Sales/Operations Manager, you will focus on operational activities to grow the business. You will promote the Ballard Designs brand at every guest encounter and ensure your stellar team exemplifies brand values, standards, and experience. The dynamic energy from your leadership will increase company programs, increase sales, and set your store to exceed all expectations. You will report to the store leader. Your hiring location is **Tampa, Florida****Who We Are**Since 1982, Ballard Designs has offered a unique curation of home furnishings and‚ÄØd√©cor‚ÄØfrom all periods and provenance. Its designers travel the world for inspiration, translating the latest fashion, color, and style trends into finely crafted products not found anywhere else. Ballard Designs is part of the Cornerstone brands - four interactive, aspirational home and apparel lifestyle brands that deliver inspirations that help customers enjoy, enhance, and celebrate life. **Your Impact** * Perform a variety of operational activities, including scheduling, inventory management, backroom organization & store maintenance * Experience with 'Division of Responsibility' understanding, competent in merchandise flow processes, including inspecting and receiving new merchandise and entering data into the inventory management system * Manage the performance of the associates and provide feedback. * Assure all back areas meet company standards of cleanliness and a safe work environment **What You Bring** * 3+ years of shipping and receiving management experience in the specialty retail industry * Proficiency using Microsoft Word, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets), Outlook, Workday, Kronos, and POS Systems * Lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 50lbs * Availability to work flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays Remote work is not permitted in NYC currently. #Onsite Our Total Rewards package includes benefits you‚Äôll love such as competitive compensation, paid time off, an employee assistance program, parental leave, paid volunteer hours, and amazing company discounts! In our US market, you can also expect health care benefits starting on day 1, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement benefits. QVC Group is committed to inclusion and belonging for all and ensuring that our workplace provides equal employment opportunities for all team members and candidates and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. As an equal opportunity employer, QVC Group is committed to a barrier-free employment process. If you need reasonable accommodations/support throughout, please contact us at workwithus@qvcgrp.com for assistance. If provided, salary ranges are a general guideline only, and actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate's qualifications, skills, experience, and geographic location as well as business and market conditions.

Your hiring location is **Tampa, Florida****Who We Are**Since 1982, Ballard Designs has offered a unique curation of home furnishings and‚ÄØd√©cor‚ÄØfrom all periods and provenance. Its designers travel the world for inspiration, translating the latest fashion, color, and style trends into finely crafted products not found anywhere else. Ballard Designs is part of the Cornerstone brands - four interactive, aspirational home and apparel lifestyle brands that deliver inspirations that help customers enjoy, enhance, and celebrate life. **Your Impact** * Perform a variety of operational activities, including scheduling, inventory management, backroom organization & store maintenance * Experience with 'Division of Responsibility' understanding, competent in merchandise flow processes, including inspecting and receiving new merchandise and entering data into the inventory management system * Manage the performance of the associates and provide feedback. * Assure all back areas meet company standards of cleanliness and a safe work environment **What You Bring** * 3+ years of shipping and receiving management experience in the specialty retail industry * Proficiency using Microsoft Word, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets), Outlook, Workday, Kronos, and POS Systems * Lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 50lbs * Availability to work flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays Remote work is not permitted in NYC currently. #Onsite Our Total Rewards package includes benefits you‚Äôll love such as competitive compensation, paid time off, an employee assistance program, parental leave, paid volunteer hours, and amazing company discounts! In our US market, you can also expect health care benefits starting on day 1, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement benefits. QVC Group is committed to inclusion and belonging for all and ensuring that our workplace provides equal employment opportunities for all team members and candidates and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. As an equal opportunity employer, QVC Group is committed to a barrier-free employment process. If you need reasonable accommodations/support throughout, please contact us at workwithus@qvcgrp.com for assistance. If provided, salary ranges are a general guideline only, and actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate's qualifications, skills, experience, and geographic location as well as business and market conditions.

Retail Sales Associate - Balsam Hill Studio
linkedin Lahaina (United States) Wed, 03 De N/A

Show full description ‚ñº
**Job Description**We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to assist the management team in our Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI. In the full-time Sales Associate role, you will have the opportunity to help ensure that our customers experience the magic of Balsam Hill in an inspired holiday setting. The Sales Associate will support the store management team by fostering a positive work environment that ensures customer satisfaction, boosts productivity, and drives sales. From enhancing the customer shopping experience to assisting with store opening and closing, the Sales Associate is vital to the success of Balsam Hill Studio. We are particularly excited about candidates with a proven history of retail success and creating customer-centric shopping experiences! **What You‚Äôll Do** * Assist customers and provide top notch service to ensure all patrons leave satisfied * Assist with merchandising, cleaning, and restocking * Gather customer feedback * Achieve sales targets by generating revenue through effective sales strategies * Perform opening/closing routines as needed * Demonstrate exemplary customer service and selling skills **What You Bring To The Table** * 2+ years of retail experience preferred * Strong communication skills with customers and sales staff * Demonstrated time management, organizational and multi-tasking skills * Passion for exemplary service * Great sales skills: retail sales experience a strong plus * Proficiency with iPads, basic computer skills, and basic data entry (data entry very minimal overall) * Flexibility: willingness to perform other various duties as required **Physical Requirements** * Must be able to work onsite for every shift * May assemble and disassemble Christmas trees and other decorations * May lift and or move items up to forty pounds **Notes:**The Sales Associate role is a full-time in-person position, expected to work around 40 hours per week. **About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines. Balsam Hill Studio, an extension of our holiday brand Balsam Hill¬Æ, reimagines souvenir shopping, offering premium ornaments unique to each store's location. The Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI will feature unique, handcrafted ornaments specific to Hawaii. Presenting tourists with beautiful, curated options for mementos to remind them of their extraordinary adventures every holiday season for years to come. The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace. * Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.com * Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023 * Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/ * Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoor The pay rate for this position is: $19.50 per hour. *At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Show full description ‚ñº
**Job Description**Balsam Hill is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Interim Project Coordinator to support the execution of key ecommerce and strategic initiatives over a three-month period. This part-time, interim role is ideal for a flexible and organised professional who can manage multiple workstreams, coordinate stakeholders, and ensure timely delivery of project milestones across digital and business transformation projects. This position reports to the General Manager and Business Lead, Europe. This is a part-time, hybrid in-office position located in our Dublin office, which will require you to work three days in-office (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday). To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview. **What You‚Äôll Do** * Coordinate and track progress across ecommerce and strategic project initiatives, ensuring alignment with timelines and deliverables. * Support project leads by preparing updates, reports, and presentations for internal stakeholders and senior management. * Manage meeting schedules, documentation, and follow-up actions. * Liaise with cross-functional teams, including marketing, merchandising, operations, and IT, to ensure project milestones are achieved. * Assist with timelines, communication, and implementation of new tools or workflows. * Maintain project trackers, budgets, and performance dashboards. * Provide administrative and analytical support to the Strategic Projects team as needed. **What You Bring To The Table** * Well-suited for graduates or early-career professionals who have hands-on experience managing projects, supporting eCommerce operations, or coordinating cross-functional business initiatives. * Excellent organisational skills with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities. * Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and common project management tools (e.g., Slack, Asana, Jira). * Strong communication and stakeholder management skills. * Able to adapt quickly within a fast-paced, changing environment. * Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage workload effectively within part-time hours. * Demonstrated AI literacy, enabling effective understanding, interaction, and critical evaluation of AI technologies and applications across diverse business functions **Notes:** This is a temporary position, expected to last through end of January **About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. Show full description ‚ñº
**Job Description**The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will play a significant role in building a best‚Äêin‚Äêclass global eCommerce website and creating a superior home d√©cor shopping experience. This role will be accountable for driving and monitoring our webstore performance via effective merchandising, A/B testing, personalization, and optimization projects. This person will be a key stakeholder in the creation of the eCommerce roadmap and a key contributor to our company roadmap and annual priorities. The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will work closely with Product Management, UI/UX, Marketing, and Creative teams to build a conversion‚Äêdriven website design that supports the brand vision and seasonal campaigns and proves our brand value to our shoppers. This person will also work closely with Product Management and Technology teams to identify technology, processes, eCommerce software, and feature improvements that contribute to the overall growth and profitability of the business**.**This position reports to the VP of eCommerce and is based in our Redwood City office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office. **What You‚Äôll Do** * Guide and support a global team of eCommerce Merchandisers to deliver best in class shopping experiences on our international sites * Oversee development of eCommerce site strategies including navigation, landing experiences, site search, and other tactical plans that will help meet and exceed conversion, revenue and profitability goals * Participate in evaluating tool and systems opportunities that drive eCommerce features and efficiencies, including use of technology to deliver a best‚Äêin‚Äêclass personalized merchandising experience * Oversee eCommerce day‚Äêto‚Äêday responsibilities, including: * Drive improvement for key page/category metrics (conversion, bounce, exit, revenue, engagement, etc.) through the optimization of online merchandising that enhances overall customer experience * Drive innovation and optimization through testing and application of eCommerce best practices * Monitor, meet, and report on eCommerce KPI's (conversion, bounce/exit, cart abandon, RPV, brand/category revenue, etc.) across devices, pages, and customer segments, and be able to explain the business drivers behind fluctuations in these metrics * Collaborate with the Marketing, SEO, Merchants, Pricing, and Planning teams to define business goals for our brands to align on strategies that drive growth * Partner with Creative by contributing to creative briefs, reviewing creative concepts against business goals, and identifying asset requirements * Partner with Merchandising (physical product) to ensure that product goals and benefits are being translated onto our site in a way that is consistent with their strategies * Partner with Product Management and Technology teams to ensure technical support for the execution of eCommerce projects and website operations * Provide input for prioritization of eCommerce projects, bug fixes, and maintenance tasks that go to Website Operations, Creative, and/or Technology teams **What You Bring To The Table** * 14+ years of experience in eCommerce/Retail * Exceptional analytical skills required * Prior experience managing teams required; remote management preferred * Ability to influence across functions and communicate across levels * Prior experience in leading cross functional projects * Experience in working with Creative, Product Management and/or Technology teams * Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Merchandising, Economics, General Business Management or equivalent **Notes:** This is a temporary position, expected to work 40 hours per week and last through January 2026. **About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico. The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace. * Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.com * Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023 * Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/ * Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoor **Benefits**At Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes: * Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review process * Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependents * Up to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accounts * Medical, transit, dependent care FSA * Infertility coverage offered on all medical plans * Generous parental leave program and flexible return options * Company-paid life and AD&D insurance * Company-paid short and long-term disability insurance * 401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar year * Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perks * Paid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packages * Paid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employment * Annual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal year * Up to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environment * Generous team member merchandise discount * Valuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insurance The base pay rate for this position is: $77-97 per hour. *At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. You will be responsible for contributing to the strategic vision, identifying and prioritizing customer and business problems, and ensuring our digital product investments drive measurable value.This full-time position reports to the Senior Product Manager, Digital and is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoLead a complex and/or high-impact product pod, including collaboration with stakeholders, engineering, QA, and analyticsConduct customer research and partner with business stakeholders to identify user needs and business goalsStay current with martech tools and trends and evaluate which are appropriate for BalsamDefine and communicate the pod‚Äôs product strategy and ensure alignment with company objectivesOwn and maintain the product roadmap; Job DescriptionThe Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US.‚ÄØThis includes building campaigns and multi-touch flows with proper logic, flawless rendering, and advanced personalization based on user behavior and lifecycle stage.This position reports to the CRM Marketing Manager and is based in our Boise office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoDesign and build responsive email campaigns using drag-and-drop email builders and visual template editors optimized for OptimoveDevelop, modify and organize email templates and existing campaigns, including editable modules so templates can be reusedTest compatibility and proper rendering across different email clients and devices, and perform A/B testing to optimize campaign performanceDevelop rule-based email templates that integrate personalized dynamic content elements, automate workflows and configure link trackingImplement customer segmentation strategies and manage email streams and sequences that engage customers at different stages of their journeyWork with marketing teams, designers, and other stakeholders in multiple time zones to execute email strategies‚ÄØthat will drive engagement for the right audience and align with channel best practicesApply best practices in email development, email compliance regulations especially CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and accessibilityAbility to diagnose and resolve email deliverability issues including spam filtering, reputation management, and authentication protocolsMay be tasked in construction/executing email campaigns. This can include implementing conditional logic or leveraging 3rd party content for personalization, using Optimove and other similar programsWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in related field; and/or 3+ years of relevant experience, preferably with an eCommerce brand3+ years of experience with various email marketing and/or CDP platforms, like Optimove, Klaviyo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud.Fluent in HTML and CSSDemonstrate commitment to accuracy and thoroughnessExperience with A/B testing to optimize email performance and conversionUnderstanding of email client compatibility, responsive design, and cross-platform rendering challengesExperience using, building, and maintaining both one-off marketing and lifecycle campaignsNice to have:Knowledge of email subscriber list best practices for both GDPR and CAN-SPAM lawsExcellent verbal and written communication skills that bridge technical and non-technical audiencesExperience using Figma is a plusExperience with project management tools such as ClickUp or JIRA is a plusExperience integrating email platforms with CRM systems, e-commerce platforms, and marketing automation tools is a plusAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes:‚ÄØhttps://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn:‚ÄØhttp://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorBenefitsAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is: $69,000 to $87,000.Please note that placement within the posted salary range is based on several factors, including geographic location, experience, skills, alignment with role requirements and other job-related factors. It is uncommon for offers to be made at the top of the range, as this typically reflects a candidate who exceeds all role requirements and brings significant, directly applicable experience.We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Email Marketing Specialist
linkedin Redwood City (United States) Tue, 29 Ju N/A
Job DescriptionThe Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US.‚ÄØT...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionThe Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US.‚ÄØThis includes building campaigns and multi-touch flows with proper logic, flawless rendering, and advanced personalization based on user behavior and lifecycle stage.This position reports to the CRM Marketing Manager and is based in our Redwood City office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoDesign and build responsive email campaigns using drag-and-drop email builders and visual template editors optimized for OptimoveDevelop, modify and organize email templates and existing campaigns, including editable modules so templates can be reusedTest compatibility and proper rendering across different email clients and devices, and perform A/B testing to optimize campaign performanceDevelop rule-based email templates that integrate personalized dynamic content elements, automate workflows and configure link trackingImplement customer segmentation strategies and manage email streams and sequences that engage customers at different stages of their journeyWork with marketing teams, designers, and other stakeholders in multiple time zones to execute email strategies‚ÄØthat will drive engagement for the right audience and align with channel best practicesApply best practices in email development, email compliance regulations especially CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and accessibilityAbility to diagnose and resolve email deliverability issues including spam filtering, reputation management, and authentication protocolsMay be tasked in construction/executing email campaigns. This can include implementing conditional logic or leveraging 3rd party content for personalization, using Optimove and other similar programsWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in related field; and/or 3+ years of relevant experience, preferably with an eCommerce brand3+ years of experience with various email marketing and/or CDP platforms, like Optimove, Klaviyo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud.Fluent in HTML and CSSDemonstrate commitment to accuracy and thoroughnessExperience with A/B testing to optimize email performance and conversionUnderstanding of email client compatibility, responsive design, and cross-platform rendering challengesExperience using, building, and maintaining both one-off marketing and lifecycle campaignsNice to have:Knowledge of email subscriber list best practices for both GDPR and CAN-SPAM lawsExcellent verbal and written communication skills that bridge technical and non-technical audiencesExperience using Figma is a plusExperience with project management tools such as ClickUp or JIRA is a plusExperience integrating email platforms with CRM systems, e-commerce platforms, and marketing automation tools is a plusAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes:‚ÄØhttps://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn:‚ÄØhttp://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorBenefitsAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is: $69,000 to $87,000.Please note that placement within the posted salary range is based on several factors, including geographic location, experience, skills, alignment with role requirements and other job-related factors. It is uncommon for offers to be made at the top of the range, as this typically reflects a candidate who exceeds all role requirements and brings significant, directly applicable experience.We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Job DescriptionThe Email Lifecycle Developer will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US.‚ÄØThis includes building campaigns and multi-touch flows with proper logic, flawless rendering, and advanced personalization based on user behavior and lifecycle stage.This position reports to the CRM Marketing Manager and is based in our Redwood City office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoDesign and build responsive email campaigns using drag-and-drop email builders and visual template editors optimized for OptimoveDevelop, modify and organize email templates and existing campaigns, including editable modules so templates can be reusedTest compatibility and proper rendering across different email clients and devices, and perform A/B testing to optimize campaign performanceDevelop rule-based email templates that integrate personalized dynamic content elements, automate workflows and configure link trackingImplement customer segmentation strategies and manage email streams and sequences that engage customers at different stages of their journeyWork with marketing teams, designers, and other stakeholders in multiple time zones to execute email strategies‚ÄØthat will drive engagement for the right audience and align with channel best practicesApply best practices in email development, email compliance regulations especially CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and accessibilityAbility to diagnose and resolve email deliverability issues including spam filtering, reputation management, and authentication protocolsMay be tasked in construction/executing email campaigns. This can include implementing conditional logic or leveraging 3rd party content for personalization, using Optimove and other similar programsWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in related field; and/or 3+ years of relevant experience, preferably with an eCommerce brand3+ years of experience with various email marketing and/or CDP platforms, like Optimove, Klaviyo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud.Fluent in HTML and CSSDemonstrate commitment to accuracy and thoroughnessExperience with A/B testing to optimize email performance and conversionUnderstanding of email client compatibility, responsive design, and cross-platform rendering challengesExperience using, building, and maintaining both one-off marketing and lifecycle campaignsNice to have:Knowledge of email subscriber list best practices for both GDPR and CAN-SPAM lawsExcellent verbal and written communication skills that bridge technical and non-technical audiencesExperience using Figma is a plusExperience with project management tools such as ClickUp or JIRA is a plusExperience integrating email platforms with CRM systems, e-commerce platforms, and marketing automation tools is a plusAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. Job DescriptionThe Email Lifecycle Developer will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US.‚ÄØThis includes building campaigns and multi-touch flows with proper logic, flawless rendering, and advanced personalization based on user behavior and lifecycle stage.This position reports to the CRM Marketing Manager and is based in our Boise office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoDesign and build responsive email campaigns using drag-and-drop email builders and visual template editors optimized for OptimoveDevelop, modify and organize email templates and existing campaigns, including editable modules so templates can be reusedTest compatibility and proper rendering across different email clients and devices, and perform A/B testing to optimize campaign performanceDevelop rule-based email templates that integrate personalized dynamic content elements, automate workflows and configure link trackingImplement customer segmentation strategies and manage email streams and sequences that engage customers at different stages of their journeyWork with marketing teams, designers, and other stakeholders in multiple time zones to execute email strategies‚ÄØthat will drive engagement for the right audience and align with channel best practicesApply best practices in email development, email compliance regulations especially CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and accessibilityAbility to diagnose and resolve email deliverability issues including spam filtering, reputation management, and authentication protocolsMay be tasked in construction/executing email campaigns. This can include implementing conditional logic or leveraging 3rd party content for personalization, using Optimove and other similar programsWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in related field; and/or 3+ years of relevant experience, preferably with an eCommerce brand3+ years of experience with various email marketing and/or CDP platforms, like Optimove, Klaviyo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud.Fluent in HTML and CSSDemonstrate commitment to accuracy and thoroughnessExperience with A/B testing to optimize email performance and conversionUnderstanding of email client compatibility, responsive design, and cross-platform rendering challengesExperience using, building, and maintaining both one-off marketing and lifecycle campaignsNice to have:Knowledge of email subscriber list best practices for both GDPR and CAN-SPAM lawsExcellent verbal and written communication skills that bridge technical and non-technical audiencesExperience using Figma is a plusExperience with project management tools such as ClickUp or JIRA is a plusExperience integrating email platforms with CRM systems, e-commerce platforms, and marketing automation tools is a plusAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. Job DescriptionThe Email Lifecycle Developer will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US.This position reports to the CRM Marketing Manager and is based in our Boise office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoBuild/Code visually appealing and responsive HTML/CSS email templates to be compatible with OptimailDevelop and modify email templates and existing campaigns, including editable modules so templates can be reusedTest compatibility and proper rendering across different email clients and devices, and perform A/B testing to optimize campaign performanceDevelop rule-based email templates that integrate personalized dynamic content elements, automate workflows and configure link trackingImplement customer segmentation strategies and manage email streams and sequences that engage customers at different stages of their journeyWork with marketing teams, designers, and other stakeholders to execute email strategiesApply best practices in email development, email compliance regulations especially CAN-SPAM, GDPR, and accessibilityTroubleshoot HTML, CSS or other performance issuesMay be tasked in construction/executing email campaigns. This can include implementing conditional logic or leveraging 3rd party content for personalization, using Optimove and other similar programsWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in related field; and/or 3+ years of relevant experience, preferably with an eCommerce brand3+ years of experience with various email marketing and/or CDP platforms, like Optimove, Klaviyo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud.Fluent in HTML and CSSDemonstrate commitment to accuracy and thoroughnessExperience with A/B testing and email optimizationExperience with proofing tools such as Litmus or Email on AcidExperience using, building, and maintaining both one-off marketing and lifecycle campaignsNice to have:Knowledge of email subscriber list best practices for both GDPR and CAN-SPAM lawsExcellent verbal and written communication skills that bridge technical and non-technical audiencesKnowledge of SQL, AMPScript, JavaScript, JIRA or other project management toolsAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. Balsam Hill Studio Sales Associate
indeed Lahaina (United States) Fri, 04 Ju N/A
Job DescriptionWe are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to assist the management team in our Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI. In the full-time Sales Assoc...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionWe are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to assist the management team in our Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI. In the full-time Sales Associate role, you will have the opportunity to help ensure that our customers experience the magic of Balsam Hill in an inspired holiday setting.The Sales Associate will support the store management team by fostering a positive work environment that ensures customer satisfaction, boosts productivity, and drives sales. From enhancing the customer shopping experience to assisting with store opening and closing, the Sales Associate is vital to the success of Balsam Hill Studio. We are particularly excited about candidates with a proven history of retail success and creating customer-centric shopping experiences!What you‚Äôll do:Assist customers and provide top notch service to ensure all patrons leave satisfiedAssist with merchandising, cleaning, and restockingGather customer feedbackAchieve sales targets by generating revenue through effective sales strategiesPerform opening/closing routines as neededDemonstrate exemplary customer service and selling skillsWhat you bring to the table:2+ years of retail experience preferredStrong communication skills with customers and sales staffDemonstrated time management, organizational and multi-tasking skillsPassion for exemplary serviceGreat sales skills: retail sales experience a strong plusProficiency with iPads, basic computer skills, and basic data entry (data entry very minimal overall)Flexibility: willingness to perform other various duties as requiredPhysical Requirements:Must be able to work onsite for every shiftMay assemble and disassemble Christmas trees and other decorationsMay lift and or move items up to forty poundsNotes:The Sales Associate role is a full-time in-person position, expected to work around 40 hours per week.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines.Balsam Hill Studio, an extension of our holiday brand Balsam Hill¬Æ, reimagines souvenir shopping, offering premium ornaments unique to each store's location. The Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI will feature unique, handcrafted ornaments specific to Hawaii. Presenting tourists with beautiful, curated options for mementos to remind them of their extraordinary adventures every holiday season for years to come.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorThe pay rate for this position is: $23.00 per hour.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company DescriptionBalsam Brandsis a global eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. Our flagship brand is Balsam Hill‚Ñ¢, the world‚Äôs leading retailer of artificial Christmas trees and holiday d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have an impact in a people-first company that values relationship-building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our communities. It's the heart of our company. In fact, our Philippine ROHQ being recognized as one of the Philippines' Best Work Places by the prestigious Great Place To Work organization is a testament to this.We know that you need to feel comfortable in your work environment, so we make sure that everyone in the team is supported and cared for. Team Manila has been working from home since 2010, with occasional in-person meet-ups and events to help build relationships and foster camaraderie.Team Manila represents nearly every function in the company‚Äîfrom Marketing to Operations and everything in between. Everyone gets to enjoy company-issued laptops and full employee benefits, including HMO coverage, mental health support, paid time off, 13th-month pay, and many more. The company trips, wellness benefits, and other perks are just the cherry on top of our permanent work-from-home setup.Balsam International on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BalsamInternationalPHBalsam International on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-international-unlimitedAt Balsam International, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Analyze performance data, create compelling ad copies, and ensure flawless campaign execution for our holiday d√©cor innovations. We welcome fresh grads with a hunger to learn and a love for details. data.Provides updates on various metrics performance based on analysis.Supports in preparing data for internal check-ins.Account Management, Review & AuditCampaign management and audits to identify areas for improvement and optimization.Reviews account setup, platform recommendations, product feeds, campaign settings, and other items to ensure that they are properly set up.Report findings and apply fixes where possible.Track and log marketing spend and campaign changes for reporting.Monitor and regularly update Expense Metric filesAd Creation and MonitoringProposes ad copies for search ads that effectively convey brand messaging.Request and review translated copy/assets with the Localization team.Creates and uploads finalized ads on channel platforms.Implements sales changes as needed.Responsible for maintaining and updating ad copy feeds for deployment across multiple marketing platforms as required.Conducts sample searches to ensure ads appear as expected and accuratelyProject Coordination and DocumentationUnderstands and identifies the different steps of the different processes.Creates a structured and systematic documentation of processes.Communicates project schedules, milestones, and deadlines to ensure all team members are aligned and informed.Market Understanding and Audience ResearchProactively stays up to date on the latest digital marketing project management tools; prior experience is a plusStrong desire to learn and develop new skills.Great attention to detail with a strong commitment to accuracyAbility to work well in a team environment and collaborate effectively.Good organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.Responsive and proactive, with the ability to adapt quickly and deliver tasks efficiently.Our must-haves:Must haveWindowsas the primary and backup laptop or desktop for use. A backup laptop is essential in cases where the primary laptop encounters issues.Must have a fast, reliable DSL, Fiber, or Broadband connection (not mobile or broadband stick) as the primary internet connection with a minimum actual speed of 50MBPS.Must have a backup internet connection of the same speed if the primary connection becomes spotty.Location:ThePerformance Marketing Analyst (Contract)position is a remote contractual position for Balsam International Unlimited Philippine ROHQ in Manila. Team members in the Philippines are located within Metro Manila, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Pampanga, Rizal, and Tarlac areas only.Note:An online assessment will also be part of the recruitment process.Status:This is a contractual, home-based job that requires a scheduled eight (8) hours of full-time, dedicated work daily, five days a week. Job DescriptionThe CRM Marketing Manager leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of lifecycle marketing initiatives, primarily through email and emerging SMS channels, while managing a team of specialists and collaborating cross-functionally to drive customer engagement, loyalty, and business growth through data-driven, personalized campaigns.This full ‚Äì time position reports to the Senior Marketing Manager, BHI and is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoStrategic Execution & Campaign ManagementProvide supervision to a small team, defining tasks aligned with common goals, and fosters the professional development of team members through active discussion, feedback, coaching, and mentorshipLeads end-to-end CRM campaign execution across all channels, ensuring consistency with broader marketing goalsDevelops and optimizes segmentation strategies, working with Data Insights to personalize campaigns based on customer behavior and lifecycle stageAnalyzes CRM performance data, translating insights into actionable recommendations to improve engagement, repeat purchase rates and retentionStays ahead of CRM trends, technologies, and best practices to continuously enhance strategiesLeadership & Team DevelopmentManages and mentors a team of CRM specialists, fostering professional growth and skill developmentProvides clear direction and accountability for team deliverables, KPIs, and prioritiesConducts regular team meetings and 1:1s, ensuring alignment on key initiatives and business objectivesFosters a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvementProvides supervision to a small team, defining tasks aligned with common goals, and fosters the professional development of team members through active discussion, feedback, coaching, and mentorshipCross-Functional CollaborationPartners with Marketing, Creative and Digital Experience teams to develop customer-centric messaging and offers; and align CRM efforts with broader marketing initiativesWorks closely with Data and Product teams to improve CRM reporting and enhance automation capabilitiesManages relationships with external vendors to optimize CRM toolsets and platformsSupports multi-variable testing and learning across CRM channels, sharing insights to scale successful strategiesBudget & Performance OptimizationExecutes revenue build up for CRM function, strategy for growth and maximizing profitabilityLeads CRM budget management, ensuring effective resource allocation to maximize ROISupports the implementation of new CRM initiatives, including potential expansion into SMS and loyalty programsMonitors compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices across all CRM effortsWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, Business, or a related field preferredMinimum of eight (8) years of CRM marketing experience, preferably in B2C eCommerce or retailAt least two (2) years of people management experience, with a track record of developing and coaching teamsStrong understanding of CRM platforms (Optimove a plus), automation tools, and customer segmentationExperience with international ecommerce / retail markets (experience with Australian and Canadian markets a plus)Analytical mindset with experience creating strategic tests and implementation based on findingsAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentStrong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional partnersValid driver‚Äôs license and proof of insurance (this job may require driving on company timeKnowledge of data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA) is a plusAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is $111,000 to $139,000. Please note that placement within the posted salary range is based on several factors, including geographic location, experience, skills, alignment with role requirements and other job-related factors. It is uncommon for offers to be made at the top of the range, as this typically reflects a candidate who exceeds all role requirements and brings significant, directly applicable experience.We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together.
