Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionAs Account Executive, B2B Sales, you will drive new business growth for Balsam Hill by selling premium holiday d√©cor packages to interior designers, event planners, and other design professionals who craft seasonal experiences for their clients. This is a hunter role, ideal for a self-starter with deep connections in the design world, who thrives without a set playbook and is passionate about premium product storytelling.This is a relationship-driven sales role focused on building trust, understanding client needs, and delivering tailored solutions aligned with the brand objectives. The Account Executive will play a hand in evolving the product assortment by sharing client feedback and work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure a seamless customer experience.As a brand ambassador for Balsam Hill, the Account Executive will lead engagement with key design industry associations to enhance the company‚Äôs presence and position Balsam Hill as the preferred partner for design professionals. Additionally, the Account Executive will play an integral role in establishing a nationwide network of designers and decorators who may be contracted to support holiday installations.This full-time remote position reports to the Director of Customer Engagement, B2B, and requires the candidate to be based near a major metropolitan area such as New York City, Chicago, Houston, Phoenix, or Los Angeles.What You‚Äôll DoNew Business Acquisition: Own the full sales cycle from prospecting through close, selling to interior designers, event planners, and similar professionals, and independently managing a national territoryDesigner Network Development (Secondary Focus): Identify, recruit, and build relationships with a network of designers and decorators across the country who can support holiday installations for high-end clientsEvent & Industry Representation: Represent Balsam Hill at industry events, trade shows, and conferences (e.g., ASID Gather), enhancing brand visibility and building strong industry partnershipsABM and Prospecting: Work in partnership with the marketing team to leverage ABM strategy, buyer intent tools, and social media to engage high-potential clientsSales Collateral: Collaborate with internal teams to develop persuasive sales tools and presentations tailored to design industry prospectCRM and Technology: Use HubSpot for pipeline management, ZoomInfo for lead insights, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator for social sellingPerformance Tracking and Reporting: Track KPIs and sales performance, adjusting strategies to stay aligned with business growth goalsWhat You Bring To The Table5+ years in B2B sales with experience in the Interior Design, Event Planning, or adjacent design industriesBachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, or a related design fieldDemonstrated success in new business acquisition and territory development, preferably in design-related B2B salesAn eye for design and a genuine passion for aesthetics, with the ability to connect with creative professionals and speak their languageHighly motivated self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and knows how to build from scratchProficient with HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other sales tools; understands how to use social media for prospecting and brand buildingAble to craft compelling presentations and messages that inspire designers and align with their aesthetic valuesWillingness to travel up to 30‚Äì40% for client meetings, trade shows, and eventsTravel for remote team members: At Balsam Brands, we believe that time spent together, in-person, collaborating and building relationships is important to who we are. For our newest remote Brandits, we will arrange travel to one of our local offices within your first three months of employment so you can meet and train with your new team in-person. You may also get to travel an additional 1 ‚Äì 2 times a year for events such as team retreats, offsites, or learning and development opportunities.Notes:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits. Please only apply if you are able to live and work full-time in one of the states listed in this posting. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is: $110,000 to $130,000 annually, depending on experience. Year 1 On-Target Earnings (OTE): $150,000‚Äì$175,000, including a $30,000 commission draw during ramp-up. Year 2 OTE: $200,000+ based on performance. Please note that placement within the posted salary range is based on several factors, including geographic location, experience, skills, alignment with role requirements and other job-related factors. It is uncommon for offers to be made at the top of the range, as this typically reflects a candidate who exceeds all role requirements and brings significant, directly applicable experience. We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.#RemoteAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Account Executive, B2B Sales - Design Industry
indeed Redwood City (United States) Sat, 31 Ma N/A
Job DescriptionAs Account Executive, B2B Sales, will drive new business growth for Balsam Hill by selling premium holiday d√©cor packages to interior designers, event planners, and other design profess...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionAs Account Executive, B2B Sales, will drive new business growth for Balsam Hill by selling premium holiday d√©cor packages to interior designers, event planners, and other design professionals who craft seasonal experiences for their clients. This is a hunter role, ideal for a self-starter with deep connections in the design world, who thrives without a set playbook and is passionate about premium product storytelling.This is a relationship-driven sales role focused on building trust, understanding client needs, and delivering tailored solutions aligned with the brand objectives. The Account Executive will play a hand in evolving the product assortment by sharing client feedback and work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure a seamless customer experience.As a brand ambassador for Balsam Hill, the Account Executive will lead engagement with key design industry associations to enhance the company‚Äôs presence and position Balsam Hill as the preferred partner for design professionals. Additionally, the Account Executive will play an integral role in establishing a nationwide network of designers and decorators who may be contracted to support holiday installations.This full-time position reports to the Director of Customer Engagement, B2B and can work remote from any U.S. state where Balsam Brands is currently setup as an employer, which includes Arizona, California, Illinois and Texas. This role can also work locally in our Redwood City, CA location. Our local teams work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday in-office.To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.What you‚Äôll do:New Business Acquisition:Own the full sales cycle from prospecting through close, selling to interior designers, event planners, and similar professionals, and independently managing a national territoryDesigner Network Development(Secondary Focus): Identify, recruit, and build relationships with a network of designers and decorators across the country who can support holiday installations for high-end clientsEvent & Industry Representation: Represent Balsam Hill at industry events, trade shows, and conferences (e.g., ASID Gather), enhancing brand visibility and building strong industry partnershipsABM and Prospecting: Work in partnership with the marketing team to leverage ABM strategy, buyer intent tools, and social media to engage high-potential clientsSales Collateral:Collaborate with internal teams to develop persuasive sales tools and presentations tailored to design industry prospectCRM and Technology: Use HubSpot for pipeline management, ZoomInfo for lead insights, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator for social sellingPerformance Tracking and Reporting: Track KPIs and sales performance, adjusting strategies to stay aligned with business growth goalsWhat you bring to the table:5+ years in B2B sales with experience in the Interior Design, Event Planning, or adjacent design industriesBachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, or a related design fieldDemonstrated success in new business acquisition and territory development, preferably in design-related B2B salesAn eye for design and a genuine passion for aesthetics, with the ability to connect with creative professionals and speak their languageHighly motivated self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and knows how to build from scratchProficient with HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other sales tools; understands how to use social media for prospecting and brand buildingAble to craft compelling presentations and messages that inspire designers and align with their aesthetic valuesWillingness to travel up to 30‚Äì40% for client meetings, trade shows, and eventsTravel for remote team members: At Balsam Brands, we believe that time spent together, in-person, collaborating and building relationships is important to who we are. For our newest remote Brandits, we will arrange travel to one of our local offices within your first three months of employment so you can meet and train with your new team in-person. You may also get to travel an additional 1 ‚Äì 2 times a year for events such as team retreats, offsites, or learning and development opportunities.Notes:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits. Please only apply if you are able to live and work full-time in one of the states listed in this posting. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Year 1 On-Target Earnings (OTE): $150,000‚Äì$175,000, including a $30,000 commission draw during ramp-up. Year 2 OTE: $200,000+ based on performance. Company DescriptionBalsam Brandsis a global eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. Our flagship brand is Balsam Hill‚Ñ¢, the world‚Äôs leading retailer of artificial Christmas trees and holiday d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have an impact in a people-first company that values relationship-building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Canada, Ireland, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our communities. When you join Balsam Brands, you‚Äôll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work while building a welcoming workplace.Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Balsam Brands on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/balsam_brands/Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbesAtBalsam Brands, we like to think of our people-first culture as more than just a tagline. It's the heart of our company. In fact, our Philippine ROHQ being recognized as one of the‚ÄØPhilippine‚Äôs Best Work Places‚ÄØby the prestigious Great Place To Work organization is a testament to this.We know that you need to feel comfortable in your work environment, so we make sure that everyone in the team is supported and cared for. Team Manila has been working from home since 2010, with occasional in-person meet-ups and events to help build relationships and foster camaraderie.Team Manila represents nearly every function in the company‚Äîfrom Marketing to Operations and everything in between. Everyone gets to enjoy company-issued laptops and full employee benefits, including HMO coverage, mental health support, paid time off, 13th-month pay, and many more. The company trips, wellness benefits, and other perks are just the cherry on top of our permanent work-from-home setup.Balsam International on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BalsamInternationalPHBalsam International on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-international-unlimitedAt Balsam International, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam International is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.Job DescriptionWe're on the lookout for aSenior eCommerce Operations Specialistto help keep our eCommerce websites accurate, organized, and functioning smoothly. In this role, you'll be more than just a page updater; you'll manage product launches, refine how we handle digital assets, and help improve our behind-the-scenes processes. You'll work closely with various teams to ensure our customers have a seamless experience every time they visit us. If you have a keen eye for details and enjoy creating systems that make work easier, we‚Äôd really like to hear from you.What You‚Äôll Be DoingWebsite Content Update and MaintenanceEnsures accurate display of product and digital assets on customer-facing web pages by uploading and assigning appropriate data.Builds, updates, and maintains static or interactive web pages that ensure the latest digital assets and content information is presented to customers.Coordinates with cross-functional partners to accomplish site merchandising deliverables within set parameters and timeline.Ensures web page design and technical specifications are met, and digital assets are optimized to support the average load time goal of less than 6 seconds.Supports merchandising campaigns by updating website pages and implementing A/B Tests that follow design specifications and meet launch deadlines.Creates and maintains website coupons and promotions for cross-functional teams.Updates and maintains website navigation structure and ensures it follows business requirements and specifications.Creates, updates, and maintains Product Category Pages and ensures they meet technical requirements, including digital assets, metadata, page URL, and database queries.Assigns appropriate data to product and site imagery to ensure the accurate display on various customer-facing web pages.Site Audit and QAParticipates in New Product Information QA, and flags or resolves digital asset and product information issues and discrepancies.Conducts routine audit and QA to make sure the website is working as expected.Conducts routine audit and QA to make sure merchandising-related components and pages are updated as per the defined sales merchandising schedule.Participates in conducting business validation activities for newly launched functions and features to ensure they meet business requirements.DocumentationDirects the documentation of internal processes and acts on identified gaps to ensure efficient process flows.Monitors the timely update of all documentation and makes sure that it is housed in the appropriate knowledge base site.Troubleshooting and ResolutionTroubleshoots digital asset and product information issues using the digital asset management tool, product information management system, and content management system.Troubleshoot spikes in website average load time speed and coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve and ensure the average load time goal of less than 6 seconds is met.Participates in troubleshooting activities during launch by identifying probable causes and providing a resolution to medium complexity bugs.Process ImprovementEnsures that the standards for uploading, naming, and categorizing assets are met by following the set standards for image organization.Identifies efficiency issues and creates tools or workarounds to improve turnaround times for various website operations tasks and the accuracy of the information found in all our websites.Proposes and drives roadmap initiatives that create either efficiency gains or a positive cost impact for the business.Project ManagementPlans all maintenance, updates, campaigns, and product launches, and maps out the work of the Website Operations team to cover all tasks needed within the set timeframe and with quality output. Educates and trains other teams on the use and functionality of various Ecommerce systems or tools, including Digital Asset System.Identifies risks in both small-scale scale to medium-complexity tasks and projects and applies mitigation measures.Participates in Technical meetings, project meetings, and retrospectives to raise challenges and incorporate future changes as agreed with various stakeholders.Digital Asset Management System (As Required)Acts as the primary owner of Digital Asset System, and other tools and processes by conducting regular housekeeping to remove or archive outdated data and update or scrub others for future reference or use.Ensures that the standards for uploading, naming, and categorizing assets are met by following the set standards for image organization.Educates and trains other teams on the use and functionality of various Ecommerce systems or tools, including Digital Asset System.Manages user accounts and portals for Widen usersOther Duties And ResponsibilitiesPerforms other duties that may be assigned from time to time.What we‚Äôre looking for ("Must-haves"):Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS, or a related field.Minimum of two (2) to three (3) years relevant experience in a similar role.Familiarity with Ecommerce and how content impacts the customer experience.Experience working with a Content Management System (CMS), such as Hybris, Contentstack, or similar CMS platforms.Familiarity with Figma or similar tools.Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a remote setup.Nice To HaveWorking knowledge of HTML and CSS.Experience using Widen or other Digital Asset Management (DAM) tools.Experience in Product Information Management (PIM) systems.Location:TheSenior eCommerce Operations Specialistposition is a remote working position for Balsam International Unlimited Company - Philippine ROHQ in Manila. Team members in the Philippines are located within Metro Manila, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Pampanga, Rizal, and Tarlac areas only.Our Must-havesMust attend occasional in-person meetings.Must have a fast, reliable DSL, Fiber, or Broadband connection (not mobile or broadband stick) as the primary internet connection with a minimum actual speed of 50MBPS.Note:An online assessment will also be part of the recruitment process.Status:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits.Hardware Provision:Company-issued Laptop will be provided on your first day.At Balsam International, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, this includes:Government-mandated Benefits (SSS, PAG-IBIG, PhilHealth)13th Month PayPaid Leaves. We use time off to rest, go on vacation, or just sleep in! Our paid time off is flexible to our needs.Internet Subsidy. With internet allowance, we are set up for success.Healthcare Coverage (+ 2 dependents). We worry less about rising medical costs with flexible quality healthcare benefits.Maternity, Paternity, and Solo Parent Benefit. We make sure parents are supported while they navigate work and family life.Continuous Learning and Professional Development Benefit. Our professional and personal development is fully supported. Whether it be online courses, workshops, or books!Mental Health Support. We manage work and life's challenges through Mental Health Day breaks, 24/7 professional counselling, and curated webinars.Company Incentive. An additional cash-based perk for all our Brandits based on the company's performance.Meeting and Team Building Allowance. Happy tummies make our meetings more fun and productive!Shutdown Week. We can spend more time on things that matter with an additional one-week paid time off on top of paid leaves.Volunteer Time Off. With two paid days off, we are able to volunteer for advocacies we believe in.Bereavement Leave. We get additional paid leaves when a loved one passes to grieve and provide immediate support to our families.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Team Manila has been working from home since 2010, with occasional in-person meet-ups and events to help build relationships and foster camaraderie.Team Manila represents nearly every function in the company‚Äîfrom Marketing to Operations and everything in between. Everyone gets to enjoy company-issued laptops and full employee benefits, including HMO coverage, mental health support, paid time off, 13th-month pay, and many more. The company trips, wellness benefits, and other perks are just the cherry on top of our permanent work-from-home setup.Balsam International on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BalsamInternationalPHBalsam International on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-international-unlimitedAt Balsam International, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam International is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.Job DescriptionEnergized by the challenge of scaling a business? We‚Äôre looking for aneCommerce Sales Support Specialistto play a key role in growing our retail partnerships and marketplace presence! In this role, you‚Äôll monitor sales, fine-tune product listings, analyze performance trends, and tackle marketplace challenges‚Äîall while collaborating with a team that thrives on innovation and problem-solving. If you love working with data, spotting opportunities, and making an impact, this could be the perfect role for you!What You‚Äôll Be DoingProduct Setup and Content OptimizationOversees the setup and maintenance of new products on all platforms based on seasonal New Product Introductions (NPIs) or assortment expansion strategies.Updates product content seasonally for SEO optimizations.Gathers product details and assets, including photos and copy, to ensure comprehensive and optimized listings.Monitoring and ReportingMonitors order flows (Order Flow Monitoring):Ensures orders are processed and shipped as planned for all retail partners, Amazon, Walmart, Target, Nordstrom, Nordstrom Rack, Pottery Barn, etc.Collaborates with the operations team to address any delays or issues.Monitors sales (Sales Monitoring):Tracks sales performance by Retail Partner and Brand against projections.Investigates and addresses any sales exceptions or discrepancies.Performs partner site audits to ensure product listings are accurate and up-to-date.Ensures product compliance and monitors accounts (Product Compliance / Account Monitoring):Monitors account health and submits tickets to resolve issues.Conducts In-Season and Post-Season Analysis:Conducts sales performance reviews during and after sales seasons.Monitors Inventory and Pricing Management:Monitors inventory availability and updates retailer allocations based on sales performance.Update pricing across retail partnerships.Accounting ReconciliationCollects and organizes reconciliation forms from partners into Excel sheets for accounting purposes.Performs other duties that may be assigned from time to time.What We‚Äôre Looking ForBachelor‚Äôs Degree in any field.Minimum of two (2) to five (5) years relevant experience in eCommerce, particularly in setting up products on retail/marketplace websites.Must have expertise in content optimization to boost conversion rates.Must have familiarity with eCommerce Key Performance Indicators (Traffic, AOV, Conversion Rate) and the supporting inputs that drive performance.Must have strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and other relevant software tools.Must have familiarity and experience with marketplace tools like Helium 10, Jungle Scout, etc.Must have the ability to quickly learn and train the team on new tools as needed.Must have attention to detail and a proactive approach to task management.Location:TheeCommerce Sales Support Specialistposition is a remote working position for Balsam International Unlimited Company - Philippine ROHQ in Manila. Team members in the Philippines are located within Metro Manila, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Pampanga, Rizal, and Tarlac areas only.Our Must-havesMust attend occasional in-person meetings.Must have a fast, reliable DSL, Fiber, or Broadband connection (not mobile or broadband stick) as the primary internet connection with a minimum actual speed of 50MBPS.Note:An online assessment will also be part of the recruitment process.Status:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits.Hardware Provision:Company-issued Laptop will be provided on your first day.At Balsam International, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, this includes:Government-mandated Benefits (SSS, PAG-IBIG, PhilHealth)13th Month PayPaid Leaves. We use time off to rest, go on vacation, or just sleep in! Our paid time off is flexible to our needs.Internet Subsidy. With internet allowance, we are set up for success.Healthcare Coverage (+ 2 dependents). We worry less about rising medical costs with flexible, quality healthcare benefits.Maternity, Paternity, and Solo Parent Benefit. We make sure parents are supported while they navigate work and family life.Continuous Learning and Professional Development Benefit. Our professional and personal development are fully supported. Whether it be online courses, workshops, or books!Mental Health Support. We manage work and life's challenges through Mental Health Day breaks, 24/7 professional counseling, and curated webinars.Company Incentive. An additional cash-based perk for all our Brandits based on the company's performance.Meeting & Team Building Allowance. Happy tummies make our meetings more fun and productive!Shutdown Week. We can spend more time on things that matter with an additional one-week paid time off on top of paid leaves.Volunteer Time Off. With two paid days off, we are able to volunteer for advocacies we believe in.Bereavement Leave. We get additional paid leaves when a loved one passes to grieve and provide immediate support to our families.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
CRM Marketing Manager
linkedin Boise (United States) Tue, 15 Ap N/A

Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionCompany Website Ad:Balsam Brands, Inc. seeks CRM Marketing Manager. Worksite: 999 W Main Street, Suite 1000, Boise, ID 83702. Offered wage of $146,640 per year. Must put job code REF1290T on resume and cover letter.Duties And ResponsibilitiesResponsible for enhancing company‚Äôs lifecycle marketing programs in the quest to make the customer experience best in class within the marketplace. Oversee the catalog and email teams, make sure that tasks and projects are delivered on time and accurately, and help develop and nurture their career path at company. Assist in the development and management of our catalog and email calendars across a portfolio of brands, and help analyze catalog and email results, identify weaknesses, and help develop solutions on how to optimize campaigns going forward. Collaborate on cross-functional projects and present learnings to brand leads and various cross functional team members. Management of a team including (but not limited to): reporting on status of different team member deliverables and KPIs, hosting team meetings; conducting 1:1s with direct reports. Lead CRM team members in planning, managing, and executing catalog, direct mail, and email marketing campaigns. Light email development and troubleshooting. Create email segmentations, schedule email sends, and calendar campaigns. Coordinate with brand and channel leads to align on goals, campaign strategy, messaging, and timing. Reports on email results when needed for Brand leads and for business reviews. Manage agency relationships. Guide CRM and cross-functional team members in completing various roadmap projects. Develops functional marketing budgets and understands how role and function tie to financial goals of company. Stay on top of industry trends, best practices, technologies, and competitive landscape to share with various team members. Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.Required Education And ExperienceMinimum Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, Journalism, or Advertising.Minimum Experience: 3 years‚Äô relevant digital marketing experience with managing a team, marketing, eCommerce and experience in interpretating data with tools such as Google Analytics, Excel and Power BI.Alternative Requirement: 5 years' relevant digital marketing experience with managing a team, marketing, eCommerce and experience in interpretating data with tools such as Google Analytics, Excel and Power BI.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Senior Manager of Creative Content
linkedin Redwood City (United States) Tue, 15 Ap N/A
Job DescriptionWe are looking for an innovative and strategic leader with a passion for visual storytelling and a strong understanding of home d√©cor trends to help us fulfill our mission of creating j...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionWe are looking for an innovative and strategic leader with a passion for visual storytelling and a strong understanding of home d√©cor trends to help us fulfill our mission of creating joy together. The Senior Manager of Creative Content will be creative, detail-oriented, and will collaborate closely with creative leads and cross-functional partners to create high-quality visual content that evolves our brand story and drives engagement with our target audience.This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the elevation of the visual identity of our home d√©cor retail brand through creative leadership, strategic planning, and high-quality content production. This role requires experience in photography and videography for both print and digital channels, as well as knowledge of photo and video editing, production, styling, and branding. Key areas of responsibilities include the development of creative concepts and the ability to bring these ideas to life in photo, video, and memorable customer experiences.This full-time position is a part of the Creative Team reporting to the VP, Creative Director and supports the Balsam Hill global brand. It is hands-on with leadership responsibilities including mentoring and directing studio managers, producers, photographers, videographers and editors, both for internal and external teams. This role is a brand ambassador and effectively collaborates with other Creative team leaders, merchants, marketing, vendors, and external production teams.This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in our Redwood City or Burlingame offices as well as additional time on location for shoots throughout the year.What You‚Äôll DoCreative Leadership and Content Development:Collaborate with creative leads to develop and maintain a clear and compelling creative vision for the photo and video content produced by the studioIntroduce holistic storytelling strategies that support business initiatives across multiple mediums including print and digitalPartner with marketing and eCommerce teams to develop comprehensive content strategies that support product launches, promotions, campaigns and brand storytellingIntroduce new concepts and ideas through swipes and storyboard developmentBring creative vision to life by overseeing creative development of media productions from concept through executionWork with external talent to develop photo and video style guidesStay updated on current home d√©cor trends, photography techniques and video production styles to ensure the studio‚Äôs work is fresh and relevantMaintain an intimate understanding of the customer and their journey throughout every touchpoint to create impact and build loyaltyWork closely with art directors, photographers, videographers and stylists to ensure work is high-quality, inspiring and on-brandIn partnership with our Global Brand Design team, brainstorm and contribute creative ideas for visual content that resonates with our target audience and drives engagementProduction ManagementCoordinate with Creative Operations Team to drive timelines and achieve milestonesCollaborate with Creative Operations to develop new best practices for post-production processes and workflowsOptimize budget to ensure efficiency and efficacy of all work produced and be accountable for budget reporting to Creative Ops teamPartner with producers to oversee high level scheduling and freelance hiresDevelop vision for building a best-in-class media studio and partner with Studio Manager to build out a roadmap for executing upgradesEnsure that team is delivering on postproduction needs that align with brand standards and advise on asset management and workflowsNegotiate contracts and manage relationships with external vendors and freelancersManage and track asset usage rights, including negotiating permissions, monitoring expiration dates, and educating teams on compliance requirements to ensure legal and proper use of all assetsTeam LeadershipLead, mentor and inspire a team that includes producers, studio management and post-production artistsDisplay leadership and inspire teams to develop compelling and meaningful work by fostering creative exploration, collaboration and innovationGuide direct reports and functional team members by identifying opportunities for growth, leveraging team strengths, and developing members toward organizational effectiveness.What You Bring To The TableKnowledge and experience with both the technical and creative side of media productionBachelor‚Äôs degree in Design or equivalent work experience10+ years of experience with consumer brands, campaigns, and photo productionProficient in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)Online portfolio displaying exceptional strategic, conceptual, and visual designDeep knowledge of media production and best practicesAbility to respond and give productive feedbackFlexible and adapts to the changing needs of the businessSupport process, proactively identifying challenges and fostering actionable solutionsExcellence in a deadline-driven environment with the ability to manage multiple prioritiesHighly self-motivated, with excellent communication skills, conflict resolution, and negotiation skillsFamiliarity with Ecommerce and digital marketing trendsAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorBenefitsAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is: $152,000 to $183,000. Please note that placement within the posted salary range is based on several factors, including geographic location, experience, skills, alignment with role requirements and other job-related factors. It is uncommon for offers to be made at the top of the range, as this typically reflects a candidate who exceeds all role requirements and brings significant, directly applicable experience. We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company DescriptionBalsam Brandsis a global eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. Our flagship brand is Balsam Hill‚Ñ¢, the world‚Äôs leading retailer of artificial Christmas trees and holiday d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have an impact in a people-first company that values relationship-building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Canada, Ireland, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our communities. It's the heart of our company. In fact, our Philippine ROHQ being recognized as one of the Philippines' Best Work Places by the prestigious Great Place To Work organization is a testament to this.We know that you need to feel comfortable in your work environment, so we make sure that everyone in the team is supported and cared for. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Canada, Ireland, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our communities. When you join Balsam Brands, you‚Äôll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work while building a welcoming workplace.Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Balsam Brands on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/balsam_brands/Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbesAtBalsam Brands, we like to think of our people-first culture as more than just a tagline. It's the heart of our company. In fact, our Philippine ROHQ being recognized as one of the‚ÄØPhilippine‚Äôs Best Work Places‚ÄØby the prestigious Great Place To Work organization is a testament to this.We know that you need to feel comfortable in your work environment, so we make sure that everyone in the team is supported and cared for. Team Manila has been working from home since 2010, with occasional in-person meet-ups and events to help build relationships and foster camaraderie.Team Manila represents nearly every function in the company‚Äîfrom Marketing to Operations and everything in between. Everyone gets to enjoy company-issued laptops and full employee benefits, including HMO coverage, mental health support, paid time off, 13th-month pay, and many more. The company trips, wellness benefits, and other perks are just the cherry on top of our permanent work-from-home setup.Balsam International on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BalsamInternationalPHBalsam International on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-international-unlimitedAt Balsam International, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam International is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.Job DescriptionEnergized by the challenge of scaling a business? We‚Äôre looking for anIndirect Sales Support Specialistto play a key role in growing our retail partnerships and marketplace presence! In this role, you‚Äôll monitor sales, fine-tune product listings, analyze performance trends, and tackle marketplace challenges‚Äîall while collaborating with a team that thrives on innovation and problem-solving. If you love working with data, spotting opportunities, and making an impact, this could be the perfect role for you!What You‚Äôll Be DoingProduct Setup and Content OptimizationOversees the setup and maintenance of new products on all platforms based on seasonal New Product Introductions (NPIs) or assortment expansion strategies.Updates product content seasonally for SEO optimizations.Gathers product details and assets, including photos and copy, to ensure comprehensive and optimized listings.Monitoring and ReportingMonitors order flows (Order Flow Monitoring):Ensures orders are processed and shipped as planned for all retail partners, Amazon, Walmart, Target, Nordstrom, Nordstrom Rack, Pottery Barn, etc.Collaborates with the operations team to address any delays or issues.Monitors sales (Sales Monitoring):Tracks sales performance by Retail Partner and Brand against projections.Investigates and addresses any sales exceptions or discrepancies.Performs partner site audits to ensure product listings are accurate and up-to-date.Ensures product compliance and monitors accounts (Product Compliance / Account Monitoring):Monitors account health and submits tickets to resolve issues.Conducts In-Season and Post-Season Analysis:Conducts sales performance reviews during and after sales seasons.Monitors Inventory and Pricing Management:Monitors inventory availability and updates retailer allocations based on sales performance.Update pricing across retail partnerships.Accounting ReconciliationCollects and organizes reconciliation forms from partners into Excel sheets for accounting purposes.Performs other duties that may be assigned from time to time.What We‚Äôre Looking ForBachelor‚Äôs Degree in any field.Minimum of two (2) to five (5) years relevant experience in eCommerce, particularly in setting up products on retail/marketplace websites.Must have expertise in content optimization to boost conversion rates.Must have familiarity with eCommerce Key Performance Indicators (Traffic, AOV, Conversion Rate) and the supporting inputs that drive performance.Must have strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel and other relevant software tools.Must have familiarity and experience with marketplace tools like Helium 10, Jungle Scout, etc.Must have the ability to quickly learn and train the team on new tools as needed.Must have attention to detail and a proactive approach to task management.Location:TheIndirect Sales Support Specialistposition is a remote working position for Balsam International Unlimited Company - Philippine ROHQ in Manila. Team members in the Philippines are located within Metro Manila, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Pampanga, Rizal, and Tarlac areas only.Our Must-havesMust attend occasional in-person meetings.Must have a fast, reliable DSL, Fiber, or Broadband connection (not mobile or broadband stick) as the primary internet connection with a minimum actual speed of 50MBPS.Note:An online assessment will also be part of the recruitment process.Status:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits.Hardware Provision:Company-issued Laptop will be provided on your first day.At Balsam International, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, this includes:Government-mandated Benefits (SSS, PAG-IBIG, PhilHealth)13th Month PayPaid Leaves. We use time off to rest, go on vacation, or just sleep in! Our paid time off is flexible to our needs.Internet Subsidy. With internet allowance, we are set up for success.Healthcare Coverage (+ 2 dependents). We worry less about rising medical costs with flexible, quality healthcare benefits.Maternity, Paternity, and Solo Parent Benefit. We make sure parents are supported while they navigate work and family life.Continuous Learning and Professional Development Benefit. Our professional and personal development are fully supported. Whether it be online courses, workshops, or books!Mental Health Support. We manage work and life's challenges through Mental Health Day breaks, 24/7 professional counseling, and curated webinars.Company Incentive. An additional cash-based perk for all our Brandits based on the company's performance.Meeting & Team Building Allowance. Happy tummies make our meetings more fun and productive!Shutdown Week. We can spend more time on things that matter with an additional one-week paid time off on top of paid leaves.Volunteer Time Off. With two paid days off, we are able to volunteer for advocacies we believe in.Bereavement Leave. We get additional paid leaves when a loved one passes to grieve and provide immediate support to our families.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Senior Manager, Wholesale & B2B Sales Strategy
linkedin Dublin (Ireland) Tue, 18 Ma N/A
Job DescriptionAs Senior Manager, Wholesale & B2B Sales Strategy you will lead impactful projects for our fast-growing International business, working closely with senior leaders and cross-functional ...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionAs Senior Manager, Wholesale & B2B Sales Strategy you will lead impactful projects for our fast-growing International business, working closely with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to expand our B2B and wholesale footprint through strategic partnerships and targeted growth initiatives. Success in this role requires a knack for breaking down big problems into key questions, a strong passion for taking initiative, learning, and driving recommendations to completion. You‚Äôll thrive as a self-starter who pays close attention to detail while managing multiple projects, adapts to ambiguity and evolving priorities, and learns quickly. With a flexible work style, you‚Äôll collaborate across functions and geographies, ready to jump in and help‚Äîeven in roles outside your expertise‚Äîto drive the planning and implementation of key growth projects in a dynamic, creative, and inspiring work environment.This full-time position reports to the VP of International and is located in Dublin, Ireland. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which includes three days in-office.To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.What You‚Äôll DoStrategy Development and Business Growth:Develop and execute a comprehensive, long-term strategy for B2B and wholesale partnerships across international marketsIdentify, evaluate, and pursue strategic partnership opportunities, negotiating complex deals that align with company objectives and profitability goalsConduct thorough market analysis, staying on top of industry trends and competitive landscapes to inform strategic decision-makingCreate and implement go-to-market strategies for new international B2B and wholesale initiativesFinancial Management And Performance OptimizationDevelop financial models and business cases for new initiatives, forecasting revenue and profitability for international B2B and wholesale channelsEstablish KPIs and metrics to measure success, analyzing performance data to identify trends and areas for improvementWork with operations teams to ensure efficient execution and continuous improvement of international B2B and wholesale programsCross-functional Leadership And CollaborationGuide cross functional team members by identifying opportunities for growth, leveraging team strengths, and developing members toward organizational effectivenessCollaborate with senior leadership to align international B2B and wholesale strategies with overall company goalsDevelop and maintain relationships with key decision-makers in target companies and marketsProvide regular updates and insights to senior management on the progress and performance of international B2B and wholesale initiativesQualificationsBachelor's degree required; MBA or other relevant advanced degree preferred10+ years of experience in business development, strategy, or related fields, with a focus on B2B and wholesale channelsStrong understanding of international markets, particularly in EuropeRetail experience in a relevant industry requiredProven track record of developing and executing successful international growth strategiesAdvanced financial acumen, including:Ability to create and interpret complex financial modelsProficiency in financial analysis and forecasting for B2B and wholesale channelsExperience in budgeting and financial planning for international business operationsOutstanding analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data insights into actionable strategiesStrong familiarity with data analysis tools and CRM systems, including the ability to write clear, detailed requirements for technical teamsExceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence senior stakeholdersExperience leading and mentoring teams in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentFluency in English required; additional language skills are a plusAbout Us: Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/At Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, this includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive planCompany contributions toward private healthcare coverageCompany pension and employer contributionsPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesAnnual continuous learning benefit up to ‚Ç¨1,100 per person, per fiscal yearUp to ‚Ç¨300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentAccess to mental health and wellness perksParking and transit employer contributionsAt Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Senior Manager of eCommerce

Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionAs Senior Manager of eCommerce you will be a cross functional leader who develops and implements comprehensive eCommerce strategies for Balsam‚Äôs international markets. You will be adept at considering cultural nuances and local consumer behaviors and applying them to global ecommerce and brand strategies. You will be a key contributor to the eCommerce roadmap and proactively identify and capitalize on new growth opportunities. This position works closely with globally distributed eCommerce Operations, UI/UX, Marketing, and Creative teams to establish and launch inspirational, educational, and conversion‚Äêdriven website strategies and content that optimize the shopper experience and proves our brand value to our shoppers.This full-time position reports to the VP of eCommerce and is located in Dublin, Ireland. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which includes three days in-office. This role will require occasional travel to the US and/or Philippines, including a 2-3 week onboarding period in Balsam‚Äôs Redwood City, CA headquarters.To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.What You‚Äôll DoBe a cross functional leader who champions ecommerce best practices to deliver a best in class shopper experience on site.Use data & analytics to understand customer purchase patterns and friction points, and leverage these insights to tailor site content and shopper journeyGain a deep understanding of cultural shopping nuances and incorporate them into site strategiesAbility to explore the site experience from the customers‚Äô perspective and weave intentional strategies throughout the sitePresent findings to the Executive Team and cross functional stakeholders, crafting the overarching story from various data pointsDevelop and maintain seasonal site calendar; planning content and campaigns to meet or exceed eCommerce KPIsIdentify business challenges, develop creative solutions, and take ownership of driving those solutions to fruitionWork closely with Localization team to stay up to date on eCommerce regulations and compliance requirements to ensure that our international sitesLead a small team of talented individuals to execute on site merchandising strategies, ensuring a seamless and engaging customer experienceWork with urgency and strong drive to improve the shopper journey and deliver on International goalsPartner with cross-functional teams (marketing, merchandising, operations, business management) to ensure a cohesive international brand experience and inform the strategy for the siteProactively identify and champion new growth initiatives, pushing and exploring the boundaries of what's possibleFoster a culture of ownership and initiative, empowering the team to contribute their bestPeople Management:Conduct regular conversations with direct reports covering performance and assessing career advancement opportunities within the team, engage with the larger team through skip level and monthly functional meetings, coordinate hiring plans, and guide team to adhere to company normsPeople Development:Lead team by providing guidance on career development, fostering diversity and inclusion, identifying training needs, promoting our values, and supporting collaboration across teamsWhat You Bring To The Table10+ years of experience in eCommerce/RetailStrong presenter who can tell a story through data, communicating clearly and with confidence to all levelsA go-getter who thrives on shaping their own path and consistently pushes for growth and innovationThrives in a dynamic environment with a rapid test & learn mindset; comfortable taking calculated risksCustomer-centric mindset with understanding and sensitivity to culture shopper differencesExceptional Analytical, Problem-Solving, and Critical Thinking skillsAbility to influence across functions and communicate effectively across levelsPrior experience in successfully leading fast paced cross-functional projectsStrong understanding of web-based consumer behavior and eCommerce KPIsExperience in working with Creative, Merchandising, and Product Management teamsBachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher in Merchandising, Economics, General Business Management or equivalentAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. Senior Manager of Creative Content
linkedin Redwood City (United States) Sat, 08 Fe N/A
Job DescriptionWe are looking for an innovative and strategic leader with a passion for visual storytelling and a strong understanding of home d√©cor trends to help us fulfill our mission of creating j...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionWe are looking for an innovative and strategic leader with a passion for visual storytelling and a strong understanding of home d√©cor trends to help us fulfill our mission of creating joy together. The Senior Manager of Creative Content will be creative, detail-oriented, and will collaborate closely with creative leads and cross-functional partners to create high-quality visual content that evolves our brand story and drives engagement with our target audience.This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the elevation of the visual identity of our home d√©cor retail brand through creative leadership, strategic planning, and high-quality content production. This role requires experience in photography and videography for both print and digital channels, as well as knowledge of photo and video editing, production, styling, and branding. Key areas of responsibilities include the development of creative concepts and the ability to bring these ideas to life in photo, video, and memorable customer experiences.This full-time position is a part of the Creative Team reporting to the VP, Creative Director and supports the Balsam Hill global brand. It is hands-on with leadership responsibilities including mentoring and directing studio managers, producers, photographers, videographers and editors, both for internal and external teams. This role is a brand ambassador and effectively collaborates with other Creative team leaders, merchants, marketing, vendors, and external production teams.This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in our Redwood City or Burlingame offices as well as additional time on location for shoots throughout the year.What You‚Äôll DoCreative Leadership and Content Development:Collaborate with creative leads to develop and maintain a clear and compelling creative vision for the photo and video content produced by the studioIntroduce holistic storytelling strategies that support business initiatives across multiple mediums including print and digitalPartner with marketing and eCommerce teams to develop comprehensive content strategies that support product launches, promotions, campaigns and brand storytellingIntroduce new concepts and ideas through swipes and storyboard developmentBring creative vision to life by overseeing creative development of media productions from concept through executionWork with external talent to develop photo and video style guidesStay updated on current home d√©cor trends, photography techniques and video production styles to ensure the studio‚Äôs work is fresh and relevantMaintain an intimate understanding of the customer and their journey throughout every touchpoint to create impact and build loyaltyWork closely with art directors, photographers, videographers and stylists to ensure work is high-quality, inspiring and on-brandIn partnership with our Global Brand Design team, brainstorm and contribute creative ideas for visual content that resonates with our target audience and drives engagementProduction ManagementCoordinate with Creative Operations Team to drive timelines and achieve milestonesCollaborate with Creative Operations to develop new best practices for post-production processes and workflowsOptimize budget to ensure efficiency and efficacy of all work produced and be accountable for budget reporting to Creative Ops teamPartner with producers to oversee high level scheduling and freelance hiresDevelop vision for building a best-in-class media studio and partner with Studio Manager to build out a roadmap for executing upgradesEnsure that team is delivering on postproduction needs that align with brand standards and advise on asset management and workflowsNegotiate contracts and manage relationships with external vendors and freelancersManage and track asset usage rights, including negotiating permissions, monitoring expiration dates, and educating teams on compliance requirements to ensure legal and proper use of all assetsTeam LeadershipLead, mentor and inspire a team that includes producers, studio management and post-production artistsDisplay leadership and inspire teams to develop compelling and meaningful work by fostering creative exploration, collaboration and innovationGuide direct reports and functional team members by identifying opportunities for growth, leveraging team strengths, and developing members toward organizational effectiveness.QualificationsWhat you bring to the table:Knowledge and experience with both the technical and creative side of media productionBachelor‚Äôs degree in Design or equivalent work experience10+ years of experience with consumer brands, campaigns, and photo productionProficient in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)Online portfolio displaying exceptional strategic, conceptual, and visual designDeep knowledge of media production and best practicesAbility to respond and give productive feedbackFlexible and adapts to the changing needs of the businessSupport process, proactively identifying challenges and fostering actionable solutionsExcellence in a deadline-driven environment with the ability to manage multiple prioritiesHighly self-motivated, with excellent communication skills, conflict resolution, and negotiation skillsFamiliarity with Ecommerce and digital marketing trendsAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. Where an individual falls within that range will vary based on several factors including geographic location and may vary depending on candidate qualifications and experience, applicable skills, and other job-related factors. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. B2B eCommerce Site Merchandising Manager
linkedin Redwood City (United States) Tue, 24 De N/A
Job DescriptionAs the B2B eCommerce Site Merchandising Manager, you will be pivotal in launching and the ongoing optimization of our Shopify website. You will develop and execute the content strategy ...
Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionAs the B2B eCommerce Site Merchandising Manager, you will be pivotal in launching and the ongoing optimization of our Shopify website. You will develop and execute the content strategy to create a seamless and engaging shopping experience that drives customer engagement and conversions. You will ensure a customer-first site experience while aligning with overall site management and operational goals.This full-time position reports to the VP of Digital Experience and is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What You‚Äôll DoDevelop and execute a site content strategy focused on enhancing the overall eCommerce experience for our B2B customers. Manage the content that displays to customers on the homepage and landing pages across desktop and mobile web, including owning the cross functional process of requesting content based on the site refresh calendar and uploading all content in the content management systemCollaborate with VP Digital Experience and B2B Business Manager to build content strategy, ensuring content is both engaging and aligned with customer expectationsMonitor customer behavior and identify opportunities to improve the user journey, enhancing overall site experienceCommunicate Creative briefs and partner with Creative team to ensure an engaging and brand enhancing shopping experience. Enhance customer journey with compelling descriptions, high-quality images, and relevant keywords to improve visibility and engagementDevelop and maintain a clear and intuitive product categorization and navigation structurePartner with SEO team to implement SEO best practices to increase organic search visibility and drive quality trafficUse analytics tools to track and analyze website performance, leveraging insights to continuously refine the CX. Make improvements to product sorts, search functionality, and merchandising tacticsProvide supervision to a small team, defining tasks aligned with common goals, and fosters the professional development of team members through active discussion, feedback, coaching, and mentorshipWhat You Bring To The TableBachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field8+ years of work experience with at least 5+ years of experience in Shopify site management and content merchandising, with a focus on digital experienceB2B experience is highly preferredProven expertise in developing and executing site content strategies on Shopify that drives business outcomesStrong analytical skills and experience using customer insights and performance data to inform continuous site optimizationProficiency in SEO principles and the ability to optimize site contentStrong understanding of the 3 C‚Äôs (Customer, Company, Competitor) and 4 P‚Äôs (Product, Price, Place, Promotion) of MarketingDemonstrate self-motivation and take initiative to drive progress independentlyThrive in ambiguity by making thoughtful decisions with incomplete informationExcellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally across levels of seniority to align content and customer experience goalsTravel 1-2x per year for conferences and off-sites as requiredAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. Job DescriptionBalsam Hill, a leader in premium artificial Christmas trees and holiday d√©cor, is seeking an accomplished leader to drive our indirect channel efforts and accelerate omnichannel growth through strategic wholesale partnerships and marketplace expansion.Reporting to the Chief People & Growth Officer, the VP of Indirect Channel Sales will play a pivotal role in developing and executing comprehensive strategies to expand Balsam Hill's market presence through indirect channels. This role will drive strategic initiatives, manage complex relationships across multiple stakeholders, and ensure the successful execution of partnership-driven growth opportunities. While the primary focus will be on the U.S. business, successful candidates will provide mentorship and guidance to the international growth team, offering leadership and insight into international indirect channel growth.If you‚Äôre a visionary leader with a passion for omnichannel innovation and a track record of driving impactful results through indirect sales channels, we want to hear from you. This full-time position is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office. Regular travel (~10-20%) to key retail partners and team locations will be required, primarily within the U.S.What You‚Äôll DoDevelop and execute comprehensive indirect channel strategies that align with Balsam Hill‚Äôs direct digital and in-store experience and support our omnichannel goalsLead and optimize Balsam Hill's indirect channel business, including:Strategic relationships with national retailersMarketplace partnerships and growthReverse logistics programsDrive analytical decision-making through:Demand planning and forecastingSupply chain optimizationSales performance analyticsChannel profitability analysisCollaborate cross-functionally with:Merchandising teams on product development and assortment strategyMarketing teams on channel-specific programs and brand positioningOperations teams on supply chain and reverse logisticsTechnology teams on e-commerce and system integrationsInternational business teams on strategies to accelerate indirect international channel growthLead strategic planning and execution for:Amazon business growth and optimizationNational account managementLead the team to achieve business outcomes by promoting collaboration and alignment with organizational values; translate company initiatives into a clear vision, aligning team actions with company priorities while fostering performance and professional developmentWhat You Bring To The Table20+ years of progressive retail and account management experience; global experience strongly preferred10+ years of leadership experience with P&L responsibilityProven track record in omnichannel retail strategy and executionExtensive experience in:Strategic planning and executionChannel strategy developmentProduct marketing and developmentAmazon marketplace optimizationDemonstrated success in managing relationships with major retailers (Target, Costco, Sam‚Äôs Club, Lowes, Home Depot, Amazon, Walmart, etc.)Strong background in both traditional retail and eCommerceExperience in multi-channel sales team leadership (direct and indirect); proven ability to recruit and develop high-performing teamsTrack record of successful cross-functional leadership, relationship building, and stakeholder managementLeadership competencies:Strong analytical and data-driven decision-makingExecutive presence and communication skillsChange management and organizational development expertiseNote:the responsibilities and scope of this role are subject to change as business needs evolve.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home d√©cor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways.
