Job Title Job Board Location Date Posted Age Description
DIGITAL MARKETING AND CONTENT MANAGER
indeed Bassett (United States) Fri, 05 De N/A
Req #105 Bassett Furniture Corporate Office, 3525 Fairystone Prk Hwy, Bassett, Virginia, United States of America Job Description Posted Wednesday, October 1, 2025, 11:00 PM **Digital Marketing & ...
Show full description ‚ñº
Req #105 Bassett Furniture Corporate Office, 3525 Fairystone Prk Hwy, Bassett, Virginia, United States of America Job Description Posted Wednesday, October 1, 2025, 11:00 PM **Digital Marketing & Content Manager** **Position Overview** The Digital Marketing & Content Manager will plan, assist with creation and oversee digital content to align with marketing goals. This role is responsible for analyzing performance of content/campaigns across social media channels. This includes maintaining content calendars and sharing information across internal and external teams. There will be a strong focus on preparing and leading the social media strategy to drive engagement and brand awareness. They will communicate events and assets to digital partners, licensed and open market partners. The manager will collaborate with the marketing team and other departments to develop online strategies that increase company brand awareness. They will make sure that all company communications have consistent messages across social and digital channels. They will help identify processes, techniques, and opportunities for improvement of communication of assets and events. This person will work closely with the marketing team, sales team, licensed and open market teams and outside agencies. They should be able to work collaboratively and effectively across the team while focusing on action and learning. They also will measure how effective communications strategies are and suggest improvements. **Key Responsibilities** * Develop and lead a comprehensive content strategy that supports the business and marketing objectives * Collaborate with copywriters, graphic designers and the marketing team to produce high-quality, on-brand content * Create and manage content calendars, including scheduling and publishing organic posts * Support content creation, including video/reels, interactive formats, and other digital assets * Track, analyze, and report on content performance, providing insights and recommendations * Manage influencer partnerships and evaluate ROI * Stay current on industry trends, competitor activity, and consumer behavior **Skills & Competencies** * Expertise in social media strategy, execution, and performance analysis * Proficiency in content formats including video, reels, interactive forms/features, and GIFs * Strong project management skills with ability to lead cross-functional collaboration * Excellent communication and presentation skills * High attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a self-motivated approach **Required Qualifications** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, business, communications, or related field * 5-7 years of experience in digital marketing and social platform management * Proven expertise with Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, including content publishing and performance tracking * Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint * Hybrid work arrangement: partial remote flexibility with required in-office days at corporate HQ in Bassett, VA *IND1 #LI-KS1 #ZR* Job Details Pay Type **Salary** Bassett Furniture Corporate Office, 3525 Fairystone Prk Hwy, Bassett, Virginia, United States of America
MARKETING SUPPORT SPECIALIST
indeed Newton (United States) Fri, 05 De N/A
Req #128 Lane Venture, 2309 N. College Ave., Newton, North Carolina, United States of America Job Description Posted Monday, November 10, 2025, 11:00 PM **Sales & Marketing Support Specialist** T...
Show full description ‚ñº
Req #128 Lane Venture, 2309 N. College Ave., Newton, North Carolina, United States of America Job Description Posted Monday, November 10, 2025, 11:00 PM **Sales & Marketing Support Specialist** This position supports the Lane Venture marketing team in promoting furniture products and the brand across multiple channels. The role includes supporting the team with clerical and administrative tasks including maintaining accurate content, managing marketing materials, and assisting with the coordination of marketing campaigns, while ensuring consistent brand representation across all customer touchpoints. Responsibilities to include: * Maintaining the product price books with precise product information, images, and pricing. * Managing updates to the company website and e-commerce platforms, ensuring accurate product descriptions, images, and pricing. * Creating and managing documents, spreadsheets, and presentations. * Conducting data entry, retrieval, and database maintenance. * Managing and updating marketing materials, website content, and other media platforms. * Maintaining the product calendar to ensure the timely delivery of marketing assets. * Supporting the development of marketing materials, such as brochures and catalogs. * Assisting in planning and executing marketing campaigns for furniture collections, seasonal promotions, and showroom events. * Helping to organize events for the furniture market. * Providing administrative support to the marketing team, including data entry and scheduling. * Ensuring brand guidelines are adhered to across all channels and materials. * Possible occasional travel for the furniture market may be required. Key Skills Ideal candidate will have: * 1 ‚Äì 3 years of experience in marketing, communications, or administrative support. * Proficient with marketing software and tools (Adobe software) * Proficient in Excel and all Microsoft software * Strong organization skills and attention to detail and high levels of accuracy * Excellent written and verbal communication abilities * Ability to multitask and meet deadlines * Must be self-motivated. Benefits: * Medical, dental, and vision plan * Short and Long-term disability * Paid holidays and paid vacation * Life insurance * AFLAC * 401(k) plan * Stock Purchase Plan * Employee Assistance Program * Tuition Reimbursement Programs online, mail a resume to Bassett Furniture, Inc., PO Box 47, Newton, NC 28658, or fax resume to 828-465-7792. Job Details Pay Type **Hourly** Lane Venture, 2309 N. College Ave., Newton, North Carolina, United States of America
DIGITAL MARKETING AND CONTENT MANAGER
linkedin Bassett (United States) Sat, 25 Oc N/A
**Digital Marketing & Content Manager****Position Overview**The Digital Marketing & Content Manager will plan, assist with creation and oversee digital content to align with marketing goals. This role...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Digital Marketing & Content Manager****Position Overview**The Digital Marketing & Content Manager will plan, assist with creation and oversee digital content to align with marketing goals. This role is responsible for analyzing performance of content/campaigns across social media channels. This includes maintaining content calendars and sharing information across internal and external teams. There will be a strong focus on preparing and leading the social media strategy to drive engagement and brand awareness. They will communicate events and assets to digital partners, licensed and open market partners. The manager will collaborate with the marketing team and other departments to develop online strategies that increase company brand awareness. They will make sure that all company communications have consistent messages across social and digital channels. They will help identify processes, techniques, and opportunities for improvement of communication of assets and events. This person will work closely with the marketing team, sales team, licensed and open market teams and outside agencies. They should be able to work collaboratively and effectively across the team while focusing on action and learning. They also will measure how effective communications strategies are and suggest improvements. **Key Responsibilities** * Develop and lead a comprehensive content strategy that supports the business and marketing objectives * Collaborate with copywriters, graphic designers and the marketing team to produce high-quality, on-brand content * Create and manage content calendars, including scheduling and publishing organic posts * Support content creation, including video/reels, interactive formats, and other digital assets * Track, analyze, and report on content performance, providing insights and recommendations * Manage influencer partnerships and evaluate ROI * Stay current on industry trends, competitor activity, and consumer behavior **Skills & Competencies** * Expertise in social media strategy, execution, and performance analysis * Proficiency in content formats including video, reels, interactive forms/features, and GIFs * Strong project management skills with ability to lead cross-functional collaboration * Excellent communication and presentation skills * High attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a self-motivated approach **Required Qualifications** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, business, communications, or related field * 5-7 years of experience in digital marketing and social platform management * Proven expertise with Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, including content publishing and performance tracking * Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint * Hybrid work arrangement: partial remote flexibility with required in-office days at corporate HQ in Bassett, VA *IND1 #ZR*

Digital Marketing & Content Manager Position Overview The Digital Marketing & Content Manager will plan, assist with creation and oversee digital content to align with marketing goals. This role is responsible for analyzing performance of content/campaigns across social media channels. This includes maintaining content calendars and sharing information across internal and external teams. There will be a strong focus on preparing and leading the social media strategy to drive engagement and brand awareness. They will communicate events and assets to digital partners, licensed and open market partners. The manager will collaborate with the marketing team and other departments to develop online strategies that increase company brand awareness. They will make sure that all company communications have consistent messages across social and digital channels. They will help identify processes, techniques, and opportunities for improvement of communication of assets and events. This person will work closely with the marketing team, sales team, licensed and open market teams and outside agencies. They should be able to work collaboratively and effectively across the team while focusing on action and learning. They also will measure how effective communications strategies are and suggest improvements. Key Responsibilities * Develop and lead a comprehensive content strategy that supports the business and marketing objectives * Collaborate with copywriters, graphic designers and the marketing team to produce high-quality, on-brand content * Create and manage content calendars, including scheduling and publishing organic posts * Support content creation, including video/reels, interactive formats, and other digital assets * Track, analyze, and report on content performance, providing insights and recommendations * Manage influencer partnerships and evaluate ROI * Stay current on industry trends, competitor activity, and consumer behavior Skills & Competencies * Expertise in social media strategy, execution, and performance analysis * Proficiency in content formats including video, reels, interactive forms/features, and GIFs * Strong project management skills with ability to lead cross-functional collaboration * Excellent communication and presentation skills * High attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a self-motivated approach Required Qualifications * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, business, communications, or related field * 5-7 years of experience in digital marketing and social platform management * Proven expertise with Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, including content publishing and performance tracking * Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint * Hybrid work arrangement: partial remote flexibility with required in-office days at corporate HQ in Bassett, VA IND1 #LI-KS1 #ZR

success.Cross-Channel Collaboration: Coordinate with channel owners (email, social, web, etc.) to ensure campaign elements are delivered on time and aligned with strategy.Project & Task Management: knowledge sharing.Customer Experience Awareness: Maintain an understanding of the customer journey and assist in identifying opportunities to enhance engagement.Administrative Support: Provide general linkedin United States Thu, 24 Ju N/A
We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality, traits, ...
Show full description ‚ñº
We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality, traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more inclusive environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.The Performance Marketing Specialist with a focus on Paid Social is a performance-driven, growth-focused role that owns the strategy, execution, and optimization of paid media campaigns for our e-commerce business. This role is critical in driving customer acquisition, improving return on ad spend (ROAS), and scaling revenue across key platforms like Meta and Pinterest. They work cross-functionally to fuel full-funnel growth‚Äîfrom awareness through conversion‚Äîacross a dynamic and fast-paced digital landscape.Job ResponsibilitiesLaunch, manage, QA, and continuously optimize paid social, display, and performance campaigns, with an emphasis on Meta (Facebook/Instagram), Pinterest and other social media advertising platforms to drive customer acquisition and online sales.Develop, implement, and iterate on full-funnel campaign strategies, leveraging advanced bidding, segmentation, and creative testing to hit growth and efficiency goals (CPA, ROAS, LTV).Manage and refine product feeds for each of the social media platforms, ensuring accurate data, up-to-date inventory, and optimal performance for shopping and dynamic ad placements.Plan and execute A/B and multivariate tests across creative, copy, audience, and placements to improve performance and discover new opportunities.Partner with creative, merchandising, and integrated marketing teams to ensure content is optimized for performance and aligned with seasonal product launches and promotions.Stay ahead of trends in paid media, social commerce, and e-commerce ad tech; proactively recommend new platform tests, ad products, and growth tactics.Monitor, report on, and analyze performance using platform tools and internal dashboards, providing actionable insights to inform strategy and spend allocation.Job Requirements And Skills3‚Äì5 years of hands-on experience managing paid campaigns in an e-commerce or DTC environment.Deep platform expertise across Meta, Pinterest, TikTok, and other social media advertising platforms; strong understanding of social commerce trends and algorithm dynamics.Experience with Google and Microsoft Ads (Search, Shopping, Display, Video) is a strong plus.Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, campaign reporting tools, and performance analytics (GA4, Meta Ads Manager, etc.), working with and manipulating large data sets. Using data to identify opportunities for improvement.Proven success managing campaigns to CPA, ROAS, and conversion rate goals.Collaborative and communicative team player with strong project management and stakeholder alignment skills.Strategic thinker and problem-solver with a creative edge and a passion for testing, optimizing, and scaling what works.Salary Range:$59,450.00. - $74,312.50EducationBachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent work experience, ideally in marketing, business, or a related field.Physical RequirementsMust be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time.Equal Employment OpportunityIt is company policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and associates. This policy includes our commitment to ensure that all employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, pregnancy, veteran status (including Vietnam-era veterans), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other non-job-related characteristic protected by law.Who We Are:We‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer:401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women‚Äôs Network, Women In Tech)And More‚Ä¶Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical Requirements:This position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. indeed Utah (United States) Thu, 05 Ju N/A

We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality is at the core of diversity, and those traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more diverse environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.This position is eligible for remote work. Currently we can hire employees in the following states: Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Kansas, Maine, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin, Wyoming. This role will have occasional on site expectations.Key ResponsibilitiesStrategy Development & Execution:Develop and implement a comprehensive performance marketing strategy across Paid Media (PPC, display, social media ads, retargeting), Organic Search (SEO), and Marketplaces (e.g., Amazon, Walmart).Develop and execute full-funnel marketing strategies, integrating awareness, consideration, conversion, and retention tactics to drive customer acquisition, engagement, and loyalty while optimizing the customer journey for maximum ROI.Support omnichannel campaigns and strategies as we open / re-open store locations.Define KPIs, set ambitious yet achievable goals, and monitor performance metrics to optimize campaigns and drive customer acquisition, retention, and revenue growth.Identify emerging trends, platforms, and opportunities to enhance acquisition channels and maintain a competitive edge in the ecommerce landscape.Paid Media Management:Oversee the strategy, execution, and optimization of paid media campaigns across platforms such as Google Ads, Meta, TikTok, YouTube, and programmatic advertising.Manage budgets, allocate resources effectively, and ensure campaigns deliver strong ROI, CPA, and ROAS.Partner with creative teams to develop high-performing ad creatives and messaging that resonate with target audiences.Organic Search (SEO):Lead the development and execution of SEO strategies to increase organic traffic, improve search rankings, and drive conversions.Oversee keyword research, on-page and technical SEO, content optimization, and link-building initiatives.Collaborate with content and product teams to ensure website architecture and content align with SEO best practices.Lead out for optimizing websites and content for consumption and inclusion in generative AI LLMs.Marketplace Management:Drive performance on key marketplace platforms by optimizing product listings, advertising campaigns, and pricing strategies.Develop strategies to increase visibility, sales, and profitability on marketplaces while maintaining brand consistency.Monitor marketplace trends, policies, and competitive positioning to capitalize on growth opportunities.Team Leadership & Collaboration:Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team of performance marketers, SEO specialists, and marketplace managers.Foster a data-driven culture, encouraging innovation, testing, and optimization within the team.Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, creative, analytics, and sales) to align acquisition strategies with broader business goals.Analytics & Reporting:Utilize data analytics tools to track, analyze, and report on campaign performance, providing actionable insights to leadership. Work with the analytics team to develop new reporting and analysis needed to support performance measurement and optimization.Implement A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other data-driven methodologies to optimize marketing efforts.Present regular performance reports to executive leadership, highlighting successes, challenges, and strategic recommendations.Budget & Vendor Management:Manage multimillion-dollar marketing budgets, ensuring efficient allocation across channels and campaigns.Oversee relationships with external agencies, vendors, and platform partners to maximize performance and negotiate favorable terms.Skills and Experience10+ years of experience in performance marketing at a consumer-facing business, with a strong track record of driving growth through paid digital channels.Proven success managing large budgets and delivering on key KPIs.Experience leading and developing high-performing marketing teams.Strong analytical and financial skills; comfortable using data to guide strategy and optimize campaigns.Deep understanding of digital media platforms, attribution, and customer acquisition strategies.Ability to collaborate across teams and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Strong business judgment and strategic thinking, with a focus on measurable outcomes.Experience navigating a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.Salary Target: $176,000.00 - $198,000.00Application Deadline: 6/11/2025Bonus Eligible: Performance BonusEducation/ Licensing/Certification:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, or related field. MBA or master‚Äôs degree in related field, a plus.Physical RequirementsMust be able to sit and/or stand for long periods at a time.Equal Employment OpportunityIt is company policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and associates. Senior Product Manager, Marketing Technology and Personalization

We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality, traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more inclusive environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.Beyond, Inc. is seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead the evolution of our marketing technology stack across Bed Bath & Beyond, Overstock, and buybuy BABY. This role is central to enabling repeat purchases, customer loyalty, and long-term profitability through smarter, more personalized marketing.As a Strategic Product Leader, you will own the roadmap for MarTech capabilities spanning email, push, in-app messaging, audience segmentation, content personalization, and experimentation tooling. You‚Äôll work at the intersection of engineering, marketing, analytics, AI/ML, and external vendors to create the levers and infrastructure that help our teams deliver the right message to the right customer at the right time.Base Pay Range:$124,000 - $145,000Responsibilities:Priorities: Business Impact & Strategic FocusDrive initiatives that improve customer retention, LTV, and profitability through targeted and timely customer engagement.Prioritize projects that balance short-term marketing agility with long-term platform scalability and tech debt reduction.Establish clear success metrics tied to business outcomes: conversion rates, engagement, frequency of purchase, and opt-in retention.Process: Building Efficient, Scalable WorkflowsDefine and document martech workflows across campaign operations, audience segmentation, personalization, and A/B testing.Partner with Engineering and AI/ML teams to automate content delivery and decision-making using machine learning and generative AI.Implement and evolve data- and content-related processes that support dynamic campaign personalization at scale.Platforms: Vendor Strategy, AI, and Migration ManagementOwn platform evaluations and decisions as we shift from custom-built tools to best-in-class vendors like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Movable Ink, and Google Gemini.Collaborate with technical architects to design modular, extensible solutions that future-proof our MarTech stack.Lead platform migrations and manage a backlog of technical debt, deprecations, and upgrades with a strategic lens.People: Cross-Functional Leadership & InfluenceServe as the connective tissue between Marketing, Engineering, Analytics, AI/ML Engineering, Merchandising, and Brand.Act as the voice of product in high-stakes conversations; listen deeply, synthesize feedback, and align diverse stakeholders.Influence without authority by leading through clarity, transparency, and outcome-driven decision-making.Stay organized while fielding inbound requests from across the company‚Äîunderstanding when to say ‚Äúyes,‚Äù ‚Äúno,‚Äù or ‚Äúnot yet.‚ÄùRequirements8+ years of product management experience, ideally in e-commerce, ad tech, or martech.Proven track record building or evolving marketing platforms, personalization engines, or campaign operations tooling.Deep understanding of marketing workflows, including content authoring, audience segmentation, testing, and orchestration.Experience with Braze, Salesforce, Movable Ink, Google Gemini, CDPs, or similar platforms.Exposure to AI/ML technologies and how they can be used to optimize content delivery, segmentation, and performance.Strong data acumen‚Äîable to define KPIs, interpret dashboards, and partner with analysts to drive decisions.Proficient in Agile methodologies, backlog management, and cross-functional execution.Preferred QualificationsExperience managing large-scale platform migrations or vendor transitions.Familiarity with generative AI tools for subject line testing, creative scaling, or campaign analysis.Comfortable navigating strong personalities and conflicting priorities with empathy and clarity.BA/BS preferred; technical or analytical background preferred.Who We Are:We‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer:401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women‚Äôs Network, Women In Tech)And More‚Ä¶Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical Requirements:This position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality, traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more inclusive environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.The Performance Marketing Specialist with a focus on Paid Social is a performance-driven, growth-focused role that owns the strategy, execution, and optimization of paid media campaigns for our e-commerce business. This role is critical in driving customer acquisition, improving return on ad spend (ROAS), and scaling revenue across key platforms like Meta and Pinterest. They work cross-functionally to fuel full-funnel growth‚Äîfrom awareness through conversion‚Äîacross a dynamic and fast-paced digital landscape.Job ResponsibilitiesLaunch, manage, QA, and continuously optimize paid social, display, and performance campaigns, with an emphasis on Meta (Facebook/Instagram), Pinterest and other social media advertising platforms to drive customer acquisition and online sales.Develop, implement, and iterate on full-funnel campaign strategies, leveraging advanced bidding, segmentation, and creative testing to hit growth and efficiency goals (CPA, ROAS, LTV).Manage and refine product feeds for each of the social media platforms, ensuring accurate data, up-to-date inventory, and optimal performance for shopping and dynamic ad placements.Plan and execute A/B and multivariate tests across creative, copy, audience, and placements to improve performance and discover new opportunities.Partner with creative, merchandising, and integrated marketing teams to ensure content is optimized for performance and aligned with seasonal product launches and promotions.Stay ahead of trends in paid media, social commerce, and e-commerce ad tech; proactively recommend new platform tests, ad products, and growth tactics.Monitor, report on, and analyze performance using platform tools and internal dashboards, providing actionable insights to inform strategy and spend allocation.Job Requirements And Skills3‚Äì5 years of hands-on experience managing paid campaigns in an e-commerce or DTC environment.Deep platform expertise across Meta, Pinterest, TikTok, and other social media advertising platforms; strong understanding of social commerce trends and algorithm dynamics.Experience with Google and Microsoft Ads (Search, Shopping, Display, Video) is a strong plus.Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, campaign reporting tools, and performance analytics (GA4, Meta Ads Manager, etc.), working with and manipulating large data sets. Using data to identify opportunities for improvement.Proven success managing campaigns to CPA, ROAS, and conversion rate goals.Collaborative and communicative team player with strong project management and stakeholder alignment skills.Strategic thinker and problem-solver with a creative edge and a passion for testing, optimizing, and scaling what works.EducationBachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent work experience, ideally in marketing, business, or a related field.Physical RequirementsMust be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time.Equal Employment OpportunityIt is company policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and associates. This policy includes our commitment to ensure that all employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, pregnancy, veteran status (including Vietnam-era veterans), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other non-job-related characteristic protected by law.Who We Are:We‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer:401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women‚Äôs Network, Women In Tech)And More‚Ä¶Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical Requirements:This position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. Show full description ‚ñº
We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality is at the core of diversity, and those traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more diverse environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.This position is eligible for remote work. Currently we can hire employees in the following states: Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Kansas, Maine, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin, Wyoming. This role will have occasional on site expectations.ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIESIntroduce/launch new products or enhance existing products by communicating the product value and manage the cross-functional implementation of strategic plans.Develop comprehensive marketing messaging, positioning, and strategies for product buyers focused on designated product portfolios. Ensure that product marketing programs align with the company‚Äôs business strategies. Create specific marketing plans and activities for product(s) or product line(s) to establish, enhance or distinguish product placement.Study how competitors market their sponsored product platforms, what features they offer and why, and assess how Overstock compares in terms of performance, revenue, adoption etc.Determine the key features that attract customers and create marketing campaigns for products.Document buyers‚Äô processes, including the source of information and thewho,what, whenandwhybehind the decisions they make. Evaluate advertisers‚Äô needs, identify new opportunities to create partner value, and establish strategies to consistently engage advertisers to ultimately increase participation and revenue.Collaborate with Product Management and Marketing Communications to develop product positioning and messaging that resonates with target buyer audiences. Drive changes to increase sales and marketing processes based on what is learned.Develop marketing plans for products, including key activities and budgets to support the retention of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers.Assess the effectiveness of the marketing programs on an ongoing basis and report back to the business leaders with respect to required changes.Compensation Range: $54,325.00 - $67,650.00QUALIFICATIONS2+ years of experience in the eCommerce industry developing strategic business plans for product lines, writing sales, promotions, and marketing content, and launching new products from consumer insights.Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Merchandising, Business or a related field preferred.Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally and with multiple teams across the organization ranging from sales, technical/product development, etc.Excellent interpersonal and verbal and written communications skills and be able to professionally interact with employees at all levels of the company.Manage multiple projects simultaneously and effectively synthesizing goals and objectives and laying strategic plans while monitoring their progress.Strong time management and decision-making skillsCreative problem-solving and project management skills.Ability to think innovatively, connect the dots and create business building insights.Who We Are:We‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer:401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesOnsite Health ClinicTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramOnsite Fitness CenterEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women‚Äôs Network, Women In Tech)And More‚Ä¶Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical Requirements:This position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. You may also be required to lift up to 25 pounds occasionally. Bending, stooping and reaching are also frequently required.Equal Employment Opportunity:It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and associates. We Go BeyondAt Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality is at the core of diversity, and those traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more diverse environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.This position is eligible for remote work. Currently we can hire employees in the following states: Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Kansas, Maine, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin, Wyoming. This role will have occasional on site expectations.Essential Job DutiesIntroduce/launch new products or enhance existing products by communicating the product value and manage the cross-functional implementation of strategic plans.Develop comprehensive marketing messaging, positioning, and strategies for product buyers focused on designated product portfolios. Ensure that product marketing programs align with the company‚Äôs business strategies. Create specific marketing plans and activities for product(s) or product line(s) to establish, enhance or distinguish product placement.Study how competitors market their sponsored product platforms, what features they offer and why, and assess how Overstock compares in terms of performance, revenue, adoption etc.Determine the key features that attract customers and create marketing campaigns for products.Document buyers‚Äô processes, including the source of information and the who, what, when and why behind the decisions they make. Evaluate advertisers‚Äô needs, identify new opportunities to create partner value, and establish strategies to consistently engage advertisers to ultimately increase participation and revenue.Collaborate with Product Management and Marketing Communications to develop product positioning and messaging that resonates with target buyer audiences. Drive changes to increase sales and marketing processes based on what is learned.Develop marketing plans for products, including key activities and budgets to support the retention of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers.Assess the effectiveness of the marketing programs on an ongoing basis and report back to the business leaders with respect to required changes.Compensation Range:$54,325.00 - $67,650.00Qualifications2+ years of experience in the eCommerce industry developing strategic business plans for product lines, writing sales, promotions, and marketing content, and launching new products from consumer insights.Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Merchandising, Business or a related field preferred.Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally and with multiple teams across the organization ranging from sales, technical/product development, etc.Excellent interpersonal and verbal and written communications skills and be able to professionally interact with employees at all levels of the company.Manage multiple projects simultaneously and effectively synthesizing goals and objectives and laying strategic plans while monitoring their progress.Strong time management and decision-making skillsCreative problem-solving and project management skills.Ability to think innovatively, connect the dots and create business building insights.Who We AreWe‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesOnsite Health ClinicTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramOnsite Fitness CenterEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women‚Äôs Network, Women In Tech)And More‚Ä¶Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical RequirementsThis position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. We Go BeyondAt Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality is at the core of diversity, and those traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more diverse environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.This position is eligible for remote work. Currently we can hire employees in the following states: Arizona, California, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Kansas, Maine, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin, Wyoming. This role will have occasional on site expectations.Job ResponsibilitiesDevelop highly effective and personalized email and push marketing strategy and manage the Email operations teamColloborate with various cross functional teams including marketing, merchandising, product, data activation, finance and engineering to increase sales, profitability and improve brand awarenessOwn and implement testing strategies to increase ROI for the email and Push programsWork with the creative team to develop effective email and push messaging and designsProvide expertise, leadership and direction on complex and personalized dynamic messaging, emails, customer segmentation, targeting and email coupon strategyOversee proper set-up, testing and deployment of email and push campaignsWork with a team of resources responsible for database set-up, segmentation, and executing out bound email marketing campaigns tracking performance relative to targets and continually optimizing resultsOversee management of email and push marketing calendars, lead email white listing & ISP relations, CAN-SPAM compliance, list scrubbing, etc, refine and continually improve email marketing processes both on the marketing and technical sideStudy email industry best practices and provide recommendations to improve Overstock.com‚Äôs email and push programsProduce market research on competitor programs with recommendations to improve email programs and the email software/hardware systemsWork with Overstock.com‚Äôs Engineering teams on email software system architecture, upgrades and enhancementsExperience hiring and leading diverse teamsCompensation Range: $153,750.00 - $191,675.00Job RequirementsB.S. in Marketing and/or a related field required, Masters degree or equivalent experience preferred. Technical and Analytical background preferred.10+ years experience with email and Push Marketing, experience with databases5+ years of leadership experienceExperience in segmentation, multi-variate testing and/or other marketing testing, and marketing data analysisExperience in execution of complex, trigger based campaignsFamiliarity with HTML, CSS and SQLKnowledge of reputation management best practices such as white listing and list managementExcellent quantitative skills with an ability to identify trends/insights from dataDemonstrated ability to drive revenue and response from email and Push messaging programsStrong communication skills (written, verbal and presentation) and ability to present to both technical and non-technical audiencesStrong experience using state of the art marketing automation and multi-channel orchestration platforms (Braze Experience a plus)Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple prioritiesProficiency in Excel, PPT, Word and other MS Office applications, experience with online analytics and BI tools such as Google Analytics, Looker, Micro Stratefy, Data StudioWho We AreWe‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. Director, Integrated Marketing

Show full description ‚ñº
We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality is at the core of diversity, and those traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more diverse environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.Key Responsibilities:Strategic Marketing Leadership:Develop and oversee the strategic direction of integrated marketing efforts across all channels, ensuring alignment with the company's long-term goals and brand vision.Collaborate closely with executive leadership and cross functional teams to ensure that marketing strategies support broader business objectives and competitive positioning.Strategic Planning And Leadership:Lead the a team of Integrated Marketing managers who oversee the planning, scheduling and execution of high impact marketing initiatives.Ensure cohesive messaging and branding across 360-degree campaigns, including digital, social, email and paid marketing channels.Data-Driven Insights & Performance Measurement:Use basic analytics to drive strategy, evaluate campaign performance, and optimize marketing investments to support the business.Must be able to coach the team on basic analytics to evaluate campaign efficacy.Leverage relationships with analytics teams to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-informed adjustments to improve campaign effectiveness.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Foster collaboration among marketing channel leads, product owners, and other departments to align on strategy, synchronize efforts, and prioritize marketing initiatives.Act as the primary liaison between marketing, merchandising, and creative teams, ensuring all creative and product requests align with campaign goals and brand standards.Process Development & Optimization:Oversee the Go-To-Market planning process and ensure it is implemented to support financial and strategic needs of the business.Create and refine processes and workflows that enhance the efficiency of integrated marketing efforts and enable scalability while allowing for business critical pivots.Implement best practices and optimize use of project management tools for smooth execution of multi-channel campaigns.Customer-Centric Focus:Deepen understanding of the customer journey across channels, continuously identifying opportunities to elevate customer engagement and experience.Ensure campaigns reflect a comprehensive view of customer needs, preferences, and behaviors.Compliance & Brand Integrity:Adhere to all industry regulations, legal policies, and brand guidelines to protect the company‚Äôs brand integrity and ensure compliance with advertising standards.Proactively monitor brand messaging for consistency and compliance across campaigns.Team Development & Mentorship:Lead, mentor, and develop a team of integrated marketing professionals, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team culture.Support team members‚Äô career growth through goal-setting, feedback, and ongoing training.QualificationsExperience:7+ years of related experience with at least 3 years in a leadership role.Proven track record in eCommerce, driving successful multi-channel marketing campaigns.Education:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field; advanced degree preferred.Skills:Strategic business acumen with the ability to leverage marketing to drive revenue and brand loyalty.Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Excel.Strong analytical, financial, and problem-solving abilities, with experience interpreting marketing performance metrics.Exceptional organizational and multitasking skills, with a keen attention to detail.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to lead cross-functional teams and inspire action.Other Requirements:Adaptability and resilience in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating a proactive and results-oriented approach.Experience hiring and leading diverse teams.Base Pay Range:$139,000 - $170,000 per year DOEPhysical RequirementsMust be able to work on-site as required. This position requires consistent and proactive communication with team members and stakeholders, which may include in-person or remote interactions.Equal Employment OpportunityOur company is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all applicants and associates. This policy includes ensuring that all employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.Who We Are:We‚Äôre a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer:401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women‚Äôs Network, Women In Tech)And More‚Ä¶Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical Requirements:This position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. Show full description ‚ñº
We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should ‚ÄúBe You!‚Äù. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person‚Äôs individuality is at the core of diversity, and those traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more diverse environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.Essential Duties and ResponsibilitiesLeadership & Strategy:Develop and execute an integrated marketing strategy that aligns with the company‚Äôs overall goals and objectives.Provide strategic leadership to the marketing team, cultivating a collaborative and high-performing culture.Work closely with the CMO to manage channel performance and ensure campaigns meet forecasts and KPIs.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Lead the marketing department‚Äôs annual and seasonal planning processes.Collaborate with the merchandising, product development, and pricing teams to design and implement integrated campaigns.Ensure consistent brand messaging and visual identity across all marketing channels and touchpoints.Life Stage Marketing:Develop targeted marketing strategies for key life stages (e.g., baby, wedding, mover, back-to-school), leveraging customer data, trends, and insights.Create personalized experiences and messaging that resonate with customers based on their unique life stage.Collaborate with the product team to enhance offerings and customer journeys based on life stage insights.Monitor campaign performance, using data to optimize strategies and maximize engagement and ROI.Integrated Marketing Management:Oversee the development and execution of cross-channel marketing campaigns, including website, app, digital, social media, email, loyalty, and traditional advertising.Collaborate with the CMO to manage key projects, from strategy and planning to KPI reporting.Lead efforts to expand into new audiences (e.g., trade programs) by facilitating marketing plans and initiatives.Qualifications & TITLE:Director of Creative OperationsREPORTS TO:Chief Creative OfficerABOUT US: Blu Dot (www.bludot.com), an award-winning designer and maker of modern home furnishings, is currently searching for a Director of Creative Operations to join our dynamic and values-driven company.Company PurposeInspire a more creative way of living through good design that's good to everyone.Core ValuesGood design is good. Good design should be reflected in everything we do.Keep it simple.Strive for economy in all that you do.Everyone is invited to our party.Treat every individual with respect & dignity.Our glass is half full.Focus on the positive.Be humble.We take nothing for granted.Turn it up to 11.Determine what is expected and do a little more.Stay curious.Try, learn, improve, repeat.ABOUT THE ROLE: Reporting to the Chief Creative Officer, you will lead the operations of Blu Dot's creative team, inclusive of design, editorial, photography and brand communications. In this role you will ensure that budgets, schedules, tools, processes, and most importantly, people, are strategically aligned and intelligently deployed to enable the development of impactful creative that meets company goals. You will serve as a critical representative of, and advocate for, the creative team with a range of cross-functional partners both inside and outside the organization.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:Develop, implement, and lead clear and effective briefing and workflow processes for the creative team. Ensure that these are adopted, followed, and maintained.Oversee a robust creative calendar that encompasses all brand activity-including print, digital, social, stores, media, and special events. Work with CCO and relevant stakeholders to balance deadlines and capacity planning.Vet and manage technology and tools to enable the above based on industry best-practices and Blu Dot standards.Create agendas for weekly creative team and cross-functional meetings. Drive alignment with necessary parties before, during, and after all meetings.Track the creative team budget under the direction of CCO and in partnership with finance. Provide strategic guidance to optimize available resources, find efficiencies, and drive impact.Manage contracts and invoices for external contributors.Promote a culture of thoughtful collaboration. Engage with key stakeholders across the organization, including CEO, finance, sales, digital, marketing, operations, and product development.Lead and facilitate the creative review process. Ensure that creative delivers on agreed upon goals, brand standards are met, objectives realized, and best practices implemented.Develop relevant and meaningful goals and objectives in relation to the above. Foster a culture of curiosity, exploration, and continuous learning and improvement.Manage creative operations staff.Other projects and duties as assigned.IDEAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS*:10+ years in brand design, marketing project management or creative operationsStrong communication and interpersonal skillsStrong leadership and management skillsAbility to think strategically and see around cornersAbility to balance diverse workloadStrong attention to detail and commitment to qualityPosition is based out of Minneapolis, MN headquarters with a flexible working environment/schedule (no full-time remote work available)Everyone's welcome to our party! TITLE:Senior Sales Manager-Trade + ContractREPORTS TO:Director | Trade + ContractABOUT US: Blu Dot (www.bludot.com), an award-winning designer and maker of modern home furnishings, is currently searching for a Strategic Growth Manager to join our dynamic and values-driven company.Company PurposeInspire a more creative way of living through good design that's good to everyone.Core ValuesGood design is good. Good design should be reflected in everything we do.Keep it simple.Strive for economy in all that you do.Everyone is invited to our party.Treat every individual with respect & dignity.Our glass is half full.Focus on the positive.Be humble.We take nothing for granted.Turn it up to 11.Determine what is expected and do a little more.Stay curious.Try, learn, improve, repeat.ABOUT THE ROLE: The Trade + Contract Strategic Growth Manager will oversee Trade + Contract sales channels, managing national B2B accounts, strategic partnerships, and custom contract sales channels managed from Blu Dot's HQ in Minneapolis. This role is responsible fordriving revenue growth, strengthening client relationships, and developing initiatives to expand Blu Dot presence within the industry. The Trade + Contract Strategic Growth Manager will also lead the in-house Trade + Strategic Contract Partnership teams, ensuring a consistent, sales-driven and relationship-focused approach at every client touchpoint. Collaborating closely with leadership, our in-market Contract sales team, fellow customer facing channel managers, and business operations, the role will align strategies to meet company objectives while delivering exceptional value to clients - ensuring new customer acquisition and YoY revenue growth in channel.Success in this role will hinge on building continued brand awareness, world class service in both Residential Trade and Contract channels, intuitive market strategies, fiscal prudence, and talent development.Trade + Contract Sales:Drive revenue growth and expand market share within assigned accounts and regions for both residential Trade + Contract customer channels.Set sales goals and KPIs for the team, tracking performance to ensure targets are met.Participate in attaining and executing company OKR goals as assigned.Partner with Director to define and execute strategic sales goals by channel to meet and exceed business objectives.Lead a team of account managers and service professionals, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer service standards.Motivate engagement by sharing the Blu Dot brand origin story and imbuing a love of original design to clients & team members.Solicit feedback about Residential Trade and Dealer experience (separately) via annual customer survey deployment.Deploy and manage Contract account (Dealer) prospecting and account tracker. Measure quarterly and report on channel penetration by market - identifying top prospecting opportunities and deploying action plans and accountability expectations with customer facing teams. Identify and deploy initiatives that support opportunities for improving Trade + Contract client customer experience at every touch point.Ensure standard sales discounting is being adhered to and that best practices are in place for special pricing considerations - establish and maintain internal tracking log for all known Dealer/project pricing exceptions.Represent Blu Dot as needed at industry-specific trade shows and via partner specific in-market initiatives.Sales Strategy + Execution:Develop, implement, and monitor performance of data-driven strategies to optimize sales and marketing ROI, focusing on high-growth segments and strategic accounts.Identify new business opportunities and markets, driving acquisition strategies within both the residential trade and contract furniture landscapes.Leverage analytics and market research to develop smarter outreach campaigns targeting high-value accounts.Monitor market trends and competitor activity and programming to adjust sales approaches accordingly.Audit and segment customer groups by class (delineation by system line) to improve communications and marketing efficacy.Assist Director in building and analyzing market budget analysis - holding yourself and the team accountable for reaching budgeted sales goals on both an annual and quarterly basis.Be versed in Contract sales data and reporting- review and analyze data to inform decision making - top Dealers, A + D outreach (led by outside sales teams) and prospecting, Dealer incentives and YoY performance.Client Relationship Management:Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with national B2B clients and strategic partners.Primary strategic account owner for Dealer clients representing Contract system lines (Allsteel, Teknion, MillerKnoll, Haworth and our strategic partner, Steelcase), National Contract accounts, and our online Residential trade program.Serve as the final escalation point for key accounts, resolving issues and driving proactive solutions to maintain top industry reputation and repeat business.Compile and maintain industry-specific event invitation lists, using data-driven reporting to ensure key accounts are prioritized for relevant events.Team Management + Development:Foster a high-performance team culture by driving innovation and championing professional growth.Empower team to deploy customer-centric and creative problem-solving tactics and encourage ownership of accounts, barriers, solutions, and new ideas.Provide timely and constructive feedback to direct reports, be invested in their development and trainingRecognize individual and team achievement - share praise and successes. Conduct annual performance reviews in timely and constructive manner - Director and channel Operations Manager to provide partnership/input in crafting. Act as a sounding board and trusted thought partner to Director for all channel specific expansion and program efforts. Recruit, train, and onboard new sales team members as dictated by business need. Lead by example - uphold and demonstrate our company core values.Marketing + Brand Awareness:Maintain awareness of Residential Trade + Contract industry and competitive landscape - possess a technical and professional knowledge base and competitive analysis platform.Assist in the execution and evolution of ongoing company strategic initiatives such as Contract Email Campaign.Audit digital and printed materials available for specific Trade + Contract client outreach - work with Trade + Contract project manager on new asset briefs with marketing as needed.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Work closely with marketing, business operations, and product teams to successfully deploy strategic initiatives that align with the company's growth objectives.Provide input into product development and service enhancements based on client feedback.Solicit and communicate quality issues and assortment feedback, as they specifically relate to Trade + Contract clientele needs.Consult with outside Contract sales teams to build monthly Trade + Contract newsletter content, highlighting customer-class specific products, resources, initiatives and brand updates.Partner with accounting & business operations to evaluate customer payment status and credit limits, balancing risk with business growth opportunities.Reporting + Analysis:Develop and maintain customer segmentation frameworks to enhance marketing strategies and improve client engagement.Enable specific sales insights by implementation of robust channel reporting, leveraging Blu Dot's analytics platform, Tableau.Monitor sales performance, analyzing data to make informed decisions.Identify underperforming customer segments and lapsed accounts and implement targeted outreach campaigns.Evaluate sales performance trends, identifying opportunities for improvement.Work with Product and BI Teams to analyze channel specific assortment data and analyses.Prepare and present sales, open projects and prospect reports to direct leader weekly.Ideal Experience + Qualifications*:8+ years of experience in key account or national account management within the contract furniture, design, or architecture industries.8+ years of experience managing people or teams.Extensive experience developing, executing, and measuring successful sales strategies for B2B clients.Demonstrated ability to manage large-scale projects while maintaining focus on high-priority goals, such as customer classification improvements and revenue growth.Emotionally intelligent with strong interpersonal skills and a natural aptitude for building relationships and trust.Proficiency in CRM platforms, Microsoft Office Suite, and data analysis & visualization tools such as Tableau.Exceptional presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal.Strategic thinker with the ability to translate market insights into actionable plans.Additional Requirements:Position is based out of Minneapolis, MN headquarters with a flexible working environment/schedule (no full-time remote work available).Flexibility to work in-person and in the evenings (for industry events) as required.Occasional travel required.Everyone's welcome to our party! Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.For California job applicants, our privacy notice can be found here.

Whether you're looking for full-time or part-time opportunities, you'll find a supportive, fun, and team-oriented environment at Bob‚Äôs. As a Sales Associate - Guest Experience Sales Specialist, you‚Äôll help customers bring their home design dreams to life while delivering world-class service in a low-pressure, gimmick-free atmosphere‚Äîjust the way Bob‚Äôs intended! **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. Success in this role is driven by a combination of customer service ability, interpersonal skills, and a passion for helping others. If you enjoy working with people, are energized by a sales environment, and love home d√©cor, this role is for you! **Key Skills For Success**To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate strengths in the following skill areas: **Core Competencies & Expertise** * Customer Engagement and Active Listening * Relationship Building and Client Follow-Up * Consultative Selling and Product Knowledge Application * Team Collaboration and Communication * Adaptability to Retail Schedules and High-Energy Environments * Comfort with Digital Tools and Point-of-Sale Systems * Organizational Skills and Time Management * Problem Solving and Goal Orientation **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * Previous retail or commission-based sales experience * Bilingual communication skills * Passion for home design and interior d√©cor * Experience with customer relationship management tools or systems **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and we‚Äôre growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace that values skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. **How We Will Support Your Success**We know you have many choices when it comes to your career. At Bob‚Äôs, we invest in your growth, well-being, and career advancement. **Benefits & Perks** * Hourly Advance / Draw vs. Commission pay structure * Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage * Employer-paid and voluntary Life Insurance options * 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with generous match * Paid time off including vacation, sick days, holidays, and your birthday! * Employee Assistance Program and Emergency Support Programs (Bail Out & Helping Hand) * Exclusive Employee Discounts * Flexible retail schedules including evenings, weekends, and holidays * Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities **Our Culture & Core Values**At Bob‚Äôs, we believe in fostering a positive, inclusive, and skill-driven work environment. Our core values‚ÄîHonesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability, and Fun‚Äîguide everything we do. We‚Äôre not just a workplace; we‚Äôre a team that supports and celebrates each other! **Minimum Qualifications** * Energetic and self-motivated with strong interpersonal skills * Basic computer proficiency * Must be at least 18 years old to be considered for employment with Bob‚Äôs * Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including weekends and holidays **Physical Demands** * Ability to stand for long periods and move throughout the showroom * Must be able to lift and move up to 50 lbs as needed **Diversity is a Core Value at Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. Digital Content Manager - Temporary Role (Manchester, CT)
linkedin United States Fri, 24 Oc N/A
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensu...
Show full description ‚ñº
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer. **Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise** * Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training. * Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency. * Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content. * Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting. * Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards. * Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility. * Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance). **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders. * Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply. * Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems. * Retail or e-commerce creative team experience. **Minimum Qualifications** * 3‚Äì5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination. * Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting. * Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and we‚Äôre growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace that values **skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.****Growth Opportunity**This is a high-impact role at the intersection of marketing, operations, and technology. You will: * Lead simplification and automation efforts to reduce friction in creative workflows. * Shape how digital content systems scale as our product and creative output grows. * Collaborate with passionate creatives in a team-oriented, no-ego culture that values clarity, collaboration, and momentum. **Diversity is a Core Value at Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquisitionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. **Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**$45.00+ *It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com. **Job Title**Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager **Job Overview**As a **Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager** at Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, you‚Äôll lead and inspire a team dedicated to optimizing sales, operations, and customer experience within our outlet locations. You‚Äôll play a critical role in ensuring merchandise is received, staged, and sold efficiently, while maintaining a safe, organized, and customer-friendly showroom and warehouse. This hands-on leadership role blends sales strategy with back-end operational excellence to drive success across multiple departments. This is a full-time, in-store leadership position requiring flexible availability including evenings, weekends, and holidays. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. Success in this role is driven by a blend of operational expertise, sales acumen, team development, and strategic thinking. If you thrive on leading teams, solving problems, and delivering results while creating a fun and organized retail environment, this is the opportunity for you. **Key Skills For Success**To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate strengths in the following skill areas: **Core Competencies & Expertise** * Retail sales and back-end operations leadership * Team management, coaching, and scheduling * Inventory control and cycle counting * Logistics coordination and merchandise flow * Safety compliance and warehouse standards * Showroom merchandising and outlet presentation * Customer experience and satisfaction * Performance feedback and employee development * Critical thinking and process improvement **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * 2‚Äì5 years of retail and/or warehouse leadership experience * Experience in sales-driven environments * Proven success in team development and accountability * Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience * Familiarity with receiving, returns, and outbound logistics processes **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and we‚Äôre growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace that values skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. **How We Will Support Your Success**We know you have many choices when it comes to your career. At Bob‚Äôs, we invest in your growth, well-being, and career advancement. **Benefits & Perks** * National Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance * Paid Time Off: Vacation, Sick Days, Holidays, and Your Birthday * 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a generous company match * Employer-paid Life Insurance with voluntary options * Pet Insurance and Employee Assistance Program * Bob‚Äôs Helping Hand & Bail Out financial support programs * Tuition Reimbursement and Employee Scholarship Programs * On-the-job training and career path development * Employee Discount from Day 1 and additional partner discounts **Our Culture & Core Values**At Bob‚Äôs, we believe in fostering a positive, inclusive, and skill-driven work environment. Our core values‚Äî**Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability, and Fun**‚Äîguide everything we do. We‚Äôre not just a workplace; we‚Äôre a team that supports and celebrates each other! **Minimum Qualifications** * Demonstrated leadership and decision-making abilities * Strong communication and organization skills * Experience in inventory, receiving, and merchandising * Must be at least 18 years old to be considered for employment **Physical Demands** * Ability to stand, walk, bend, and lift throughout the workday * Capable of lifting or moving items up to 50 lbs. without assistance * Frequent use of warehouse tools, ladders, and equipment **Reporting Relationships** * Reports to: Retail Store Manager * Direct Reports: Retail Product Support Leads, Retail Outlet Experience Leads, Retail Product Associates, Retail Outlet Experience Specialists (may vary by location) **Equal Opportunity**Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members, applicants, and customers. **Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**Pay: $60,000-$62,000 annually plus bonus *It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment.
