Digital Content Manager - Temporary Role (Manchester, CT)
linkedin Fairfield (United States) Thu, 02 Oc N/A
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensu...
Show full description ‚ñº
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer. **Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise** * Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training. * Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency. * Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content. * Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting. * Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards. * Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility. * Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance). **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders. * Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply. * Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems. * Retail or e-commerce creative team experience. **Minimum Qualifications** * 3‚Äì5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination. * Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting. * Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and we‚Äôre growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace that values **skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.****Growth Opportunity**This is a high-impact role at the intersection of marketing, operations, and technology. You will: * Lead simplification and automation efforts to reduce friction in creative workflows. * Shape how digital content systems scale as our product and creative output grows. * Collaborate with passionate creatives in a team-oriented, no-ego culture that values clarity, collaboration, and momentum. **Diversity is a Core Value at Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law. Show full description ‚ñº
**Job Summary**The primary function of a Bobs Squad Support Associate is to represent Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture and its products with honesty and integrity while providing exceptional support to guests through all stages of their journey. The goal of the Sales Support Associate is to support the omnichannel experience and to identify root causes of issues to assist stores efficiently in a timely manner. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and it shows in our expansive growth! Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture is more than just a furniture store. We are one of the fastest growing omni-channel furniture retailers in the country. **How We Will Support You**At Bob‚Äôs we understand there are many companies you can choose to work for, so, along with exceptional opportunities for career growth we offer a fun team-oriented work environment and great benefits! Let us tell you more. **Benefits & Perks-** We‚Äôve got you covered! We believe in supporting our employees and their families in the best ways possible is a top priority. We focus on three core wellness pillars: Emotional, Physical and Financial. Below are just some of the benefits that we offer: * Feeling under the weather, we‚Äôve got you covered! We offer Nationally provided Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance * Paid Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days, Holidays, work anniversary and your Birthday! After all, your birthday should be a holiday * 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a Generous Company match! * Pet Insurance to help keep your furry friends happy and healthy * Life insurance ‚Äì Employer-paid basic Life Insurance, with the option to add Voluntary Life Insurance as well! * Financial Planning, Voluntary Legal Benefits and Wellness Plans * We already offer value priced furniture, but on top of that we offer a Generous Employee Discount starting on your 1st day! * Additional Employee Discounts through the ‚ÄúHays Perks discount program‚Äù offering hundreds of online discounts from your favorite merchants. * And so much more! **Culture and Core Values-** At Bob's we have a set of core values that shape the decisions we make every day and help define our company culture. These values comprise what we call "The Bob's Way." **Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability and Fun.****DIVERSITY IS A CORE VALUE AT BOB‚ÄôS**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. **Learn and Grow-** We believe in developing our team members and helping them grow both personally and professionally! We promote Professional Development: In-person, virtually and offer an infinite library of on-demand classes in Workday Learning. We also offer Tuition Reimbursement as well as the BDF Education Foundation Scholarship Program open to employees and their dependents. Want to grow at Bob‚Äôs professionally? We look to promote from within our organization by having robust succession planning in place to ensure that our team members have the opportunity to advance their careers. **Responsibilities** * Be consistently positive, enthusiastic, and respectful in all interactions with guests and co-workers. * Accurately and honestly represent all company policies, products, and services, to help the store reach quantitative goals the ‚ÄúBOB‚ÄôS WAY,‚Äù bringing his positive image and energy into all service situations. * Update guest orders into the system accurately and completely across all store locations using BobsBoost. * Accurately process payments; be responsible for security of cash and other legal tenders in the store and on the phone. * Ensure the company‚Äôs assets are properly cared for and in good working condition. * Answer national incoming calls and respond to guest queries in a timely and courteous manner. * Stay well informed about Bob‚Äôs products, pricing and policies. * Assist guests in using the most appropriate Bob‚Äôs systems. * Maintain guest communication on all national open orders and communicate status with guests. * Provide communication and guidance along the guest journey from pre-purchase to the day of delivery. * Follow up and complete all training and tasks, including but not limited to, e-learnings and daily tasks assigned by the company and managers. * Execute all behavioral and operational standards per company policies, procedures, and processes. * Arrive to work on time dressed according to the Dress Code Policy on scheduled days, which includes being able to work weekends and major holidays per the company‚Äôs scheduling guidelines and Dress Code Policy. * Support all company initiatives as directed by Bobs Squad Management or company. * Attend and constructively participate in all scheduled meetings, workshops and training sessions. * Ad hoc assignments that support the instore sales function, that include the CPU instore process * The list of responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive as there may be other duties assigned. **Required Qualifications** * Flexibility to work a retail schedule that includes nights, weekends, and holidays. * Ability to effectively use technology and learn new technologies. * Effective cash handling skills. * Effective verbal and listening skills. * Interpersonal and human relations skills. * Global call center experience. * Proven analytical and problem-solving skills. * Ability to use sound judgment and decision making. **Preferred Qualifications** * Retail background * Sales experience * Customer Service experience **Physical Requirements** * Ability to stand and walk. * Ability to complete seated work at a desk * Ability to answer the phone and utilize a computer. **Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**Pay:$16.63 - per hour plus commission *It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to Digital Content Manager - Temporary Role (Manchester, CT)
linkedin United States Fri, 24 Oc N/A
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensu...
Show full description ‚ñº
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer. **Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise** * Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training. * Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency. * Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content. * Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting. * Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards. * Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility. * Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance). **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders. * Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply. * Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems. * Retail or e-commerce creative team experience. **Minimum Qualifications** * 3‚Äì5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination. * Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting. * Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and we‚Äôre growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace that values **skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.****Growth Opportunity**This is a high-impact role at the intersection of marketing, operations, and technology. You will: * Lead simplification and automation efforts to reduce friction in creative workflows. * Shape how digital content systems scale as our product and creative output grows. * Collaborate with passionate creatives in a team-oriented, no-ego culture that values clarity, collaboration, and momentum. **Diversity is a Core Value at Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law. **Job Title**Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager **Job Overview**As a **Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager** at Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, you‚Äôll lead and inspire a team dedicated to optimizing sales, operations, and customer experience within our outlet locations. This hands-on leadership role blends sales strategy with back-end operational excellence to drive success across multiple departments. This is a full-time, in-store leadership position requiring flexible availability including evenings, weekends, and holidays. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer. **Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise** * Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training. * Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency. * Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content. * Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting. * Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards. * Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility. * Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance). **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders. * Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply. * Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems. * Retail or e-commerce creative team experience. **Minimum Qualifications** * 3‚Äì5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination. * Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting. * Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and we‚Äôre growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace that values **skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.****Growth Opportunity**This is a high-impact role at the intersection of marketing, operations, and technology. You will: * Lead simplification and automation efforts to reduce friction in creative workflows. * Shape how digital content systems scale as our product and creative output grows. * Collaborate with passionate creatives in a team-oriented, no-ego culture that values clarity, collaboration, and momentum. **Diversity is a Core Value at Bob‚Äôs**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. Show full description ‚ñº
At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem. **What You‚Äôll Bring To Bob‚Äôs**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer. **Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise** * Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training. * Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency. * Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content. * Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting. * Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards. * Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility. * Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance). **Preferred Competencies & Skills** * Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders. * Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply. * Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems. * Retail or e-commerce creative team experience. **Minimum Qualifications** * 3‚Äì5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination. * Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting. * Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, **Job Summary**The primary function of a Bobs Squad Support Associate is to represent Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture and its products with honesty and integrity while providing exceptional support to guests through all stages of their journey. The goal of the Sales Support Associate is to support the omnichannel experience and to identify root causes of issues to assist stores efficiently in a timely manner. **Who We Are**At Bob‚Äôs, we have fun, we love what we do, and it shows in our expansive growth! Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture is more than just a furniture store. We are one of the fastest growing omni-channel furniture retailers in the country. **How We Will Support You**At Bob‚Äôs we understand there are many companies you can choose to work for, so, along with exceptional opportunities for career growth we offer a fun team-oriented work environment and great benefits! Let us tell you more. **Benefits & Perks-** We‚Äôve got you covered! We believe in supporting our employees and their families in the best ways possible is a top priority. We focus on three core wellness pillars: Emotional, Physical and Financial. Below are just some of the benefits that we offer: * Feeling under the weather, we‚Äôve got you covered! We offer Nationally provided Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance * Paid Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days, Holidays, work anniversary and your Birthday! After all, your birthday should be a holiday * 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a Generous Company match! * Pet Insurance to help keep your furry friends happy and healthy * Life insurance ‚Äì Employer-paid basic Life Insurance, with the option to add Voluntary Life Insurance as well! * Financial Planning, Voluntary Legal Benefits and Wellness Plans * We already offer value priced furniture, but on top of that we offer a Generous Employee Discount starting on your 1st day! * Additional Employee Discounts through the ‚ÄúHays Perks discount program‚Äù offering hundreds of online discounts from your favorite merchants. * And so much more! **Culture and Core Values-** At Bob's we have a set of core values that shape the decisions we make every day and help define our company culture. These values comprise what we call "The Bob's Way." **Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability and Fun.****DIVERSITY IS A CORE VALUE AT BOB‚ÄôS**At Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you‚Äôre shopping with us or a part of the Bob‚Äôs team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. **Learn and Grow-** We believe in developing our team members and helping them grow both personally and professionally! We promote Professional Development: In-person, virtually and offer an infinite library of on-demand classes in Workday Learning. We also offer Tuition Reimbursement as well as the BDF Education Foundation Scholarship Program open to employees and their dependents. Want to grow at Bob‚Äôs professionally? We look to promote from within our organization by having robust succession planning in place to ensure that our team members have the opportunity to advance their careers. **Responsibilities** * Be consistently positive, enthusiastic, and respectful in all interactions with guests and co-workers. * Accurately and honestly represent all company policies, products, and services, to help the store reach quantitative goals the ‚ÄúBOB‚ÄôS WAY,‚Äù bringing his positive image and energy into all service situations. * Update guest orders into the system accurately and completely across all store locations using BobsBoost. * Accurately process payments; be responsible for security of cash and other legal tenders in the store and on the phone. * Ensure the company‚Äôs assets are properly cared for and in good working condition. * Answer national incoming calls and respond to guest queries in a timely and courteous manner. * Stay well informed about Bob‚Äôs products, pricing and policies. * Assist guests in using the most appropriate Bob‚Äôs systems. * Maintain guest communication on all national open orders and communicate status with guests. * Provide communication and guidance along the guest journey from pre-purchase to the day of delivery. * Follow up and complete all training and tasks, including but not limited to, e-learnings and daily tasks assigned by the company and managers. * Execute all behavioral and operational standards per company policies, procedures, and processes. * Arrive to work on time dressed according to the Dress Code Policy on scheduled days, which includes being able to work weekends and major holidays per the company‚Äôs scheduling guidelines and Dress Code Policy. * Support all company initiatives as directed by Bobs Squad Management or company. * Attend and constructively participate in all scheduled meetings, workshops and training sessions. * Ad hoc assignments that support the instore sales function, that include the CPU instore process * The list of responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive as there may be other duties assigned. **Required Qualifications** * Flexibility to work a retail schedule that includes nights, weekends, and holidays. * Ability to effectively use technology and learn new technologies. * Effective cash handling skills. * Effective verbal and listening skills. * Interpersonal and human relations skills. * Global call center experience. * Proven analytical and problem-solving skills. * Ability to use sound judgment and decision making. **Preferred Qualifications** * Retail background * Sales experience * Customer Service experience **Physical Requirements** * Ability to stand and walk. * Ability to complete seated work at a desk * Ability to answer the phone and utilize a computer. **Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**Pay:$16.63 - per hour plus commission *It is policy of Bob‚Äôs Discount Furniture, Inc., to We offer comprehensive training and ongoing development to help you thrive in a role that blends creativity, relationship-building, and strong earning potential. This is an exciting opportunity to grow your career while contributing to a team that transforms homes with care and expertise. **Job Description** * Represent the brand professionally with a confident, warm, and solutions-driven approach * Conduct in-home or virtual consultations to complete detailed needs analyses * Design custom organizational solutions using CAD software (laptop/iPad provided) * Deliver a consultative sales experience that focuses on win-win outcomes * Attend monthly sales and skills-development meetings * Maintain consistent follow-up with clients and collaborate with the installation team to ensure seamless project completion * Cultivate referrals and repeat business through excellent client relationships **Qualifications** The ideal candidate will bring: * Experience or education in interior design or a strong ability to translate client needs into design driven sales solutions * Proven success in sales or customer facing roles where relationship building and trust directly drive repeat and referral business * Demonstrated ability to consistently achieve or surpass sales targets, with a strong focus on closing and revenue growth * Confidence in promoting and selling premium products * Proficiency with basic computer programs; CAD experience is an asset * Creativity paired with meticulous attention to detail and a focus on quality * Ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment * A collaborative, team-oriented mindset * Class 5 Driver‚Äôs License and access to a personal vehicle **Additional Information** **Compensation & Benefits** * Full-time, Monday-Friday with some evenings and occasional weekends * Ability to work in Edmonton showroom * 12 weeks of paid, on- the- job training * Benefits after 3 months: Dental, extended health care and health spending account * Commission and bonus-based pay structure **What we provide:** At California Closets, we invest in your success: * **Flexible Schedule**: Split schedule including some evenings, weekend and showroom shifts * **Training and Development:** Extensive onboarding, 10 weeks of classroom training and on-going coaching * **Competitive Pay**: Commission- based structure, bonuses and allowances for fuel and cell phone * **Employee Perks:** Employee discount program **Why Join Us?** Be part of a team that values inclusivity, collaboration, and innovation. At California Closets, we‚Äôre passionate about creating beautiful, functional spaces ‚Äì and equally passionate about the people who make that possible. Your work will make a meaningful difference in the lives of our clients, one space at a time. Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**The Sales Supervisor role focuses on ensuring that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the designers are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Sales Supervisor also collaborates with the Sales Manager to ensure that the process flow is being followed and delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints. **What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is a franchise, therefore earns the following benefits: * A fun, creative, and inclusive work environment * Compensation is Salary plus a commission based on sales. Approximately $75k annually. * Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, and Dental * Paid Vacation and Sick time * Simple IRA retirement plan with company match * Company phone number Company-owned locations may offer different benefits. **Essential Functions** * Coach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R‚Äôs. * Ensure direct reports are delivering on an exception customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policy * Performance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager. * Collaborate with Sales Manager to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development. * Working in collaboration with the Sales Manager to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads. * Work with Design Consultants to create a plan for driving self-generated leads. * Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team members * Co-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with the Sales Manager on creation and tracking. * Working in collaboration with Sales Manager to co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers. * Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity. * Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID). **Qualifications** * High school diploma and/or GED, some college education preferred * Interior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home d√©cor. * 5+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments * 3+ years of management/leadership experience * Proven track record of leading a team to exceed sales quotas and sales metrics **Additional Information***We are an equal opportunity employer.*All your information will be kept confidential. **Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**We‚Äôre seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of leveraging Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deploy technically-advanced email campaigns that enhance customer engagement and drive business results. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has a strong technical background and project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming email marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights. You‚Äôll work cross-functionally with marketing, analytics, and CRM teams to create advanced customer journeys, automated workflows, dynamic content, and system integrations. The ideal candidate is an expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud tools, scripting languages, and marketing automation best practices. We foster a values-based, collaborative environment and are seeking candidates who know how to drive growth while building deep partnerships. As a key driver of California Closets‚Äô growth, this role works in partnership with cross-functional teams, and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives. The Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist will report to the Senior Director, Relationship Marketing (CRM). Pay - $95K + **TECHNICAL EXECUTION** * Advanced experience building, managing, and optimizing email campaigns specifically within Salesforce Marketing Cloud * Hands-on experience leveraging Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Audience Builder, and Content Builder to deploy personalized, dynamic campaign flows and automations and create advanced multi-step customer journeys * Create and troubleshoot automated workflows and data processes to support real-time, triggered messaging * Proficient with building Data Extensions, conducting data imports and exports, and utilizing AMPscript to populate personalized attributes into emails * Support integration with Marketing Cloud Connect and integrating SFMC with Salesforce CRM for triggered sends and real-time personalization * Expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud data architecture, including Contact Builder, Data Extensions, and Data Views * Working knowledge of html, CSS, AMPscript, and responsive design **EMAIL TRAFFIC AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT** * Submit creative briefs and partner with cross-functional teams to take emails from concept to delivery * Help develop and maintain the monthly/quarterly email content calendar in collaboration with creative and marketing teams * Proficiency in Figma for email design collaboration, proofing, and QA * Thoroughly QA all email assets (email lists, subject lines, content blocks, links, dynamic fields, and imaging) across multiple devices and email clients before launch to ensure successful execution **REPORTING** * Strong analytical capabilities with expertise in email data analysis and performance reporting * Experience analyzing performance metrics and creating detailed campaign reports to translate insights into actionable improvements * Proficient with using Salesforce Marketing Cloud Intelligence Reports to create dashboards and visualizations * Expertise using Google Analytics (G4) or similar web analytics platform to leverage data and metrics to drive campaign improvements **Qualifications** * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, Analytics, or related field * Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Email Specialist * Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Administrator * 5-7 years of professional hands-on email marketing experience, ideally at an agency or within a premium lifestyle brand * Strong experience with Excel for data manipulation, charts and pivot tables **Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**The Assistant Sales Manager role focuses on ensuring that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the designers are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Assistant Sales Manager also collaborates with the Operations team to ensure that the process flow is being followed and results in delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints. **Essential Functions** * Coach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R‚Äôs. * Ensure direct reports are delivering on an exception customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policy * Performance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager. * Collaborate with Sales Manager and other Assistant Sales Managers Sales Leads to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development including classroom and CC 360 (Not academy) courses & other required training sessions from time to time. * Working in collaboration with the General Manager and Central Support team to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads. * Work with Design Consultants to create a Personal Marketing Plan and/or a plan for self-generated leads. * Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team members * Co-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with Sales Manager on creation and tracking. * Working in collaboration with the rest of the Sales Leadership team, co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers and head office personnel. * Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity. * Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID). * Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs attendance at the monthly sales meetings. * Ensure correct usage of CRM (dashboard & SalesForce) including quality of data entry, statuses etc. **New Designer Training** * Potential involvement in initial and follow up interviews * Potentially coordinate your assigned Designers‚Äô access to websites (CC email, Paylocity, CC 360, SalesForce, Dashboard, Slack, Digideck, DocuSign, Zoom, Sharepoint), materials (Computer, iPad, CAD key, Business Cards, branded materials and supplies) and samples (Designer Bags, Finish boxes). * Ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new training and development including classroom and CC 360 courses. **Qualifications** * High school diploma and/or GED, some college education preferred * Interior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home d√©cor. * 5+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments * 3+ years of management/leadership experience * Proven track record of leading a team to exceed sales quotas and sales metrics **Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. #FL107
Marketing and Growth Manager

Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚Äô **Job Description**Position Overview We are seeking a Marketing & Growth Manager to drive the execution of marketing initiatives, lead generation programs, and trade partnerships that accelerate company growth. This role blends hands-on execution with strategic input, supporting the Director of Marketing in bringing the company‚Äôs growth strategy to life. The ideal candidate thrives at the intersection of marketing, partnerships, and sales enablement‚Äîturning strategic goals into measurable results through campaigns, events, and partnerships. The Marketing & Growth Manager will be responsible for executing marketing initiatives, analyzing performance metrics, and bringing forward innovative ideas that enhance brand visibility and pipeline growth. Key Responsibilities Marketing Strategy & Execution * Execute the company‚Äôs marketing strategy under the guidance of the Director of Marketing. * Translate high-level marketing plans into actionable campaigns across digital, event, and trade channels. * Provide input on creative and strategic direction to enhance performance and brand consistency. * Track and report on key marketing metrics, including lead sources, campaign ROI, and conversion trends. Lead Generation * Develop and execute lead generation programs that drive high-quality inbound and partner-sourced leads. * Optimize marketing funnels in collaboration with sales to improve lead-to-close ratios. * Report on Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs), Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs), and conversion metrics. Trade Partnerships & Business Development * Identify, secure, and grow relationships with designers, contractors, builders, and real estate professionals. * Create and execute trade and referral programs that expand the pipeline and increase referral-driven revenue. * Collaborate with the Director of Marketing to co-develop partner campaigns that align with brand strategy. * Manage partnership engagement, performance reporting, and ROI analysis. Event Marketing & Brand Activation * Plan and execute high-impact showroom and trade events that generate leads and strengthen community presence. * Oversee logistics, promotions, vendor coordination, and post-event follow-up. * Analyze event performance and report on ROI and lead conversion. Territory Marketing & Local Growth * Support regional growth plans by tailoring marketing campaigns to local markets. * Work with the sales team to identify high-opportunity markets and drive localized awareness and leads. * Track territory-level performance and provide insights to leadership on growth opportunities. **Qualifications**3‚Äì5 years of experience in marketing, partnerships, or business development. * Proven track record in executing marketing campaigns, event management, and relationship development. * Proven ability to develop and manage trade relationships * Strong ability to translate strategy into execution while contributing new ideas and innovation. * Excellent project management, analytical, and communication skills. * Experience using CRM systems and marketing performance tools. * Entrepreneurial mindset with accountability for measurable outcomes. **Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Potential for direct responsibility for locations. * Responsible for the implementation of digital and other marketing campaigns, analyze and report on results and make recommendations to improve the performance of the campaigns. * Analyzing social media channels, local web pages, other digital platforms and developing insights to share with operators to improve performance of the platforms. **Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**We are seeking a strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max, and YouTube campaigns. This role will be responsible for using data-driven insights to develop and own paid search strategies, manage media budgets, drive campaign execution, and work cross-functionally to achieve growth and ROI objectives. You understand the full search landscape to identify opportunities where paid and organic search can work together to maximize performance. We are seeking a creatively strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max and YouTube campaigns. This role will be responsible for using data-driven insights to develop and own paid search strategies, manage media budgets, drive campaign execution, and work cross-functionally to achieve growth and ROI objectives. While this role is focused on paid search, we‚Äôre seeking a candidate that is aware of the greater paid digital ecosystem including broadcast, streaming and OTT advertising, paid social, affiliate marketing and their potential impacts on paid search performance. The ideal candidate has a passion for problem-solving, a data-first mindset, and excellent communication skills. You will be part of the Growth Marketing team‚Äîa collaborative group of marketers working to expand brand awareness and generate demand for California Closets through conversations with the customer. Optimizing their brand experience from awareness through first contact with us. Base salary for this range is $130k - $150k + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. This is a remote position, however there is occasionally travel required about 3-5x per year. **Responsibilities** * Ownership role in the planning, management, and execution of all California Closets Paid Search campaigns, including but not limited to account setup, development and implementation of strategies, campaign structure, budget management, bidding strategies and invoice and billing management * Experience managing budgets more than $10M, with an aptitude for managing market-specific billing details and reporting these charges to internal finance teams * Actively direct and manage a digital agency to define, execute and measure marketing campaigns to maximize efficient customer growth for existing and new paid media channels, including paid search (SEM), YouTube video and display, programmatic, and retargeting * Actively direct and manage digital agency efforts to conduct keyword research, competitive analysis, and audience targeting to identify growth opportunities and mitigate risks * Have a true love of data and problem solving. Know what data to pull to obtain needed insights and be skilled at interpreting the data and knowing where and how to dig deeper to uncover anomalies, unexpected outcomes and key performance insights * Review paid search and YouTube campaign performance by market/DMA and work directly with local business owners & managing operators to adjust strategies to align with their business specific objectives * Meet and exceed monthly volume and ROAS targets by driving continuous improvement and experimentation of new optimization concepts and tactics * Meet regularly with agency and platform account teams to assess account performance, and to ensure optimal solution adoption while continually evolving strategies in tandem with the rapidly shifting paid search landscape * Partner with digital agency to monitor new opportunities within the Google and Microsoft Ads platforms to test and optimize accounts * As the driving force behind our YouTube efforts, you‚Äôll create a data-driven YouTube advertising strategy that compliments California Closets overall business goals * Conduct in-depth post-campaign analysis, test plans for new user acquisition initiatives, and measure performance to identify testing opportunities across paid search and YouTube * Collaborate across levels and functions within the Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions and Brand teams to support company growth initiatives * Develop creative and innovative solutions for how to leverage paid search and YouTube for customer acquisition with a willingness to test new strategies and tactics * Derive critical insights from data (front-end performance metrics from search engine platforms and back-end California Closets actions) and synthesize recommendations to deliver improvements to campaign performance * Proven ability to seek cross channel insights by conducting attribution analysis to understand how the market specific media mix impacts paid search performance, regarding new/returning visitor volume and quality * Proactively seek ongoing education with the very latest industry trends and advancements in paid search, AI and all other aspects of modern digital marketing * Ensure that your efforts and those of 3rd party partners adhere to the latest corporate privacy and data governance policies **Qualifications** * 7+ years of Paid Search experience managing and optimizing campaigns in Google Paid Search and Microsoft Ads. * Hands-on experience managing and optimizing YouTube video campaigns. * Google and Microsoft Ads certifications. * Advanced proficiency in Google Analytics (GA4). * Strong skills in Excel (macros, charts, pivot tables) and Tableau or similar BI platforms for data manipulation and visualization. * Proven experience with A/B testing and iterative campaign optimization. * Detail-oriented with a passion for creating processes to manage multiple campaigns and track location/franchise-specific strategies. * Ability to use data and metrics to solve problems, support assumptions, and identify opportunities. * Track record of exceeding performance goals through analysis, problem-solving, and strategic execution. **Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe ho...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚Äô **Job Description**The Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. **What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits: * A fun, creative, and inclusive work environment * A generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn uncapped commissions + bonuses * Health, Dental and RRSP program * 401(k) retirement plan with company match * Cell phone and mileage reimbursement * Company leads to help bridge the gap after completion of training * Ongoing training on products, CRM, and proprietary CAD software * An excellent environment in a refreshingly open culture alongside individuals who love to exceed expectations Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits. The address listed for this position is part of the region the Sales and Design Consultant would oversee and does not reflect a specific location the Designer reports to. **We are seeking designers in the GTA East End (Whitby & Scarborough area).****Duties And Responsibilities** * Design personalized storage solutions for customers utilizing our proprietary CAD software program. * Utilize a consultative sales approach to meet monthly sales goals. * Commute to customers‚Äô homes for a needs analysis and to design a storage unit. * Participate in meetings and training sessions. * Continuous follow-up with the customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion. * Pursue referrals and repeat business. Meet goals for self-generating leads. * Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales related goals and targets. * This is a full-time (40 hours/week) opportunity * Collaborate with team to deliver an exceptional brand experience **Qualifications** * Interior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred. * Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required. * Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferred * The ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship. * Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required. **Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. #ON112

**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. This role ensures that the designers are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Assistant Sales Manager also collaborates with the Operations team to ensure that the process flow is being followed and results in delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints. **Benefits** * Competitive starting salary of $90k + 25% potential bonus * Benefits (Health & Dental) + RRSP Program * Generous employee discount **Essential Functions** * Coach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R‚Äôs. * Ensure direct reports are delivering exceptional customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policy. * Performance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager. * Collaborate with Sales Manager and other Assistant Sales Managers Sales Leads to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development including classroom and CC 360 (Not academy) courses & other required training sessions from time to time. * Working in collaboration with the Sales Manager and Central Support team to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads. * Work with Design Consultants to create a Personal Marketing Plan and/or a plan for self-generated leads. * Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team members * Co-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with Sales Manager on creation and tracking. * Working in collaboration with the rest of the Sales Leadership team, co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers and head office personnel. * Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity. * Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID). * Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs attendance at the monthly sales meetings. * Ensure correct usage of CRM (dashboard & SalesForce) including quality of data entry, statuses etc. **New Designer Training** * Potential involvement in initial and follow up interviews. * Potentially coordinate your assigned Designers‚Äô access to websites (CC email, Paylocity, CC 360, SalesForce, Dashboard, Slack, Digideck, DocuSign, Zoom, Sharepoint), materials (Computer, iPad, CAD key, Business Cards, branded materials and supplies) and samples (Designer Bags, Finish boxes). * Ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new training and development including classroom and CC 360 courses. **Qualifications** * College or University degree preferred * Interior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home d√©cor. * 5+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments * 3+ years of management/leadership experience * Proven ability to drive revenue through a heavy sales focus, effective lead generation strategies, and oversight of showroom and tradeshow events. * Proven track record of leading a team to exceed sales quotas and sales metrics * Valid driver's license and use of a reliable vehicle **Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer.
