Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**We‚Äôre looking for a motivated go-getter who wants to make a real difference in sales and marketing. In this role, you‚Äôll team up with our Sales Manager and General Manager to drive leads, grow opportunities, and keep things moving in the Atlanta market. You‚Äôll be hands-on with marketing campaigns, events, and the behind-the-scenes coordination that makes our sales team shine. You‚Äôll also get the chance to work on a variety of projects that will help you build new skills and sharpen your toolkit. Every day will look a little different, so if you‚Äôre eager to learn, ready to jump in, and excited to grow your career, we want to hear from you! **What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits: * Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision * PTO days and paid holidays * 401K retirement plan with company match * 40 hours/week with overtime potential * Grow your career with us ‚Äì many promotional opportunities are available Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits. **Essential Functions** * When in a showroom, serves as first contact to greet all clients who visit our showroom, including assisting the clients with signing our guestbook and offering refreshments as necessary. * Responsible for lead management in an efficient and detailed manner for our Design Consultants, using CRM. * Responsible for answering incoming phone calls & emails to either the local scheduling office or local showrooms and address client needs. * Updating the local marketing including showroom hours on the website, social media, Yelp and Google reviews. * Updating and maintaining Design Consultant bios on the website. * Running and distributing weekly reports for rescheduled consults, open status jobs, and ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists. * Collaborating with Design Consultants to follow up on the ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists. * Sending out ‚Äúclient anniversary‚Äù marketing campaigns. * Will assign Trade Partners for the Trade program. * Managing ‚ÄúDigideck / Hepburn‚Äù activities including local photos and keeping the ‚Äúoffer list current based on market. * Responsible for sales administrative duties including, online social media support, warranty, trade packages, additional sales support (add-ons), and other clerical responsibilities. * When in the showroom, maintains the showroom at the direction of their leader in accordance with the maintenance and cleanliness checklist. This includes opening and closing of the Showroom duties. * Tracking and maintaining client traffic reports and distributing to leaders. * Maintains an adequate supply of the Design Consultant and Showroom samples in the showroom at all times. * Assists the Sales Manager with the ongoing education and training of the Design Consultants with Central Scheduling, as needed. * Responsible for assisting General Manager and Sales Manager with any administrative needs that may arise. * \*Some locations may include CAD Design Support as part of this role including: + Review and mentor Design Consultants in CAD and Design process, providing guidance + Train new Design Consultants Advanced CAD Design with the assistance of the Sales Manager + Weekly office hours and individual meetings with Design Consultants + Heavy focus with Design Consultants who‚Äôs defect rate is higher than 30%. + Support team and sales manager with product training as needed, may included CAD/Design presentation in monthly Sales Meetings. Qualifications **Competencies:** * Decisions will affect others within the functional area. * Understanding a range of routine work procedures and their impacts on internal and external work areas, requiring a longer period of job training. * Internal Communication that includes CCO team and/or corporate. * Requires the ability to elaborate on routine information and ensure understanding. * Problems encountered are routine, somewhat repetitive, and generally solved by following clear directions and procedures. * Work is guided by specific procedures and well-defined instructions. The team member would normally not deviate without seeking advice or guidance. **SKILLS & ABILITIES:** * High school diploma and/or GED * Associates Degree related to business & or sales administration from an accredited college or university preferred * 1-2 years of experience of administrative and/or customer service experience in construction and/or in the home renovations/improvement industry ‚Äì preferably within a luxury brand environment * Advanced knowledge with internal CC CAD system. * Strong communication, interpersonal and presentation skills * Ability to communicate politely, clearly and professionally with clients * Ability to work quickly and accurately data entry * Calendar management / regional scheduling experience preferred * Must be able to adapt to a fast-paced, changing environment and exercise independent though to challenges and improve the status quo. * Self-starter with a positive attitude, ability to manage own schedule and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment * Detail oriented, organized and time management skills * Ability to provide an exceptional client experience aligned to the company values * Must possess strong critical thinking, problem solving, time management, and organizational skills with the ability to work under pressure * Strong multi-tasking, time management, and prioritization capabilities * Must possess an unwavering commitment to foster a safe and event-free work environment * Tech savvy with the ability to quickly learn and apply various business systems (CAD, Epicor, Salesforce, Microsoft Office, etc) **Certificates & Licenses:**Successfully complete a Background check **PHYSICAL DEMANDS** * Ability to stand on feet for minimum 4‚Äì6-hour shift. * Minimal sitting in front of a computer for periods of time * Ability to operate office equipment using hands and fingers, handle or feel, and reach with hands and arms * Minimal bending, squatting, kneeling, stretching, twisting, reaching, and climbing * Ability to frequently talk and hear * Ability to reach with hand and arms and grasp objects * Flexible work schedule: ability to work evenings and weekends **WORK ENVIRONMENT**Company office and/or showroom location Additional Information Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. #GA148
Sr Manager, Growth Marketing - Remote
linkedin Phoenix (United States) Sun, 05 Oc N/A
**Job Description**We are seeking a strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max, and YouTube campaig...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Job Description**We are seeking a strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max, and YouTube campaigns. This role will be responsible for using data-driven insights to develop and own paid search strategies, manage media budgets, drive campaign execution, and work cross-functionally to achieve growth and ROI objectives. You understand the full search landscape to identify opportunities where paid and organic search can work together to maximize performance. While this role is focused on paid search, we‚Äôre seeking a candidate that is aware of the greater paid digital ecosystem including broadcast, streaming and OTT advertising, paid social, affiliate marketing and their potential impacts on paid search performance. The ideal candidate has a passion for problem-solving, a data-first mindset, and excellent communication skills. You will be part of the Growth Marketing team‚Äîa collaborative group of marketers working to expand brand awareness and generate demand for California Closets through conversations with the customer, optimizing their brand experience from awareness through first contact. Base salary for this range is $130k - $150k + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. This is a remote position, however there is occasionally travel required about 3-5x per year. **Responsibilities** * Lead planning, management, and execution of all California Closets Paid Search campaigns, including account setup, strategy development, campaign structure, budget management, bidding strategies, and invoice/billing oversight. * Manage budgets exceeding $10M, including market-specific billing details and reporting to internal finance teams. * Direct and manage digital agency to define, execute, and measure marketing campaigns across paid media channels including SEM, YouTube video and display, programmatic, and retargeting. * Guide agency efforts in keyword research, competitive analysis, and audience targeting to uncover growth opportunities and mitigate risks. * Leverage SEO insights to inform keyword strategy, landing page relevance, and overall search visibility. * Demonstrate a passion for data and problem-solving, with the ability to extract insights, interpret anomalies, and identify key performance trends. * Review campaign performance by market/DMA and collaborate with local business owners and managing operators to align strategies with specific objectives. * Drive continuous improvement and experimentation to meet and exceed monthly volume and ROAS targets. * Engage regularly with agency and platform account teams to assess performance, adopt optimal solutions, and evolve strategies in response to the dynamic paid search landscape. * Develop and execute a data-driven YouTube advertising strategy aligned with California Closets‚Äô business goals. * Collaborate across Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions, and Brand teams to ensure alignment of paid search initiatives with company growth initiatives & business objectives. * Conduct attribution analysis to understand how media mix impacts paid search performance, including visitor volume and quality. * Maintain awareness of SEO trends and algorithm updates to ensure paid search strategies complement organic efforts. * Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to identify opportunities for innovation and growth in paid search advertising. * Ensure compliance with corporate privacy and data governance policies for all internal and third-party efforts.
Sr Specialist, Salesforce Marketing Cloud - Remote
linkedin Phoenix (United States) Mon, 15 Se N/A
**Job Description**We‚Äôre seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candid...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Job Description**We‚Äôre seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of leveraging Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deploy technically-advanced email campaigns that enhance customer engagement and drive business results. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has a strong technical background and project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming email marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights. You‚Äôll work cross-functionally with marketing, analytics, and CRM teams to create advanced customer journeys, automated workflows, dynamic content, and system integrations. The ideal candidate is an expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud tools, scripting languages, and marketing automation best practices. We foster a values-based, collaborative environment and are seeking candidates who know how to drive growth while building deep partnerships. As a key driver of California Closets‚Äô growth, this role works in partnership with cross-functional teams, and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives. The Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist will report to the Senior Director, Relationship Marketing (CRM). **TECHNICAL EXECUTION** * Advanced experience building, managing, and optimizing email campaigns specifically within Salesforce Marketing Cloud * Hands-on experience leveraging Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Audience Builder, and Content Builder to deploy personalized, dynamic campaign flows and automations and create advanced multi-step customer journeys * Create and troubleshoot automated workflows and data processes to support real-time, triggered messaging * Proficient with building Data Extensions, conducting data imports and exports, and utilizing AMPscript to populate personalized attributes into emails * Support integration with Marketing Cloud Connect and integrating SFMC with Salesforce CRM for triggered sends and real-time personalization * Expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud data architecture, including Contact Builder, Data Extensions, and Data Views * Working knowledge of html, CSS, AMPscript, and responsive design **EMAIL TRAFFIC AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT** * Submit creative briefs and partner with cross-functional teams to take emails from concept to delivery * Help develop and maintain the monthly/quarterly email content calendar in collaboration with creative and marketing teams * Proficiency in Figma for email design collaboration, proofing, and QA * Thoroughly QA all email assets (email lists, subject lines, content blocks, links, dynamic fields, and imaging) across multiple devices and email clients before launch to ensure successful execution **REPORTING** * Strong analytical capabilities with expertise in email data analysis and performance reporting * Experience analyzing performance metrics and creating detailed campaign reports to translate insights into actionable improvements * Proficient with using Salesforce Marketing Cloud Intelligence Reports to create dashboards and visualizations * Expertise using Google Analytics (G4) or similar web analytics platform to leverage data and metrics to drive campaign improvements
Sales and Design Consultant
linkedin Lisle (United States) Sun, 14 Se N/A
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe ho...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚Äô **Job Description**The Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position. * This position will include a 12-week paid training program\*\*\* * The training class for this opportunity will begin on 9/29\*\*\* **What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits: * A fun, creative, and inclusive work environment * A generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonuses * Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision * 401(k) retirement plan with company match * Company issued cell phone and mileage reimbursement * Company leads to help bridge the gap after completion of training * Uncapped earning potential Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits. **Duties and Responsibilities:** * Commute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program. * Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business. * Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion. * Participate in meetings and training sessions. * Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment. Qualifications * Interior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred. * Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required. * Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferred * The ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship. * Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required. Additional Information Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram #IL168 *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions an...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**We‚Äôre looking for a motivated go-getter who wants to make a real difference in sales and marketing. In this role, you‚Äôll team up with our Sales Manager and General Manager to drive leads, grow opportunities, and keep things moving in the Atlanta market. You‚Äôll be hands-on with marketing campaigns, events, and the behind-the-scenes coordination that makes our sales team shine. You‚Äôll also get the chance to work on a variety of projects that will help you build new skills and sharpen your toolkit. Every day will look a little different, so if you‚Äôre eager to learn, ready to jump in, and excited to grow your career, we want to hear from you! **What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits: * Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision * PTO days and paid holidays * 401K retirement plan with company match * 40 hours/week with overtime potential * Grow your career with us ‚Äì many promotional opportunities are available Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits. **Essential Functions** * When in a showroom, serves as first contact to greet all clients who visit our showroom, including assisting the clients with signing our guestbook and offering refreshments as necessary. * Responsible for lead management in an efficient and detailed manner for our Design Consultants, using CRM. * Responsible for answering incoming phone calls & emails to either the local scheduling office or local showrooms and address client needs. * Updating the local marketing including showroom hours on the website, social media, Yelp and Google reviews. * Updating and maintaining Design Consultant bios on the website. * Running and distributing weekly reports for rescheduled consults, open status jobs, and ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists. * Collaborating with Design Consultants to follow up on the ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists. * Sending out ‚Äúclient anniversary‚Äù marketing campaigns. * Will assign Trade Partners for the Trade program. * Managing ‚ÄúDigideck / Hepburn‚Äù activities including local photos and keeping the ‚Äúoffer list current based on market. * Responsible for sales administrative duties including, online social media support, warranty, trade packages, additional sales support (add-ons), and other clerical responsibilities. * When in the showroom, maintains the showroom at the direction of their leader in accordance with the maintenance and cleanliness checklist. This includes opening and closing of the Showroom duties. * Tracking and maintaining client traffic reports and distributing to leaders. * Maintains an adequate supply of the Design Consultant and Showroom samples in the showroom at all times. * Assists the Sales Manager with the ongoing education and training of the Design Consultants with Central Scheduling, as needed. * Responsible for assisting General Manager and Sales Manager with any administrative needs that may arise. * \*Some locations may include CAD Design Support as part of this role including: + Review and mentor Design Consultants in CAD and Design process, providing guidance + Train new Design Consultants Advanced CAD Design with the assistance of the Sales Manager + Weekly office hours and individual meetings with Design Consultants + Heavy focus with Design Consultants who‚Äôs defect rate is higher than 30%. + Support team and sales manager with product training as needed, may included CAD/Design presentation in monthly Sales Meetings. Qualifications **Competencies:** * Decisions will affect others within the functional area. * Understanding a range of routine work procedures and their impacts on internal and external work areas, requiring a longer period of job training. * Internal Communication that includes CCO team and/or corporate. * Requires the ability to elaborate on routine information and ensure understanding. * Problems encountered are routine, somewhat repetitive, and generally solved by following clear directions and procedures. * Work is guided by specific procedures and well-defined instructions. The team member would normally not deviate without seeking advice or guidance. **SKILLS & ABILITIES:** * High school diploma and/or GED * Associates Degree related to business & or sales administration from an accredited college or university preferred * 1-2 years of experience of administrative and/or customer service experience in construction and/or in the home renovations/improvement industry ‚Äì preferably within a luxury brand environment * Advanced knowledge with internal CC CAD system. * Strong communication, interpersonal and presentation skills * Ability to communicate politely, clearly and professionally with clients * Ability to work quickly and accurately data entry * Calendar management / regional scheduling experience preferred * Must be able to adapt to a fast-paced, changing environment and exercise independent though to challenges and improve the status quo. * Self-starter with a positive attitude, ability to manage own schedule and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment * Detail oriented, organized and time management skills * Ability to provide an exceptional client experience aligned to the company values * Must possess strong critical thinking, problem solving, time management, and organizational skills with the ability to work under pressure * Strong multi-tasking, time management, and prioritization capabilities * Must possess an unwavering commitment to foster a safe and event-free work environment * Tech savvy with the ability to quickly learn and apply various business systems (CAD, Epicor, Salesforce, Microsoft Office, etc) **Certificates & Licenses:**Successfully complete a Background check **PHYSICAL DEMANDS** * Ability to stand on feet for minimum 4‚Äì6-hour shift. * Minimal sitting in front of a computer for periods of time * Ability to operate office equipment using hands and fingers, handle or feel, and reach with hands and arms * Minimal bending, squatting, kneeling, stretching, twisting, reaching, and climbing * Ability to frequently talk and hear * Ability to reach with hand and arms and grasp objects * Flexible work schedule: ability to work evenings and weekends **WORK ENVIRONMENT**Company office and/or showroom location Additional Information Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. #GA148
Sales Manager
linkedin Plainsboro Center (United States) Sun, 14 Se N/A
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions an...
Show full description ‚ñº
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚Äô **Job Description**The Sales Manager ensures that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the Design Consultants are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Sales Manager also collaborates with the GM and Operations Team to make sure that the process flow is being followed and results in delivering a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints. **What We Offer:**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is a company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits: * Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision * PTO days and paid holidays * 401K retirement plan with company match Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits. **Duties and Responsibilities:** * Collaborate with GM to hire and retain top talent based on the budgeted number of Design Consultants. * Manage a team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded. Ensure the Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and personal marketing plan leads. * Performance management of underperformers while following guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation. * Collaborate with head office operations team on process flow and identify opportunities for improvement. * Conduct monthly goal setting and reviews with all team members. * Work closely with the GM on a variety of initiatives including the creation of sales contests and incentive programs, a sustainable charitable strategy, and develop a sustainable trade business strategy. * Schedule and facilitate monthly Sales Meetings including coordination with guest speakers and head office personnel. * Analyze sales data and develop a strategy with GM to address areas of opportunity. * Ensure correct usage of CRM (dashboard) including quality of data entry, statuses, etc. * Review feedback through 5 Star and follow up on all negative responses with the customer and or Design Consultant, communicate findings to GM. Qualifications * 3 -5 years as a Sales Consultant or in a sales management role preferred. * Industry experience is a plus. * Proven sales coach and mentor. * Strong conflict resolution skills. * Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. * Familiarity with data analysis and reporting. * Exceptional customer experience skills. * Experience with design fundamentals preferred. * Experience with CAD is a plus. Additional Information Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram *We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. #NJ071

Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionWe‚Äôre seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of leveraging Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deploy technically-advanced email campaigns that enhance customer engagement and drive business results. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has a strong technical background and project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming email marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights. You‚Äôll work cross-functionally with marketing, analytics, and CRM teams to create advanced customer journeys, automated workflows, dynamic content, and system integrations. The ideal candidate is an expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud tools, scripting languages, and marketing automation best practices.We foster a values-based, collaborative environment and are seeking candidates who know how to drive growth while building deep partnerships. As a key driver of California Closets‚Äô growth, this role works in partnership with cross-functional teams, and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives. The Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist will report to the Senior Director, Relationship Marketing (CRM).TECHNICAL EXECUTIONAdvanced experience building, managing, and optimizing email campaigns specifically within Salesforce Marketing CloudHands-on experience leveraging Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Audience Builder, and Content Builder to deploy personalized, dynamic campaign flows and automations and create advanced multi-step customer journeysCreate and troubleshoot automated workflows and data processes to support real-time, triggered messagingProficient with building Data Extensions, conducting data imports and exports, and utilizing AMPscript to populate personalized attributes into emailsSupport integration with Marketing Cloud Connect and integrating SFMC with Salesforce CRM for triggered sends and real-time personalizationExpert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud data architecture, including Contact Builder, Data Extensions, and Data ViewsWorking knowledge of html, CSS, AMPscript, and responsive designEMAIL TRAFFIC AND PROJECT MANAGEMENTSubmit creative briefs and partner with cross-functional teams to take emails from concept to deliveryHelp develop and maintain the monthly/quarterly email content calendar in collaboration with creative and marketing teamsProficiency in Figma for email design collaboration, proofing, and QAThoroughly QA all email assets (email lists, subject lines, content blocks, links, dynamic fields, and imaging) across multiple devices and email clients before launch to ensure successful executionREPORTINGStrong analytical capabilities with expertise in email data analysis and performance reportingExperience analyzing performance metrics and creating detailed campaign reports to translate insights into actionable improvementsProficient with using Salesforce Marketing Cloud Intelligence Reports to create dashboards and visualizationsExpertise using Google Analytics (G4) or similar web analytics platform to leverage data and metrics to drive campaign improvementsQualificationsBachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, Analytics, or related fieldSalesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Email SpecialistSalesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Administrator5-7 years of professional hands-on email marketing experience, ideally at an agency or within a premium lifestyle brandStrong experience with Excel for data manipulation, charts and pivot tablesAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.**Training class starting early September**Duties and Responsibilities:Primarily works outside of a fixed office or retail location, meeting face to face with potential and existing customers.Attend monthly sales meetings at the Huntington Beach office.Commute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Prospecting new clients, maintaining relationships, presenting products/solutions, and closing sales.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.QualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram#CA002We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.CA Privacy Policy - California Privacy Policy - California ClosetsTerms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

The Assistant Sales Manager also collaborates with the Operations team to ensure that the process flow is being followed and results in delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints.Pay: 90K+ & bonusEssential FunctionsCoach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R‚Äôs.Ensure direct reports are delivering on an exception customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policyPerformance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager.Collaborate with Sales Manager and other Assistant Sales Managers Sales Leads to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development including classroom and CC 360 (Not academy) courses & other required training sessions from time to time.Working in collaboration with the General Manager and Central Support team to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads.Work with Design Consultants to create a Personal Marketing Plan and/or a plan for self-generated leads.Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team membersCo-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with GM on creation and tracking.Working in collaboration with the rest of the Sales Leadership team, co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers and head office personnel.Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity.Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID).Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs attendance at the monthly sales meetings.Ensure correct usage of CRM (dashboard & SalesForce) including quality of data entry, statuses etc.New Designer TrainingPotential involvement in initial and follow up interviewsPotentially coordinate your assigned Designers‚Äô access to websites (CC email, Paylocity, CC 360, SalesForce, Dashboard, Slack, Digideck, DocuSign, Zoom, Sharepoint), materials (Computer, iPad, CAD key, Business Cards, branded materials and supplies) and samples (Designer Bags, Finish boxes).Ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new training and development including classroom and CC 360 courses.QualificationsHigh school diploma and/or GED, some college education preferred3+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or In-Home sales3+ years of management/leadership experienceAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, Sales and Design Consultant
linkedin Harrisburg (United States) Wed, 14 Ma N/A
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home i...
Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries, garages, laundry rooms and home offices, we design, manufacture and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This is a franchise location, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesProfit Sharing401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued laptop computer and CAD programCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingOther franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.QualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. and assertive, consultative sales skills.Advance knowledge of Microsoft suite and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD or Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Assistant Sales Manager role focuses on ensuring that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the designers are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Assistant Sales Manager also collaborates with the Operations team to ensure that the process flow is being followed and results in delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints.Pay: 90K+ & bonusEssential FunctionsCoach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R‚Äôs.Ensure direct reports are delivering on an exception customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policyPerformance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager.Collaborate with Sales Manager and other Assistant Sales Managers Sales Leads to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development including classroom and CC 360 (Not academy) courses & other required training sessions from time to time.Working in collaboration with the General Manager and Central Support team to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads.Work with Design Consultants to create a Personal Marketing Plan and/or a plan for self-generated leads.Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team membersCo-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with GM on creation and tracking.Working in collaboration with the rest of the Sales Leadership team, co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers and head office personnel.Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity.Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID).Monitor and enforce sales team‚Äôs attendance at the monthly sales meetings.Ensure correct usage of CRM (dashboard & SalesForce) including quality of data entry, statuses etc.New Designer TrainingPotential involvement in initial and follow up interviewsPotentially coordinate your assigned Designers‚Äô access to websites (CC email, Paylocity, CC 360, SalesForce, Dashboard, Slack, Digideck, DocuSign, Zoom, Sharepoint), materials (Computer, iPad, CAD key, Business Cards, branded materials and supplies) and samples (Designer Bags, Finish boxes).Ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new training and development including classroom and CC 360 courses.QualificationsHigh school diploma and/or GED, some college education preferredInterior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home d√©cor.5+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments3+ years of management/leadership experienceProven track record of leading a team to exceed sales quotas and sales metricsAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram#TX140We are an equal opportunity employer. contests and incentive programs and collaborate with GM on creation and tracking.Working in collaboration with the rest of the Sales Leadership team, co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Job DescriptionThe primary responsibility of the Sales Support Assistant is to assist the sales team as it pertains to providing an exceptional Brand Experience. This includes responsibilities with local social media, the development of sales performance reporting, administration of local marketing events, and the processing of sales documents.This position requires a work schedule of 10a-4p Tuesday-SaturdayPay for this opportunity is $19-$21/hrWhat We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and VisionPTO days and paid holidays401K retirement plan with company match40 hours/week with overtime potentialGrow your career with us ‚Äì many promotional opportunities are availableFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Essential FunctionsResponsible for lead management in an efficient and detailed manner for our Design Consultants, using CRM.Responsible for answering incoming phone calls & emails to either the local scheduling office or local showrooms and address client needs.Updating the local marketing including showroom hours on the website, social media, Yelp and Google reviews.Updating and maintaining Design Consultant bios on the website.Running and distributing weekly reports for rescheduled consults, open status jobs, and ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists.Collaborating with Design Consultants to follow up on the ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists.Sending out ‚Äúclient anniversary‚Äù marketing campaigns.Managing the Digital Showroom activities including local photos and keeping the ‚Äúoffer list current based on market.Responsible for sales administrative duties including, online social media support, warranty, trade packages, additional sales support (add-ons), and other clerical responsibilities.Tracking and maintaining client traffic reports and distributing to leaders.Maintains an adequate supply of the Design Consultant and Showroom samples in the showroom at all times.Assists the Sales Manager with the ongoing education and training of the Design Consultants with Central Scheduling, as needed.

Show full description ‚ñº
Job DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.
Sales and Design Consultant DELAWARE
linkedin Lewes (United States) Tue, 22 Ap N/A
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and ex...
Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place - it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs.Job DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer's needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design integrity and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:Health insurance - Medical, Dental, and Vision401K retirement plan with company matchTraining payA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program, commission, and bonusesCell phone and mileage reimbursementInitial and ongoing training on products, CRM, and proprietary CAD softwareQualified leads and an excellent environment in a refreshingly open culture alongside individuals who love to exceed expectationsFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesDesign organization units for customers utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Utilize a consultative sales approach to meet monthly sales goals.Telecommute to customers' homes for a needs analysis and to design a storage unitParticipate in meetings and training sessionsContinuous follow-up with the customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Pursue referrals and repeat business.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales related goals and targets.This is a full-time (40 hours/ week) opportunityQualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, or proven passion for home dcor.Manage and engage customers through an exceptional experience where the consultant is the reason for repeat clients.Professional and assertive, consultative sales skills.Advance knowledge of Microsoft suite and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD or design software is a plus.The ability to be consistently inspiring and create delightful customer and brand experiences.Confidently be able to sell and promote a product.The ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Team player with the ability to manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/RequiredPreferredJob IndustriesSales & Marketing

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.QualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/
Paid Social Media Marketing Manager - Remote
linkedin Phoenix (United States) Sat, 19 Ap N/A
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and ex...
Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionWe‚Äôre seeking a creative and data-driven Paid Social Media Marketing Manager to lead and optimize our paid social advertising campaigns across Meta and other social platforms. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of running high-performing campaigns that blend innovative, compelling creative with precise, data-informed optimization strategies. The ideal candidate thrives in a values-based and collaborative environment and demonstrates a growth mindset. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has strong project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights.As a key driver of California Closets‚Äô growth, this role works in partnership with the Brand Content and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility acquisition marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives.ResponsibilitiesOwn the paid social content calendar and execute full funnel creative strategies from awareness and consideration to customer prospecting and retargeting. Creative will be informed by the Brand‚Äôs Content calendar, current social media trends, and data-driven organic and paid social performance insightsDrive and manage customer acquisition through social platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Reddit, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest, LinkedIn with detailed knowledge of audiences, functional nuances, and targeted channel leversProactively identify and embrace all aspects of social media ‚Äì from algorithm shifts to available audiences, campaign and placement types, ways to leverage 1P data by platform and awareness about emerging platforms and related technologiesManage the results of paid social media influencer marketing strategies that align with our Brand goals and objectivesCollaborate with the Brand Content team to identify, engage and manage relationships with influencers representing California Closets in paid social media campaignsPresent the strategy, tactics and results to key owner/operator stakeholders, sharing insights and techniques used improve channel effectiveness via presentations, meetings and webinarsEstablish account and campaign strategies rooted in experimentation, industry benchmarks, and insights from account representatives at Meta, TikTok, Pinterest etc.Design, launch, and manage performance-driven paid campaigns on Meta (Facebook/Instagram), TikTok, Pinterest and/or other social platforms, focusing on CPA and ROAS goalsConduct A/B testing on creatives, landing pages, and bidding strategies to continuously optimize performanceRun in-depth post-campaign analysis, develop test plans for new user acquisition initiatives, and measure performance to identify testing opportunitiesCollaborate across levels and functions within the Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions and Brand teams to support company growth initiativesEnsure agency partner teams effectively balance bid methods to deliver intended outcomes, at scale and on time, and within efficiency guardrailsEnsure that all your efforts and those of 3rd party partners adhere to the latest corporate privacy and data governance policiesQualifications5+ years of professional hands-on paid social media planning and management experience with platforms including Meta properties, TikTok, Pinterest, Snapchat and Reddit. Experience must be focused on paid, not organic.Experience in managing paid social media projects and implementing paid social media influencer marketing strategiesFamiliarity working with paid influencer platformsStrong experience using Google Analytics (G4) and leveraging data and metrics to drive campaign improvementsStrong experience with Excel (data manipulation, charts and pivot tables)Advanced experience building, managing and optimizing social campaigns within the Meta and other social media platformsExperience working within cross-functional marketing and creative teamsMust be willing to work Pacific or Mountain TimeAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.This address to this position does not reflect a showroom the Designer will be reporting to but is part of the region this Designer will oversee.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.QualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.#GA148Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

Director, Brand Marketing - Remote
linkedin Phoenix (United States) Thu, 10 Ap N/A
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and ex...
Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionAs an important member of the growing Brand Marketing team, this role requires creativity and laser focus on building California Closets‚Äô differentiated Brand position as the industry leader. The ideal candidate has a strong editorial background in Brand content development across marketing channels and specifically brings seasoned and proven ability to lead organic social strategy with ideas that resonate and engage with California Closets‚Äô community across platforms. Reporting to the VP of Brand Strategy & Partnerships, this role is highly involved in Brand initiatives, campaigns, and collaborations and is responsible for organic social content strategy, execution, and performance analysis.At California Closets, values matter. Team-oriented collaboration, kindness, and respect are just as important as proficiency in excellent communication, organization, and project management.ResponsibilitiesBrand PositioningPartner with the Brand Marketing team comprised of Brand, Design, Creative, and Growth leaders, as well as key internal stakeholders, to maintain the integrity of the Brand‚Äôs voice and visual identity across Brand environments.Craft differentiating Brand narratives and refine strategic positioning, ensuring it resonates with our business operators and customer audiences.Content & Media PartnershipsManage Brand collaborations with media partners, design influencers and celebrities in partnership with VP of Brand Strategy to foster those relationships and generate original content that differentiates California Closets‚Äô design point of view, quality, and expertise for creating custom storage solutions throughout the home.Support the ideation to execution phases, and distribution of full-funnel Brand campaigns.Develop content that ladders up to thematic focuses and supports the Company‚Äôs award-winning Ideas of Order Magazine and Podcast, managing an integrated Brand Marketing calendar and partnering with team members to ensure that quarterly content is cohesive and drives to business needs.Lead external Brand efforts and communications with our national PR agency and media partners, working effectively with cross functional teams and both internal and external stakeholders.Lead organic social media content planning and posting across Instagram, IGTV, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and any and all new emerging platforms by partnering with key team members and leveraging the Company‚Äôs digital platform resources and consultants.Project ManagementLead creative agency and/or project-based partners on all organic social content deliverables as determined by integrated brand marketing briefs approved by VP of Brand Strategy.Coordinate and project manage approved digital content shoots with creative agency and/or project-based partners.Monitor new technology, platforms, macro trends, and other Brand activities, etc. to ensure California Closets social presence remains authentic, competitive, and relevant.Cross-Functional CollaborationServe as a supporting point of contact for all brand-related matters, ensuring clear and consistent communication across teams and departments.Work collaboratively and efficiently across all teams and productively contribute to team conversations and presentations that address Brand contents strategy and performance.QualificationsBachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, Communications, or related field10+ years of professional experience in Brand Marketing or Content Strategy, ideally within home, lifestyle or design field.Proven experience in strategic Brand positioning, development, and communication.Proven experience of hands-on organic social media management including examples demonstrating expertise in social-first content creation, including video, design, motion graphics, and copy.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer.
