Sales and Design Consultant
linkedin Washington (United States) Sun, 06 Ap N/A
POSITION SUMMARYThe Sales and Design Consultant provides an in-home customer experience by designing and selling closets, cabinetry, home offices, garages, media centers and other storage solutions fo...
Show full description ‚ñº
POSITION SUMMARYThe Sales and Design Consultant provides an in-home customer experience by designing and selling closets, cabinetry, home offices, garages, media centers and other storage solutions for homes.Our in-home customer experience includes taking multiple meetings per week where designer will measure space and design on-site with proprietary CAD software. Designer is also responsible for working with internal team on ordering necessary materials, scheduling installations and managing all sold projects to completion.Designers are responsible for meeting monthly and yearly sales goals set forth by closing business from assigned leads and self-generated leads.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSBrand Experience Responsibilities:-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Design Consultants play a critical role in building strong relationships with customers and representing the brand through demonstration of our Company Core Values while also executing all steps in the Facilitative Sales Cycle-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Commute using personal vehicle to customers‚Äô home for a needs analysis to design a unit-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Manage both company and self-generated leads from start to finish. This includes a 24-hour turnaround time for introductory call, designing on-the-spot during consultations, uploading required documents into CXM (Salesforce), follow up with the customers and collaborating with installation team to ensure job completion, visiting installations to ensure effective project management and expectations align with contracted project.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Design Consultants are required to complete an average of 12-15 new client consultations per month-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Create goals and manage your ‚ÄúPersonal Marketing Plan‚Äù, for self-generated leads while building relationships with existing customers and pursue referrals/repeat business-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Monitor your performance metrics at all times in company‚Äôs prescribed software (monthly, YTD, close rate, average sale and sales per consultation)-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Meet weekly for 1:1 with sales leader and regularly review performance metrics. Prepare for mid-month projection via Goal, Setting, and Review meetings-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Design Consultants are required to maintain the highest standards of quality in every aspect of their work to ensure customer satisfaction.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Respond to all internal and external emails/phone calls within a 24-hour period within business working hours.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Follow and understand industry trends including fashion, design, and organization.Technology Responsibilities:-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Utilize the Cal Closets Retail Inc. cloud-based software (SalesForce) for managing contracts, opportunities, scheduling meetings, and documenting every contact and next step with customers.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Maintain customer records: (including but not limited to‚Ä¶) All contact related correspondence, interaction, and clear next steps; relevant documents related to each customer; identify, evaluate, and design solutions to meet the needs of the customers; accurately design project(s) for customers through CAD program; maintain high quality standards and assure each project is completed correctly, in addition, partnering with national plan review team for complexity meetings and/or making changes to the design. Request support from the sales leadership team if encountering difficulties with customer designs or project complexities.Design Consultant Availability Expectations:-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Attend company meetings or functions as required, including monthly GS&Rs, monthly sales meetings, and sales training meetings.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Available for appointments 5 days a week. This includes one evening a week (after 5pm), and 2 appointments two weekend days (Saturday or Sunday) per month.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Consultation expectations: 4 new appointments per week, depending on the volume of incoming leads, the number of sales consultants, workload, and performance. There is no guarantee of a minimum number of leads from Corporate Lead Sources; therefore, may need to rely on Personal Marketing and Prospecting (PMP) efforts to meet monthly consultation expectations.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Work with Sales Manager to set minimum 40 ‚ÄúOperating Hours‚Äù per week in applicable software systems. This open availability specifies windows for new opportunities and blocks of time set aside for designing, personal marketing, networking, and follow-up appointments.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Showroom duty requirements: Work 2-3 showroom shifts per month.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Participate in a rotating work schedule in the local Showroom(s) and meet clients in the showroom agreed upon appointment times with customers, as required.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Make every effort to accommodate reasonable customer requests for meeting days, times, and locations. Appointments are scheduled primarily based on customer needs, considering factors such as customer availability, drive time, designer availability, and performance.POSITION QUALIFICATIONSCompetencies:-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Understanding a range of work procedures and practices, some of which are non-routine, which require a base level of specialized/technical knowledge. Acquired through some formal training or equivalent experience.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Requires the skill to persuade, influence, and/or negotiate with others on a regular basis-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†External communication that includes clients, vendors, gov‚Äôt agencies, and service providers-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Internal Communication that includes manufacturing, corporate, and other CCO teams.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Modifies existing processes in order to resolve issues.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Significantly enhances entire existing processes, systems, or products.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Work will be guided by company policies and strategies. The team member has freedom to act independently to achieve objectives within appropriate guidelines, practices, and precedents. The team member is responsible for setting annual objectives for their area.SKILLS & ABILITIES-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†College Degree Preferred-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†High School Diploma Required-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Interior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home d√©cor-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†2+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to learn new software programs quickly; Tech savvy with the ability to quickly learn and apply various business systems (CAD, Salesforce, Microsoft Office, etc)-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to provide an exceptional client experience aligned to the company values.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Professional and assertive, consultative sales skills.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Detail oriented, organized and with time and project management skills.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Self-starter and ability to manage own schedule working remotely.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Understanding the importance of repeat customers, referrals and cultivating relationships.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience in customer service or retail sales of any kind, where the consultant is the reason for repeat clients.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†The ability to be consistently inspirational and create delightful customer and brand experiences.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†A proven record of sales success.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Confidently able to sell and promote a product you might not be able to personally afford.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Team player with the ability to manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven customer service / support experience-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Thorough knowledge of millwork and related materials and hardware (i.e door styles, finishes, decorative hardware, countertop surfacing, glass or molding)-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong communication, interpersonal and presentation skills-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong phone contact handling skills and active listening-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Demonstrates excellent critical thinking and reasoning abilities to identify and resolve potential issues.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to work with all employees to create a forward-moving, positive work environment.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proficient in math (i.e. Fractions and unit measurements)-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Must possess an unwavering commitment to foster a safe and event-free work environmentCERTIFICATES & LICENSES-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Valid driver‚Äôs license, current vehicle registration and a driving record that is acceptable to the company. Minimum vehicle insurance coverage and ability to maintain vehicle in good repair.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Successfully complete a MVR and Background check Government Regulations and Safety: We are committed to providing a workplace free from serious recognized hazards and comply with standards, rules and regulations issued under the OSH Act. It is the responsibility of the employer and team members to examine workplace conditions to make sure they conform to applicable OSHA standards. As a result, we will make sure team members have and use safe tools and equipment and properly maintain this equipment. Reasonable Accommodations Statement To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.PHYSICAL DEMANDS-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Often sitting in front of a computer for long periods of time-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability standing on feet for longer periods of time-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Frequently bending, squatting, kneeling, stretching, twisting, reaching, and climbing when measuring difficult spaces-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to often lift up to 20 pounds.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to operate office equipment using hands and fingers, handle or feel, and reach with hands and arms and grasp objects.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to frequently talk and hear.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Flexible work schedule: ability to work evenings and weekendsWORK ENVIRONMENT-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Frequently traveling in personal car/vehicle-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Frequently in client‚Äôs personal residential homes-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Some out of state travel required for meetings and/or conferences.-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Company office location and/or showroom based on a schedule set by management

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe primary responsibility of the Sales Support Assistant is to assist the sales team as it pertains to providing an exceptional Brand Experience. This includes responsibilities with local social media, the development of sales performance reporting, administration of local marketing events, and the processing of sales documents.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:Health insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and VisionPTO days and paid holidays401K retirement plan with company match40 hours/week with overtime potentialGrow your career with us ‚Äì many promotional opportunities are availableFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Essential FunctionsResponsible for lead management in an efficient and detailed manner for our Design Consultants, using CRM.Responsible for answering incoming phone calls & emails to either the local scheduling office or local showrooms and address client needs.Updating the local marketing including showroom hours on the website, social media, Yelp and Google reviews.Updating and maintaining Design Consultant bios on the website.Running and distributing weekly reports for rescheduled consults, open status jobs, and ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists.Collaborating with Design Consultants to follow up on the ‚Äúpending‚Äù client lists.Sending out ‚Äúclient anniversary‚Äù marketing campaigns.Managing the Digital Showroom activities including local photos and keeping the ‚Äúoffer list current based on market.Responsible for sales administrative duties including, online social media support, warranty, trade packages, additional sales support (add-ons), and other clerical responsibilities.Tracking and maintaining client traffic reports and distributing to leaders.Maintains an adequate supply of the Design Consultant and Showroom samples in the showroom at all times.Assists the Sales Manager with the ongoing education and training of the Design Consultants with Central Scheduling, as needed.QualificationsHigh school diploma and/or GEDAssociates Degree related to business & or sales administration from an accredited college or university preferred1-2 years of experience of administrative and/or customer service experience in construction and/or in the home renovations/improvement industry ‚Äì preferably within a luxury brand environmentAbility to work quickly and accurately data entryCalendar management / regional scheduling experience Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.QualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.#MD086Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

We are currently looking for designers based in the Vancouver, WA area to be based out of our NEW Showroom. Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionWe‚Äôre seeking a creative and data-driven Social Media Marketing Manager to lead and optimize our paid social advertising campaigns across Meta and other social platforms. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of running high-performing campaigns that blend innovative, compelling creative with precise, data-informed optimization strategies. The ideal candidate thrives in a values-based and collaborative environment and demonstrates a growth mindset. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has strong project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights.As a key driver of California Closets‚Äô growth, this role works in partnership with the Brand Content and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility acquisition marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives.ResponsibilitiesOwn the paid social content calendar and execute full funnel creative strategies from awareness and consideration to customer prospecting and retargeting. Creative will be informed by the Brand‚Äôs Content calendar, current social media trends, and data-driven organic and paid social performance insightsDrive and manage customer acquisition through social platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Reddit, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest, LinkedIn with detailed knowledge of audiences, functional nuances, and targeted channel leversProactively identify and embrace all aspects of social media ‚Äì from algorithm shifts to available audiences, campaign and placement types, ways to leverage 1P data by platform and awareness about emerging platforms and related technologiesManage the results of paid social media influencer marketing strategies that align with our Brand goals and objectivesCollaborate with the Brand Content team to identify, engage and manage relationships with influencers representing California Closets in paid social media campaignsPresent the strategy, tactics and results to key owner/operator stakeholders, sharing insights and techniques used improve channel effectiveness via presentations, meetings and webinarsEstablish account and campaign strategies rooted in experimentation, industry benchmarks, and insights from account representatives at Meta, TikTok, Pinterest etc.Design, launch, and manage performance-driven paid campaigns on Meta (Facebook/Instagram), TikTok, Pinterest and/or other social platforms, focusing on CPA and ROAS goalsConduct A/B testing on creatives, landing pages, and bidding strategies to continuously optimize performanceRun in-depth post-campaign analysis, develop test plans for new user acquisition initiatives, and measure performance to identify testing opportunitiesCollaborate across levels and functions within the Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions and Brand teams to support company growth initiativesEnsure agency partner teams effectively balance bid methods to deliver intended outcomes, at scale and on time, and within efficiency guardrailsEnsure that all your efforts and those of 3rd party partners adhere to the latest corporate privacy and data governance policiesQualifications5+ years of professional hands-on paid social media planning and management experience with platforms including Meta properties, TikTok, Pinterest, Snapchat and RedditExperience in managing paid social media projects and implementing paid social media influencer marketing strategiesFamiliarity working with paid influencer platformsStrong experience using Google Analytics (G4) and leveraging data and metrics to drive campaign improvementsStrong experience with Excel (data manipulation, charts and pivot tables)Advanced experience building, managing and optimizing social campaigns within the Meta and other social media platformsExperience working within cross-functional marketing and creative teamsMust be willing to work Pacific or Mountain TimeAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. times.Assists the Sales Manager with the ongoing education and training of the Design Consultants with Central Scheduling, as needed.QualificationsHigh school diploma and/or GEDAssociates Degree related to business & or sales administration from an accredited college or university preferred1-2 years of experience of administrative and/or customer service experience in construction and/or in the home renovations/improvement industry ‚Äì preferably within a luxury brand environmentAbility to work quickly and accurately data entryCalendar management / regional scheduling experience preferredTech savvy with the ability to quickly learn and apply various business systems (CAD, Epicor, Salesforce, Microsoft Office, etc)Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚ÄòPractical Magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals, new trade partnerships, new customers and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.1 Mandatory evening shift a week, 2 weekends a month and 4 retail showroom shifts a month.QualificationsAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Outside sales experience with emphasis in customized solutions.Ability to Cultivate new business through a personal marketing plan.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram#NV123We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

Company DescriptionLife at California Closets:Are you craving something more out of your work life? More inspiration, a better culture, the chance to make an impact, the opportunity to learn and grow? If you‚Äôre a sales-driven, networking champion with a flair for creativity, apply to be a California Closets Design Consultant today.Job DescriptionJob SummaryOur Sales and Design Consultants are the keepers of our most important relationships and joy-makers who believe there is real purpose in helping others design better lives, where they are free to focus on what matters most.In this role, you‚Äôll work directly with our clients to create closets and storage solutions customized to their needs during in-home consultations and in our design showrooms. This is sales position that sells the designs you create.We will get you started with the design training and tools you need for success. From there, your opportunity for growth is virtually unlimited: It all comes down to you, with our full support along the way.What will make you successful in this role is your desire to learn and grow, your passion for making a difference, and your ability to listen to customers‚Äô ideas and transform an everyday space into one that truly improves their lives.Here, you‚Äôll find flexibility with the support system of an industry-leading company. The ability to wear different hats ‚Äî and to thrive while doing so ‚Äî is a plus.If you are self-motivated, hardworking, want to be part of a family culture, love forging relationships with customers, are energized by creating tranquility and order, and committed to unrivaled customer service and delivering excellence, then there is a home for you here.What We OfferPaid trainingSalary plus commission pay based on sales performanceNo commission maxProfessional development opportunitiesPaid time offMedical, dental, vision, and other insurance benefits available401KWhat Will You Do?Manage all facets of the sales cycle, from initial inquiry through final installationDesign solutions that inspire and meet client needs using proprietary CAD software to complete design specificationsDevelop ongoing client relationshipsMaintain an ongoing consultation schedule through company and independently generated leadsStay updated and understand industry trends that include organization, fashion, and interior designBuild relationships with clients and potential clients through networkingWork Design Showroom shifts as scheduled by managementQualificationsWhat You NeedPrior sales experiencePassion for organization, design, and helping peopleStrong communication and listening skillsA desire to learn, grow, and build relationships with customersAbility to work with computer software and to learn CAD programsValid Driver‚Äôs LicenseHigh school diploma or equivalentLearn more about the California Closets Michigan team here.Hear directly from some of our Sales and Design Consultants on finding their dream career here.Check us out on InstagramAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionWe are seeking a results-driven Director of Sales to lead and inspire our sales team while achieving and exceeding company sales goals. This role plays a critical part in driving business growth by ensuring all key metrics are met, maintaining adherence to California Closets‚Äô policies and procedures, and delivering a high standard of customer service at every touchpoint. In this role, you will develop and implement strategic plans to drive growth, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and deliver exceptional customer experiences.The Director of Sales will manage, mentor, and develop the Design Consultant team to ensure excellence in customer experiences. Additionally, you will collaborate with the CEO and Operations Team to maintain seamless process flows that align with California Closets‚Äô standards and contribute to sustainable success.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is a franchise location and is independently owned and operated. This position earns the following benefits:Medical Health insurancePaid holidays401K retirement plan with company matchKey ResponsibilitiesTeam Leadership and Performance ManagementHire and retain top talent in collaboration with the CEO, ensuring budget alignmentManage and mentor a team of Design Consultants to deliver the California Closets experience, meeting or exceeding revenue goals and KPIsConduct monthly and quarterly goal-setting sessions and performance reviews, providing coaching and guidance to support the professional growth of Design ConsultantsAddress underperformance through structured improvement plans and maintaining detailed documentationEnsure Design Consultants deliver the California Closets‚Äô standards of excellence for every customer interactionSales Strategy and ExecutionDevelop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve and exceed sales targetsWork closely with the Operations Analytics Team to identify opportunities and risks through data insights, driving informed decision-makingCollaborate with the CEO to establish and execute initiatives that meet or exceed sales goals and key business metricsWork with cross-functional teams to create and execute sales contests, incentive programs, and develop sustainable trade business strategiesCustomer Relations and Process ManagementOversee proper CRM usage, emphasizing and maintaining high-quality data entry and monitoring sales activityReview customer feedback and address any negative responses, ensuring appropriate follow-ups with customers and Design ConsultantsCollaborate with the CEO and Operations Team to ensure adherence to process flows and deliver exceptional customer service across all touch pointsCollaboration and CommunicationPartner with the CEO on cross-functional initiatives, such as optimizing sales processes and enhancing customer experiencesPlan and lead monthly sales meetings, incorporating updates, strategy discussions, and guest speakers. Work closely with the Operations Team to maintain process flow and alignment with business objectivesQualifications3+ years‚Äô experience in sales, sales operations/management, marketing, consulting, business development, or a related fieldProven track record in achieving sales targets and leading high-performing teamsDemonstrated success as a sales coach and mentor, fostering team development and growthStrong skills in effectively managing and resolving conflictsExceptional written and verbal communication abilitiesOutstanding ability to deliver exceptional customer experiencesExperience with data analysis and reporting to drive informed decisionsFamiliarity with design fundamentals preferred; experience with CAD is a plusAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.CA Privacy Policy - California Privacy Policy - California ClosetsTerms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.This position will include a 12 week paid training program***The training class for this opportunity will start in April***What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:A fun, creative, and inclusive work environmentA generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn commissions or bonusesHealth insurance ‚Äì Medical, Dental, and Vision401(k) retirement plan with company matchCompany issued cell phone and mileage reimbursementCompany leads to help bridge the gap after completion of trainingUncapped earning potentialFranchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.Duties And ResponsibilitiesCommute to customers‚Äô homes and design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.Continuous follow-up with customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.Participate in meetings and training sessions.Manage a portfolio of projects and clients of different complexity in a dynamic environment.QualificationsInterior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferredThe ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.Valid driver‚Äôs license and reliable transportation is required.Additional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. Show full description ‚ñº
Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place ‚Äî it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‚Äòpractical magic.‚ÄôJob DescriptionWe are seeking a visionary‚ÄØSenior Director of Customer and Marketing Analytics‚ÄØto lead our efforts in transforming disparate data sources into actionable insights that inform strategy and drive performance. The leader in this role will have a chance to create (from the ground up) the Analytics function within the Growth Marketing team, providing oversight and support across the Relationship Marketing (CRM), Digital Marketing, Customer Care, and Web teams.The Senior Director will establish and maintain the standards and KPIs that define our success, enabling the organization to track and optimize marketing and customer strategies at both a national and local level. With the goal of delivering a telemetry transformation within the organization, this individual will create both channel-specific and executive dashboards to monitor key metrics such as web traffic, lead generation, sales, and customer lifecycle progression. Key to the role will be driving analytics capability growth using AI, ML, and conversational analytics to enhance our relationships with our customers.Additionally, this leader will be responsible for answering fundamental questions like:What customer segments should we be nurturing?Where are the dig sites for our next growth opportunities?Which Media Mix analytics partner would be best suited to help support our specific business structure and reporting needs?What channel investment would drive the most incrementality for our business?What leading indicators should we track to get ahead of issues before they happen?What is the optimal test plan for a given channel/program that will drive usable, statistically significant results?You manage what you measure and, as a result, this role is a critical member of our Growth Marketing team.Key ResponsibilitiesModernize our approach to telemetry, by integrating diverse data sources into a cohesive framework that becomes a key springboard for decision-making and action.Develop and implement an advanced analytics roadmap and strategy.Define and monitor customer and marketing KPIs.Partner with leadership to design and deliver performance dashboards for executive and operational decision-making.Evaluate and implement analytics tools, partners, and models that support the company‚Äôs unique structure, which includes franchise and corporate-owned locations.Develop testing roadmaps in partnership with channel leaders.Support corporate data governance efforts on behalf of the Growth team.Provide thought leadership to the organization on privacy and cookie consent management.Evaluate our tracking capabilities inclusive of our tag management approaches, providing continuous monitoring and optimization.Manage 3rd party CRM system vendor from a data integrity and system standpoint in collaboration with tech partners and CRM team.Collaborate across levels and functions within the Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions, and Brand teams.Serve as the data & analytics evangelist for the knowledge, benefits, and opportunities this department can unlock for the business.Qualifications15+ years of marketing analytics and customer insights experienceStrong problem-solving skills with a record of transforming data sets into actionable insights and outcomesProven expertise in data modeling, statistical analysis, performance dashboard building, and KPI development/alignmentAdvanced knowledge of SQL, Marketing Analytics and Business Intelligence tools required (Salesforce, Tableau, Sugar, GA4, and Alteryx experience a plus)Deep experience with tagging tools and partners (GTM, Tealium etc.)Demonstrated performance across corporate and franchise business models a plusAbility to evaluate and implement responsive solutions to meet business needsEffective communicator, able to turn complicated data sets into inspiring insights within both small and large group settingsTrack record of building of strong cross-functional partnerships and developing teamsOccasional travel necessary for in-person meetings with partners and operatorsServant leader mindset requiredAdditional InformationFind us on Facebook, YouTube, and InstagramWe are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. By listening to a customer‚Äôs needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. CB2 is transforming the perception of home design for today's modern consumer. Born out of Crate and Barrel, CB2 is committed to high-quality, sophisticated design at an approachable price. Located in downtown Chicago, CB2 offers an engaging, collaborative work environment. If you're creative, team spirited and have a passion for modern design, then join the team as a Director, Digital and Paid Marketing.The Director, Digital and Paid Marketing will oversee all aspects of paid marketing initiatives from vision, planning, budget management, customer insights, analytics, execution and decision making across programs across CB2. They will lead a dedicated team across paid search, social, and display, and is the primary decision maker with the external digital marketing agency.This is a 4 day hybrid position based out of our CB2 Headquarters in Chicago, Illinois.A day in the life as a Director, Digital and Paid Marketing‚Ä¶Own the strategy for growing all paid and digital marketing efforts, working in close partnership with the Ecommerce, Brand Marketing, Creative, and other cross-functional teamsEnsure cross functional alignment to paid marketing strategy for building immediate and long term visionAccountable for conceiving and executing customer-centric strategies that support key brand objectives: acquisition, retention, key program support (Design Services, New Movers, Registry, Trade, B2B)Accountable for ensuring all budgets are strategically aligned to business goals including ecom sales, traffic, and conversion goals in partnership with the ecom teamResponsible for driving and communicating hind-sight performance and optimizationsAccountable for developing and maximizing marketing budget in partnership with the external agency to drive business objectivesResponsible for ensuring CB2 Marketing has strong relationships with key platform and vendor partners (Google, Meta, Pinterest, TikTok, etc) and is staying abreast of new ideas and developing tactics and technologyPartner with Analytics, Ecom, and Agency partners to develop ‚Äúsource of truth‚Äù reporting that triangulates marketing platform reporting and ecom reporting to ensure strategy and performance alignmentPartner with the Marketing/Planning/Merchandising/Ecom leadership to develop customer-centric promotional and advertising strategies that deliver on financial goals and the editorial calendarTeam leadership excellence. Be able to develop a strong performance minded team, and communicate strategy cross-functionally to business partnersWhat you‚Äôll bring to the table‚Ä¶A Digital thought leader with a passion for connecting media to business performanceAn analytical leader with a passion for digital innovation Results Oriented while maintaining a balance between brand building and performanceA strong passion for retail with entrepreneurial energy, an innovative spirit, and insatiable curiosityPassion for understanding the customer and influencing their journeyAbility to think strategically & tactically to ensure ideas turn to actionAbility to dive into technical details, understand nuances and work with technology leaders on complex initiativesAbility to simplify and structure complex and ambiguous problemsConceptualize and provide thought leadership and strategic direction to product & data roadmapsAbility to handle diverse and conflicting opinions to arrive at the best decisions and outcomesExcellent presentation and written communication skills; experience presenting to and engaging with senior and executive level audiencesCollaborate and work effectively across functions. Influence and achieve consensus on goals and objectivesAbility to present complicated material in a concise and effective wayWe‚Äôd love to hear from you if you have‚Ä¶Bachelor's degree in Marketing or equivalent field10+ years of Digital Marketing experience with best in class organizations in consumer-focused industries (specialty-retail preferred), including strategic planning, implementation & executionDemonstrated experience in stewarding media investment and driving for a brand in the retail or DTC spaceStrong business management experience including full responsibility and accountability for managing a substantial budgetProven ability to leverage data to drive measurable results and track accountabilities to ensure desired outcomes and ROIMust be knowledgeable, savvy and strategic as to the effective deployment of all forms of media with significant experience leveraging analyticsDemonstrated knowledge of digital marketing methods, and a track record of testing and learning in this spaceExperience with Media Mix Modeling, brand health tracking, lift studies, and other pertinent methodologies for measuring and tracking impact of media
